loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, age 46, makes charcoal as a source of income. She usually earns about PHP 150 to 200 each day, but it depends on the charcoal that she produces.  She would like to make her source of income more profitable, so she is asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 to buy wood to produce charcoal. 

In the future, Rose would like to keep making the business profitable to provide a good living to her family.

loans.use: to buy wood to produce charcoal.

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru: Заявитель Айсулуу, 1967 года рождения, замужем, имеет троих детей, образование среднее. В ведении хозяйства и бизнеса помогают муж и сын. За время оформления документов заемщик показал себя с положительной стороны, как человек ответственный и предприимчивый, умеющий правильно вести хозяйство и вкладывать средства по назначению, среди соседей и знакомых имеет авторитет, характеризуется как человек отзывчивый и доброжелательный. Свой бизнес заемщица начинала в 1998 году, с накопленных 20,000 KGS. В настоящее время Айсулуу в своем активе имеет 1 корова, 3  голов овец и 2 лошади. Имеются все условия для содержания скота.  Свою деятельность осуществляет на основании своего многолетнего опыта, знает все тонкости в сфере животноводства и полеводства. Айсулуу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. За счет прибыли от проекта заемщик собирается осуществить свою давнюю мечту, приобрести Автомобиль.
texts.en:
This is the entrepreneur Aisuluu, who was born in 1967. She is married, has three children and a secondary education. Her husband and her son help her in managing her business. During the paperwork for getting a loan, this borrower showed herself from a positive side, as a responsible and enterprising person. She is able to run a business properly and invest for other purposes, she has authority among neighbors and friends, and is described as a sympathetic and friendly person. 

Aisuluu started her business in 1998, with savings of 20,000 som (KGS). Currently Aisuluu has one cow, three sheep and two horses. She has all conditions for breeding livestock in place. She undertakes her business on the basis of long experience, and knows all details in the area of livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. 

Aisuluu turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of livestock. Based on the income from the loan, she hopes to be able to realize her old dream of purchasing a car.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto de 47 años de edad, es un hombre lleno de sueños y metas por realizar, cuenta que desde que estudiaba en el colegio, aprendió sobre el oficio de la ebanistería gracias a la enseñanza impartida por un familiar. Cuando terminó su bachiller, Alberto optó por comenzar a laborar en este sector ya que por las condiciones económicas de su familia acceder a la educación superior era un imposible. Después de perfeccionar el oficio en los diferentes talleres en donde laboró, decidió independizarse y montar su propio taller, en donde elabora toda clase de muebles. Hoy lleva 29 años realizando la actividad y se siente agradecido porque gracias a su trabajo ha podido sostener a su familia y ofrecerle educación a sus dos hijos. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de materiales con el fin de mejorar su productividad e incrementar sus ventas para comenzar ahorrar y comprar una vivienda para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 47 years old. He is a man full of dreams and goals to reach. He says that after he studied in school, he learned about the craft of carpentry thanks to instruction given by a relative.

When he finished his degree, Alberto decided to start working in this sector since the financial condition of his family prohibited access to higher education. After perfecting his craft in the different workshops where he worked, he decided to become independent and open his own workshop, where he makes all kinds of furniture. He has been doing this activity for 29 years and feels grateful that thanks to his work he can support his family and offer education to his two children.

He is currently asking for a loan in order to buy supplies in order to improve his productivity and increase his sales in order to begin saving and buying a house in order to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood to use in his carpentry workshop

loans.name: Mable's Group

texts.en:
Mable's group is comprised of 7 hard-working women. Mable is 19 years old and lives in Kiyinda, Uganda. For the past 2 years, Mable has been working hard to manage her salon where she does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Mable has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hair products and extensions for the salon and will help Mable to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Mable hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Mable is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: To buy more hair products and extensions for her salon

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван женат. У него двое взрослых  детей.  Иван имеет свой бизнес.
Иван продает продукты питания на центральном рынке города. Опыт работы у него 16 лет, торговое место собственное. Иван заботится о том, чтобы был большой ассортимент, и продукты всегда были свежие. Иван трудолюбивый и ответственный, он обеспечивает свою семью.
Иван просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 13000 гривен на закупку товара. Дополнительную прибыль он хотел бы вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Ivan is married. He has two adult children. Ivan has his own business, he sells food products at the central market of the town. He has 16 years of experience in the work, and his own point of sales. Ivan cares about having a large assortment, and his products are always fresh. 

Ivan is hardworking and responsible, he supports his family. Ivan requests a loan in the amount of 13,000 hryvnia for the purchase of products. He would like to invest the additional income in developing his business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods with meat and fish, pasta, cereal etc.

loans.name: Usmon

texts.ru:
Усмон живет в районе Руми - южной части Таджикистана. Ему 29 лет. У него жена и трое маленьких детей. Усмон имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Он работает учителем в средней школе в течение трех лет. 
В местности, где живет Усмон имеются благоприятные условия для разведения скота. Поэтому Усмон хочет попробовать себя в сфере животновотсва. Он просит кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота. На полученный кредит Усмон намерен закупить коров и телят, будет откармливать их несколько месяцев и затем продавать на скотном рынке. За счет прибыли с новой деяетельности он планирует сделать ремонт в доме и улучшить условия проживания.
texts.en:
Usmon lives in the J.Rumy region in the southern part of Tajikistan. He is 29 years old. He has a wife and three small children. Usmon has higher pedagogical education. He has worked as a teacher in secondary school for a period of three years. 

In the countryside, where Usmon lives, the conditions are favorable for livestock breeding. Therefore Usmon would like to try the area of livestock breeding. He requests a loan for purchasing and reselling cattle. For the loan received, Usmon intends to purchase a cow and a bull, fatten them for some months and thereafter sell them at the livestock market. Based on the income from his new business he plans to repair his house and increase their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase and resell cattle

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA  est constitué de 5  femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et  4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur onzième prêt. Les dix précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait de la restauration, et de la vente de poissons à l’image de MAMOU  deuxième de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 70 kilos de poissons avec les pécheurs de la ville. Elle effectue ses ventes  à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group DANAYA comprises five women, all married, who average 26 years of age and four children each. The women live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers, and sons in the Heremakono Nord district of Bougouni City. 

The women know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to do better business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their 11th loan. The 10 previous ones were properly repaid. 

This group of women works in food service and sells fish, as is the case with MAMOU, who is second from the left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase 70 kg of fish from fisherfolk in town. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales to a customer base composed of essentially women at her house. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in her business and to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: Leonardo Fabio

texts.es:
Leonardo de 25 años de edad, reside en la vereda el Alto Grande en el municipio del Carmen de Viboral, Colombia. Labora en un cultivo de flores como operario agrícola, y en su tiempo libre se dedica a la agricultura, actividad heredada de su padre. 
En la actualidad tiene sembrados de maíz, fríjol y cilantro en un terreno de propiedad de su abuelo; la producción es comercializada en el centro de acopio y en la plaza de mercado del municipio.
Su mayor deseo es poder convertirse en un microempresario y dedicar todo el tiempo a sus cultivos, pero para ello necesita aumentar su capacidad de producción, generar  mayor ganancias y poder ser auto-sostenible. En búsqueda de materializar su sueño, Leonardo se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de semillas de papa, abonos y riego. Espera que con esta inversión pueda mejorar su capacidad de producción y venta.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 25 years old and lives in the district of Alto Grande in the municipality of Carmen de Viboral, Columbia. He works as a farm laborer cultivating flowers. In his free time he works his own crops, which he learned to do from his father. 

Leonardo currently has corn, beans and cilantro planted in a field that belongs to his grandfather. The crops are sold to the collection and distribution center and in the marketplace of the municipality.

Leonardo’s greatest dream is to become a microentrepreneur and to spend all his time working his own crops. To do this he has to increase the size of his harvests, generate higher profits and become self-sufficient. 

As a step toward realizing his dream, Leonardo is requesting this loan to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and water for irrigation. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to increase the size of his harvests and improve his sales.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and water for irrigation.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  SABALY  est constitué de 6  femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Heremakono Nord  de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur cinquième prêt. Les quarte précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d'habillements et de friperie  à l’image de  ROKIA  assise avec un papier a main. Elle   compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 colis de friperie avec les commerçants grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group SABALY comprises six women, all married, who average 45 years of age and four children each. The women live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers, and sons in the Heremakono Nord district of Bougouni City. The women know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. 

To bolster their financial capacity, so as to do better business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth loan. The four previous ones were properly repaid. 

This group of women does commerce in clothing and secondhand clothing, as is the case with ROKIA, who is seated and holding papers in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase 3 packets of secondhand clothing from wholesale merchants in Bamako. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales to a customer base composed of essentially women at the market and at her house. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in her business and to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Angel Daniel

texts.es:
ANGEL tiene 43 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo y la esposa en Chimbo de Provincia de Bolívar.

 ANGEL es Chofer en una Cooperativa de camionestas que dan servicio a los que habitan en la ciudad, además se dedica a atender en un bar en una escuela del centro. Solicita el crédito para comprar gelatinas, colas, papas, arroz, cafe, azúcar. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podra comprar lo que le hace falta en el bar. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda.

El sueño es poner una tienda variada en el domicilio. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es poder mejorar los productos. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Angel is 43 years old. He is married and he has a son. He lives with his wife and his son in Chimbo in the Province of Bolívar.

Angel is a driver in a trucking co-op that provide services to the people who live in the city. In addition, he works tending a snack bar in a school in the town center. He seeks this loan to buy jellos, sodas, potatoes, rice, coffee and sugar. 

WIth the help of this loan he will be able to buy things he is missing in the snack bar. He will make these purchases in the city of Guaranda. 

His dream is to build a variety store in his home. The challenges he has faced have improved the products he produces. In his free time he likes to go out with his family.

loans.use: to buy jellos, sodas, potatoes, rice, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 41 years old and married with five children.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Arlene has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming corn.

Arlene aspires to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en: Sheryl is 27 years old, married, and has one child. She owns and manages a small variety store in her community while her husband cultivates their farmland. She aims to improve her business and increase her income in order to help her husband in satisfying their needs. She plans to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' demands, but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more snack foods, canned goods, noodles, candies, beverages, seasonings, and soft drinks to sell. She hopes that her loan will be a great help in improving her business.

loans.use: To buy more snack foods, canned goods, noodles, candies, beverages, seasonings, and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 18 años de edad esa soltero vive con los padresen casa de ellos en Chimvo Provincia de Bolivar no tiene hijos.

Oscar se dedica a manejar un taxi en el que sale todos los dias de 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche de lunes a sabado. El credito lo solicita para la compra de articulos para el hogar como alimentos de consumo de primera necesidad y electrodomesticos como: una refrigeradora. El credito le ayudado a adquirir estos productos de contado para que le cobren un poco menos.

El sueño de Oscar es trabajar muy duro para poder tener dinero para ayudar a los padres y a un hermano menor que esta en el clegio. en los tiempos libres le gusta reunirse con los amigos y conversar chistes.
texts.en: Oscar is 18 years old, single with no children, and lives together with his parents in their house in Chimbo Provincia de Bolivar. He works as a taxi driver, going out every day from 8:00 in the morning to 7:00 at night from Monday to Saturday. The loan he's seeking will be used to buy certain household items including basic foods and appliances such as a television, a refrigerator, and a washing machine. The loan will help him buy these items cash down, making them a little less expensive. Oscar's dream is to work very hard to make money to help his parents and a younger brother still in school. In his free time he likes to hang out with friends and share jokes.

loans.use: to buy certain household items including basic foods and appliances such as a television and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Dúo Las Promesas  De Dios Group

texts.es: Dúo las Promesas de Dios, este dúo esta integrado por la señora Jacinta de 53 años de edad, ella se dedica al cultivo de verduras tiene 14 años de dedicarse a esta actividad ya que es asi la unica forma como ella puede ayudar con los gastos de su familia, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de semillas y abono para seguir cultivando y asi seguir luchando por salir adelante.
texts.en: The duo "Promesas de Dios" has two members and Jacinta is one of them. She is 53 years old and who has grown vegetables for 14 years and it is the only way she has to help with her family expenses. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her crops and to be able to continue fighting for a better tomorrow.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Naba Dite Ramata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1989 à OUELESSEBOUGOU, NABA vit avec ses 2 enfants et son époux dans une  famille monogame dans le quartier N’tentou de la ville de Ouelessebougou. 
NABA na pas eut la chance d aller à l école,  très vite s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente de l’encens et des pagnes  bazin.  Après avoir correctement remboursé le prêt précédent, NABA est à son deuxième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 50 kilos  d’encens (naturel c'est-à-dire non préparé) et 20 pièces de bazin auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché Ouelessebougou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
NABA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1989 in OUELESSEBOUGOU, NABA lives with her two children and husband in a monogamous family in the N’tentou district of Ouelessebougou City.  

NABA did not have the chance to go to school. Early on, she became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying and selling of incense and damask cloth. After having properly repaid the previous loan, NABA is on her second loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The loan will be used to purchase 50 kg of incense (natural, that is, unprepared) and 20 lengths of damask from wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she sells  to a customer base composed of men and women at the Ouelessebougou market and at her house. 

NABA hopes to make an average monthly profit  of 75,000 francs CFA that will be used for helping her husband to meet family needs, paying back the loan, and reinvesting in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods, such as cloth and incense to sell

loans.name: Juan Fidel

texts.es:
El Señor Juan Fidel es casado, tiene 42 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunudad de estudiar, tiene 5 hijos y 4 de ellos estan estudiando, él se dedica a la sastrería y albañilería, inició este negocio como ayudante de sastreria; hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia, el cuenta también con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a la tejeduria.

Solicita un prestamo que le servira para cubrir gastos personales que necesita realizar, especificamente para comprar eletrodomesticos, va a comprar una estufa y un cilindro de gas para su cocina, espera con esto mejorar la condicion de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Fidel, 42, is married and has five children, four of which are currently studying.  He was unable to further his education and works as a tailor and mason.  He began his business as a tailor's assistant and now has 7 years' experience.  He also has the support of his wife, who works as a weaver.  

He is requesting a loan to cover personal expenses, specifically to buy household appliances.  He is going to buy a stove and gas canister for his kitchen.  He hopes to improve his family's living conditions with the loan.

loans.use: to buy household appliances such as a stove and gas canister for his kitchen

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
La Sra. María vive en Guayaquil, tiene 52 años. Siempre ha trabajado para mantener a sus hijos, cocina en casa y vende en un local ubicado en la avenida principal.

Lo que le dificulta son las competencias  y que no tiene vehículo para trasladar la comida lo cual se le hace un poco difícil en hacerlo. No está casada, es soltera pero tiene hijos y todos son mayores de edad.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar granos, vegetales, frutas, verduras para hacer sus comida y tener mas ventas. EL sueño que quiere realizar es poder alquilar un local más amplio para poder atender mejor a los clientes ya que es muy pequeño, mejorar la construcción de  su casa.
texts.en:
María, 52, lives in Guayaquil.  She's always worked to support her children.  She cooks at home and sells in a stand located on the main street.  Her difficulty is competition because she does not own a vehicle to transport the food which makes it a bit difficult to do.  She’s not married; she’s single but has children who are all adults now.

She wants to use the loan to buy grains, vegetables and fruit to make the food and increase sales.  Her dream is to be able to rent a more spacious locale to provide better customer service since the one she has is very small; she also wants to make home improvements.

loans.use: to buy grains, vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El Cliente vive en Guayaquil, el empezó con su negocio hace 10 años después de haber sufrido un accidente laboral en lo cual sufrió la pérdida de su vista, pero él siguió adelante con su discapacidad  y ahora tiene su negocio.

EL Sr. Realiza su trabajo con la ayuda de su esposa ellos empiezan su labor desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde.

Si se encuentra casado, su esposa también es comerciante (es la que esta en la foto con el), tienen 3 hijos 2 de los cuales estudian en escuela particular y uno esta becado por ser un  excelente estudiante.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar microondas, cocinas, licuadoras. Sus sueños es de poder tener un negocio en un lugar fijo y así poderle dar mejor vida a sus hijos aunque tienen la esperanza del estudio de sus hijos en el cual van a salir adelante.
texts.en:
This borrower is from Guayaquil.  He started his business 10 years ago after he suffered an accident at work that left him blind.  Despite this disability, he continued to forge ahead and now he has his own business.  

The borrower works with the help of his wife.  Their work schedule is from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M.  He is married and his wife is also a merchant.  (his wife is pictured in the photo) They have three children, but two of them are studying at a private school.  One is on scholarship for being an excellent student.  

With this loan, the borrower will buy microwave ovens, hot plates, and blenders.  His dreams include having a business at an established location.  As a result, he will be able to provide a better life for his children in hopes that they will attain the education they need to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy microwave ovens, hot plates, and blenders.

loans.name: Deysi Gardenia

texts.es:
La Sra. Deysi vive en Guayaquil. Empezó a trabajar ayudando a una amiga a vender productos de Yambal luego se inscribió con su propio código de vendedora, escogió esta actividad porque le es rentable, con el esfuerzo a logrado ser directora de Yambal. Ella realiza su trabajo de  desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 18:00 de la tarde.

No le dificulta nada hasta ahora y tampoco lo quisiera en un futuro No está casada, es soltera pero tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian en escuela fiscal. 

Con el prestamo quiere para las matriculas de sus hijos. EL sueño que espera en un futuro es poder  tener en un futuro medio de transporte lo cual le haría más fácil su trabajo.
texts.en:
Deysi lives in Guayaquil.  She started to work by helping a friend sell Yambal products.  Then she registered with her own selling certificate.  She chose this business activity because it is profitable for her.  With effort, she has managed to become a Yambal director.

She works from 7:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has had no problems so far, and she would not like to have any in the future.  She is not married.  She is single, but she has three minor children who attend public school.

She wants to use the loan to pay her children’s school fees.

Her dream for the future is to be able to have a means of transportation.  This would make her work easier.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Piedad Amira

texts.es:
La Sra. Piedad vive en Guayaquil, tiene 51 años. Trabaja en su casa para así poder cuidar a sus hijos, atiende el local y atiende a sus niños.

Lo que le dificulta son las competencias  y que no tiene le da el tiempo para así tener más ventas lo cual se le hace un poco difícil en hacerlo. No está casada, es soltera pero tiene 2 hijos mores de edad. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar sabanas, ropa, zapatos. EL sueño que quiere realizar en un futuro es poder poner un bazar en su casa para seguir cuidando a sus hijos y con eso poder seguir construyendo su casa lo cual le faltaría lo que es dos departamento lo  que le serviría de alquiler.
texts.en:
Piedad, age 51, lives in Guayaquil.  She works at her house in order to be able to take care of her children.  She tends to her place of business and she tends to her children.

The difficulty she has is the competition and not having the time for more sales.  This makes it a little difficult.  She is not married.  She is single, but she does have two minor children.

She wants to use the loan to buy sheets, clothes, and shoes.  Her dream for the future is to be able to set up a store at her house.  She wants to do this in order to continue taking care of her children.  By doing this she will be able to continue building her house.  The house needs two apartments, which she will rent.

loans.use: to buy sheets, clothes, and school shoes.

loans.name: Mercy Germania

texts.es:
Germania tiene 37 años de edad su estado civil soltera vive con su familia vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC  Solidaria, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Gabriel, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Germania  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida. 

Con la ayuda del cerdito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza en Ventanas.  El sueño es comprarse un terreno. Los desafíos que enfrentan son las plagas y cultivos. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Germania is 37 years old. She is single and lives with her family in the city of Ventanas in Los Rios Province.

Solidaria Communal Bank is located in the rural community of San Gabriel in Ventanas canton where the inhabitants engage in farming and animal husbandry.

Germania farms corn and rice. She is requesting a loan to buy urea, liquid weed killer and insecticide.

With the help of this loan she will be able to buy the agricultural supplies she needs. She makes her purchases in Ventanas. Her dream is to buy land. The challenges she faces include pest infestations in her crops. In her free time she enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquid weed killer and insecticide.

loans.name: Aliceminda

texts.en:
Aliceminda is 57 years old and married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Aliceminda sells coconut wine in the Philippines. Aliceminda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more coconut wine to sell to customers.

Aliceminda has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Aliceminda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more coconut wine to sell to customers

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en: Nabil is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children, who are in school. He is the main income source for his family. In 2004, he decided to get involved in the car-trading industry. Due to his talented negotiation skills and friendly personality, he was able to succeed in this occupation. But his financials are hardly helping him covering the high costs of living; that’s why he got his wife’s support in order to bring added income into their life. Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., to purchase some required equipment for his business. His purpose is to improve his cars and secure their transportation features. Nabil is very optimistic and willing to open his own showroom in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase some required equipment for his business

loans.name: Rubylyn

texts.en:
Rubylyn, 43, is married and resides at Sta. Ana. She has been making and selling charcoal for more than five years, earning approximately PHP 200 per day.  In order to improve her income, Rubylyn is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use the loan to purchase hard woods, from which she will make additional charcoal to sell. By doing so, she will be able to generate extra income to support her family.

She would like to expand her business in the future, and help her children in their education.

loans.use: to purchase hard woods, from which she will make additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina es una mujer de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposo y sus 5 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Marcelina no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Seco de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Marcelina trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de útiles escolares y de escritorio, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Marcelina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado central de su ciudad, de esta manera Marcelina podrá seguir trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio y tener una gran librería.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 48, lives in the city of Pisco with her husband and her five children, whom she loves and who are her main motivation in life.  She's a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic woman.  She and her husband devote all their effort to getting their family ahead.  Unfortunately, because she didn't have the money and she had to work from a very young age, Marcelina wasn't able to study business administration, but she would like to have been able to do so.  In her free time she likes to cook a delicious chicken stew to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Marcelina works in her small business selling school and office supplies.  She works every day for approximately 10 hours.  She believes it's going well for her because of the variety of products and her good customer service.

Marcelina's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy a small sales stall in the main market of her city.

This way Marcelina will be able to continue working and making the effort to achieve her big dream of expanding her business and having a great bookstore.

loans.use: to buy a sales stall

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La cliente vive en Guayaquil, tiene 33 años .Empezó su negocio hace 10 años, lo escogió por consejo de unos primos que tienen un negocio similar.

Ella lo realiza con la ayuda de su hermano desde las 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 7:00 de la noche, la dificultad es la que presenta su negocio.

La cliente es soltera, porque tiene que cuidar de la mama que no le permite movilizarse y requiere de la ayuda de la hija para poder lograrlo, tampoco tiene hijos.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar mercaderia como correas, cuadernos, agendas. El sueño que quiere realizar es de rentar otra sucursal de su negocio y tener su casa propia para vivir mejor sin preocupaciones.
texts.en:
This client lives in Guayaquil and is 33 years old.  She started her business 10 years ago and chose this line of work because of the advice she received from some of her cousins who have a similar business.  

Her brother helps her as she works from 9:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. since she must deal with difficulties that are facing her business.  The borrower is single, but she must also devote time to caring for her mother who is not able move around and requires assistance.  Because of this, she does not have any children.  

With this loan, the borrower will buy merchandise such as belts, notebooks, and journals.  Her dreams include renting another location for her business and having a house of her own so that she can live without any worries.

loans.use: to buy belts, notebooks, and journals.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is 45 years old and a married woman, running a business of milk sales with the support of her husband. They have six years of experience in the field. They have two buffaloes in milk, and they sell the milk to many of their neighbors. Parveen looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from the animals, while her husband sells the milk to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing this together, to support their family.

Parveen has four children, and they need to earn much more to meet the everyday expenditures of their family, including food, clothing, and education. In order to make more profit, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase one more buffalo. After the loan they will get more milk and be able to cater to more customers. She hopes to have an increase in their production capacity, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: To purchase one more buffalo to sell milk.

loans.name: Floridalma

texts.es: Floridalma, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 7 hijos y vive con tres de ellos en una aldea que pertenece a la Entrada, Copan. Anteriormente ella vendía medicinas naturales, pero hace tres años decidió por establecer una pulpería para vender productos alimenticios como arroz, azúcar, huevos, pan, sal, manteca, refrescos, churros, harina, pastas y verduras. Ha solicitado  un préstamo de 12,000 lempiras para surtir el negocio de productos alimenticios y ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. Su meta es lograr tener un negocio grande para sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en: 42 year old Floridalma is a single mother of 7 children and lives with three of them in a village that is part of Entrada, in the Copan area. Previously, she sold natural medicines. But, 3 years ago, she decided to open a grocery store to sell foods such as rice, sugar, eggs, bread, salt, butter, sodas, churros, flour, pasta, and vegetables. She has requested a loan of $625 to supply her store with food products and to offer her customers some variety. Her goal is to have a big store to support her children.

loans.use: to supply her store with products such as rice, sugar, sodas, butter, meat, churros, vegetables and other groceries.

loans.name: Michel Emmanuel

texts.fr: michel est un camerounais de 52 ans, célibataire et père d'enfants. Il possède et gère un mini magasin de vente de bois dans un quartier de la ville depuis 3 ans. il sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et de matières premières en achetant du bois et des planches à bois.les bénéfices générés seront injecté dans son activité pour l'expansion d'une part et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Michel is a 52-year-old man from Cameroon.  He is single and the father of some children.  He owns and runs a small shop in one of his city's neighborhoods, and he has been selling timber for three years.  He is requesting this loan to strengthen his stock of merchandise and raw materials through the purchase of wood and wood boards.

Michel will reinvest his profits in his activity in order to expand it.  He will also use them to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (wood and wood boards)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil, tiene 56 años de edad. El empezó su negocio desde hace mucho tiempo con el hermano que le enseño esta actividad y el poco a poco fue aprendiendo hasta lograr obtener su propio negocio de instalador de cerámica. 

Esta labor la realiza junto a su hijo todos los días desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 4:00 de la tarde, la esposa trabaja en la venta de cosméticos pero el trabajo que realizan los dos no genera mucho dinero para la educación de sus hijos y en los gastos del hogar. 

Sus dos hijos estudian en una escuela fiscal y los fines de semana cuando no van a la escuela ellos les ayudan a su papa en su trabajo juntos hacen esta labor para salir adelante.

Con el préstamo quiere poder comprar más herramientas para su negocio como martillos, reglas, ceramica y así pode tener mas trabajo y mejorar su vivienda. Para así darle un mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
This client lives in Guayaquil and is 56 years of age.  He started his business a long time ago with his brother, who taught him this line of work.  After he gradually learned the trade, he was able to obtain his own business of installing ceramic tiles.  

He and his son work together every day from 8:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M.  His wife sells cosmetics, but she only works two days and does not earn much money for their children’s education and the household expenses.  Their two children attend a state school.  On the weekends when school is not in session, they help their father with his work so that they can all get ahead.  

With this loan, he will buy more tools for his business such as hammers, rulers, and ceramic tiles.  This will help him to obtain more work and also make improvements to his home.  As a result, he can improve his family’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy hammers, rulers, and ceramic tiles.

loans.name: Rutter

texts.en: Rutter is 41 years old, married, and has four children. His spouse is a housekeeper. Rutter patiently provides motorcycle transport services to the people in his village. He is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to maintain his motorcycle, such as by purchasing new tires. He would like to ensure safe travel for his passengers. With good profits, Rutter will be able to pay his children's school expenses and save for their future needs.

loans.use: to maintain his motorcycle, such as by purchasing new tires

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 47 years old, married, and has four children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Anecita has a business of selling dried fish in the Philippines. Anecita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell in her stall.

Anecita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Anecita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 45 años, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos de 23, 19 y 17 años , con quienes vive en una casa propia construida a base de material rústico ubicada en un anexo rural.Alicia se dedica a la agricultura por está razón cuenta con terrenos agrícolas donde siembra arvejas, maíz y flores. Mientras cosecha uno, va cultivando otros, de esa manera tiene ingresos asegurados en distintas fechas del año. “Me conviene sembrar arvejas y flores, porque se cosecha rápido y los precios son buenos”, comenta. Además, en la tranquilidad de su hogar se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes. Cada ejemplar lo negocia entre 20 a 25 soles, dependiendo del tamaño. Gracias a esta actividad tambien obtiene ingresos que solventan las necesidades de sus hijos, ya que se encuentran estudiando. Alicia dedicará sus esfuerzos a la siembra de arvejas y maíz, por ello requiere de su apoyo ya que usará los S/2000 soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en: 45 year old Alicia is a single mother and has 3 children who are 23, 19, and 17 years old. She lives with them in her own house which is made of rustic material and located in a rural area. Alicia works in agriculture and so she has agricultural land where she grows peas, corn, and flowers. While she is harvesting one crop, she is growing the others, and in this way she has reliable income at different times of the year. "It works well for me to grow peas and flowers as they are quick to harvest and bring a good price", she comments. What's more, in the tranquility of her home she raises small animals such as guinea pigs. She sells each one for between 8 and 10 dollars, depending on their size. Thanks to this activity she also has income that covers her children's needs as they are studying. Alicia will concentrate her effort on growing peas and corn, and for this she needs support so she will use the $775 to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

Josefina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further improve her tailoring business. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional supplies for her tailoring.

NWTF is presenting Josefina's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her tailoring.

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in the fishing business for 10 years.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing business, like a fishing net, some plywood, a light, and some bamboo.

Rechel would like to save enough money in the future, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in her fishing business, like a fishing net, some plywood, a light, and some bamboo.

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
MARIA FRANCISCA
DOÑA FRANCISCA ES SOCIA YA CONOCIDA EN LA FUNDACION ES EL SEGUNDO CRDITO KIVA QUE TRAMITA, YA HA TRABAJADO EN Y HA SIDO MUY PUNTUAL EN SUS PAGOS, DOÑA FRANSISCA DESDE HACE YA MAS DE 20 AÑOS SE HA DEDICADO A LA COMPRA-VENTA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES (GRANOS BASICOS) Y TEJIDOS TIPICOS. EL PROPOSITO DE DOÑA FRANCISCA ES SURTIR MAS SU NEGOCIO. AGRADECE A KIVA Y FAPE  LA OPORTUNIDAD  QUE  LE  HAN DADO DE DE PODER SUPERAR PARA AYUDAR A SU FAMILIA A SEGUIR ADELANTE. ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES(GRANOS BASICOS)Y PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA Y ASI SEGUIR CON SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Doña Francisca is already known to FAPE. This is the second KIVA loan processed for her and she has already worked and been very punctual in her payments. For more than 20 years she has been buying and selling groceries (basic grains) and traditional woven goods. Doña Francisca’s purpose is to re-stock her business.  She is grateful to KIVA and FAPE for the opportunity they have given her to excel in order to help her family get ahead. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase groceries (basic grains) and other staples so that she can continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and other staples.

loans.name: Behije

texts.en:
Behije is a widow. She is a mother of two children, ages 10 and 3 years old. One of them goes to school. Her husband has died and she lives with her sister and brother and her two children.  

Her brother works in construction. His job is the family’s main source of income. He doesn't earn enough to support the needs of his family. Recently, they had a problem with the electricity installation and water. The money he generates is not enough to support the family's needs.  

Behije now is requesting a loan to do the new installation of water and electricity in her house. The loan will help them to live in a comfortable environment. Her goal is to make a new installation for the house, and offer a better, secure life for her family.

She is very grateful to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to install water and electricity in her house.

loans.name: Genaly

texts.en:
Genaly is 40 years old and married with four children. Genaly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items such as bread, biscuits, shampoo, sugar and other groceries.

Genaly has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eleven years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Genaly aspires to save enough to have a meat stand at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more items such as bread, biscuits, shampoo, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Jose Bertilio

texts.es: Don José, tiene 60 años, es casado, tiene una hija y vive en el municipio de las Vegas, Santa Bárbara. Lleva aproximadamente 30 años de dedicarse a la agricultura donde cultiva café y banano dicha producción se vende en la comunidad. Ha solicitado tres préstamos con el actual para asistencia a sus cultivos. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 lempiras y los invertirá en fertilizantes y limpieza de los cultivos para lograr una mejor cosecha. Su meta es ampliar los cultivos en otro terreno que tiene.
texts.en: Don José is 60 years old, married, and has one daughter and lives in the municipality of Las Vegas, Santa Bárbara. He has been working in agriculture for about 30 years and he grows coffee and bananas which he sells in the community. He has had 3 loans for assistance with his crops. The loan that he is requesting is for $775 and he will use if for fertilizers and for clearing the land so he can get a better harvest. His goal is to increase his crops by farming other land that he has.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and and pay for clearing land for his coffee and banana crops.

loans.name: Nelly Esther

texts.es: Nelly tiene 50 años  tiene una miscelánea y ofrece servicios de fotocopiaje e internet en el municipio de Soledad donde habita con su cónyuge y tienen 3 hijos en las edades de 17 a 32 años. Su experiencia la obtuvo hacia el año 1993 en el negocio que fuere de su madre  y solo hasta el año 2011, cuando su madre  se lo entregó, lo trasladó a su domicilio  e inició con mayor autonomía  su generación de  ingresos. Poco a poco con su ahorros logró adecuarlo, compró vitrinas y agregó  artículos varios y construyó una clientela. Hoy  tienen una miscelánea y ofrece servicios de fotocopiaje, vende detalles para fiestas ofrece servicios de llamadas útiles escolares galletería dulcería etc. Su  crecimiento es superior a sus posibilidades de responder a la demanda del mercado y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva,   primer financiamiento que hace a la  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará   refrescos y mecatos para surtir su vitrina de alimentos. Su meta personal es apoyar a sus hijos para que se conviertan en profesionales exitosos y tengan mayores opciones de bienestar.
texts.en:
Nelly, 50, has a shop and offers photocopying services and Internet in the town of Soledad where she lives with her spouse.  They have three children between the ages of 17 and 32.

She got her experience around 1993 in her mother's business.  It was only in 2011, when her mother gave it to her, that she moved it to her home and started to generate income with greater autonomy.  Little by little she managed to adapt it with her savings.  She bought display cases, added various articles, and built her clientele.  Today she has a shop and offers photocopying and telephone services and sells party gifts, school supplies, cookies, sweets, etc.

Her growth is superior to her possibilities of responding to market demand, which is exactly why she's requesting a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She's going to buy soft drinks and pastries to stock her food display case.

Her personal goal is to support her children so they become successful professionals and have better options for their well-being.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned gods, etc. for her general store business.

Candida has been in this business for 11 years. Candida earns more income from buying and selling pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and buy and sell pigs.

Candida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, canned gods, etc.

loans.name: Adan De Jesus

texts.es: Adán de Jesús de 48 años, casado, padre de 5 hijos, es originario de un municipio de Chinandega ubicado al  sureste   del departamento, él es dueño y chófer de una unidad de transporte que cubre la ruta del municipio hacia una comarca del mismo, él tiene de trabajar con su unidad 12 años, ya que él es el padre de familia y encargado de velar y llevar el alimento a su familia, dos de sus hijos estudian en la escuela primaria y uno estudia en la universidad. Adán solicita el crédito para arreglar su vehículo con el que él trabaja (arreglar el motor,  cambio de piso del vehículo, pintura, tapizado de los asientos).
texts.en:
Adán de Jesús, 48, has five children. He is originally from the municipality of Chinandega, southeastern region of the department. Adán owns and drives a 12-years-old vehicle that covers a route that goes from the municipality to a nearby locality. 

Adán is responsible for protecting and supporting his family. Two of his children go to primary school and one goes to the university. 

Adán is requesting a loan to repair his vehicle: fix the engine, change the floor, paint it and put new covers on the seats.

loans.use: arreglar el motor,  cambio de piso del vehículo, pintura, tapizado de los asientos

loans.name: G.s El Trapiche #1 Group

texts.es:
El señor Francisco tiene 57 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con el viven sus hijos y su esposa quien la apoya en su actividad comercial. Su negocio es producción y venta de granos,  trabajo que realiza desde hace 30 años en la comunidad donde vive.
Don Francisco su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez de personas es en grandes cantidades, porque está en el centro de su comunidad y esto hace que tenga mucha demanda.
Don Francisco sus planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio y darle una mejor educación a sus hijos para que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida. 
Don Francisco  al igual que sus compañeros grupo el crédito lo necesitan para la compra de una planta solar debido a que en su comunidad no cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica y esto les ayudaría a mejorar un poco  su condición de vida y las de sus familias, están contentos porque con la obtención de la planta solar podrán realizar muchas más actividades y a la ves están contribuyendo a cuidar más el medio ambiente. 
Doña Cristina   producción y venta  de granos 
Don Jelson   producción y venta de granos 
Doña Blanca    producción y venta de granos 
Don  Allan   producción y venta de granos 



Choluteca- Honduras- Febrero del 2013.
texts.en:
Francisco is 57 years old. He lives in the south of Honduras with his children and his wife who supports their commercial activity. His business is the production and sale of grains. He has been doing this work for 30 years in the community where he lives. Francisco’s business is located at a strategic point, where many people pass by, and because it is in the center of the community it is in high demand. Francisco’s plans for the future is to continue growing his business and to give a better education to his children in order for them to have better life opportunities.

Francisco and the other members of the group need a loan in order to buy a solar panel because his community does not have electrical service and this would help them improve their living conditions a little more and that of their families. They are happy because by obtaining the solar panel they can do many more activities while they are contributing towards caring for the environment.

Cristina is in production and sale of grains.
Jelson is in production and sale of grains.
Blanca is in production and sale of grains.
Allan is in is in production and sale of grains.

Choluteca - Honduras - February, 2013

loans.use: to buy a solar panel for his home

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 51 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marissa is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Marissa has been raising pigs for thirty years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 32 years old, married and was gifted with three children. She and her husband aim for a happy and successful life in order to give their children a better living. 

In this regard, Rowena engages in buying and selling charcoal, while her husband manages their farmland. 

Rowena aimed to acquire more stock of charcoal to sell, but she has inadequate capital. In this regard, she is asking for an additional loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more stock of charcoal to sell. 

She is hoping that someday she will improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is a 58-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children. The eldest is nine years old, and the youngest is three years old. She engages in a ukay-ukay or ready-to-wear clothes business. She has been in this business for 13 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Aquilina is requesting a loan to buy ready-to-wear (RTW) clothes. She will buy and sell these clothes in her local area. By the help of this loan, she will buy clothes and sell them in her area to supply the needs of her family.

In the future, Aquilina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ready-to-wear (RTW) clothes to sell

loans.name: Juan Inocente

texts.es:
Don Juan es un microempresario que se dedica al arte de elaborar muebles de madera como camas, roperos, sillas mecedoras,  tiene once años de dedicarse a este oficio.

Antes de tener su propio negocio era obrero de la construcción en donde aprende a construir casas y realizar trabajos de carpintería, gracias a su habilidad en trabajos manuales decide comprar herramientas para poner su propio negocio personal en donde actualmente tiene clientes que atiende de manera personal.

Su negocio ha crecido, sin embargo necesita de un financiamiento para capital de trabajo para atender la demanda de muebles, en especial las camas de madera.

Es una persona emprendedor y con un alto potencial de crecimiento como microempresario.
texts.en:
Juan is a microbusiness owner who crafts wooden furniture such as beds, closets, and rocking chairs. He has had this job for 11 years. 

Before having his own business he was a construction worker where he learned to build houses and do carpentry work. Thanks to his ability in handicrafts he decided to buy tools to start his own business where he currently has customers whom he personally attends.

His business has grown, but nonetheless requires financing for working capital to address the demand for furniture, especially for beds made of wood. 

He is an enterprising person with high potential for growth as a microbusiness owner.

loans.use: to buy laurel and Guanacaste wood

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a 44-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For sixteen years, he has been teaching, and with his savings he has been able to build rental houses where he earns extra income.

Ezekiel was inspired into service by his desire to nurture young people. A good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university, while his business plan is to own a housing estate.

Ezekiel intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Phao

texts.en:
Phao would like to take a further loan to buy materials to increase his production of metal products. His previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. 

Phao hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase sales. He also hopes that through the loan, he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to increase his production of metal products.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 3 hijos y vive con ellos y su madre en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida.  Hace dos años ella estableció su  propio negocio de venta de medicamentos, y productos por catalogo como cremas, lociones y cosméticos. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para comprar más medicamentos como vitaminas, pastillas, sueros, antibióticos, inyecciones etc. Para surtir su negocio y poder atender mejor a sus clientes. Tiene como meta darles la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Maritza is 38 years old. She is a widow with three children. She lives with them and her mother in Arizona municipality, Atlántida. Two years ago, she started her own business selling medicines and catalogue products like creams, lotions, and cosmetics. She has always worked in business. She has asked for a loan of 15,000 lempiras to buy more medicines like vitamins, pills, serums, antibiotics, injections, etc. to stock her business and to be able to attend to her customers better. Her goal is to provide her children with an education.

loans.use: to buy medicines like pills, injections, vitamins, antibiotics, serums, etc. to stock her business.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor tiene 40 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Ésta familia habita un hogar propio construido a base de adobe y material noble el cual se encuentra ubicado en un anexo rural.Leonor tiene una apariencia seria, pero es carismática y dulce con su familia. Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde su juventud. Ahora, ella y su esposo cuentan con terrenos que compraron gracias a los años de trabajo constante, ahí siembran maíz, arvejas, papas, alfalfa, flores y otras verduras. “El maíz de la zona es bien grande y jugoso, por eso hay compradores que prefieren llevarse mi cosecha”, menciona orgullosa de sus logros.
Tiene pendiente sembrar un poco de arvejas y maíz pero dentro de dos meses se inician las lluvias y deberá realizar mayor esfuerzo. Mientras tanto, mantiene a su familia con la venta de los cuyes que cría.Éste es su préstamo número 7 con Kiva y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su actividad agrícola. Leonor iniciará una siembra de arvejas por ello invertirá 2000 soles en la compra de semillas.
texts.en: Leonor, 40, is married and has two children. The family lives in their own home, built out of adobe and more solid materials. It is located in a rural area. Leonor looks serious, but she is charismatic and sweet with her family. She has worked in agriculture since she was young. Now she and her husband have land that they bought thanks to years of constant work. They plant corn, peas, potatoes, alfalfa, flowers, and other vegetables. "The corn from the area is very big and juicy. This is why there are buyers who prefer my harvest," she says, proud of her achievements. She still has to sow some corn and peas, but the rains will start within two months and she needs to work harder. She also supports her family by selling the guinea pigs that she raises. This is her seventh Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the financial help that she receives to continue her agricultural work. Leonor will start planting peas, which is why she will use 2,000 soles to purchase seeds.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds.

loans.name: Dúo Unidas Para Triunfar Group

texts.es: Dúo Unidas para triunfar. este grupo esta conformado por la señora Marleny de 21 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de consumo diario ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 4 años y gracias a Dios y a la ayuda que a resibido de ustedes ella se a superado un poco mas es por esa razon que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la venta ya que sus clientes han aumentado y necesita mas capital para trabajar ella espera que le sigan ayudando para que ella se pueda superar un poco mas.
texts.en: Dúo Unidas para Triunfar (Pair United to Triumph). This group includes Marleny, 21. She works selling edible goods for daily consumption. She has been doing this work for four years and thanks to God and to all of you, she has advanced a little bit. This is why she is applying for this loan to buy food to sell, since she has more customers and she needs more money to work. She hopes that everyone continues to help her so that she can advance more.

loans.use: to buy food to sell.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 62 years old and widowed. She has eight children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for ten years, and she earns additional income from selling fruits and vegetables.

Emerita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dúo Gracias A Dios Group

texts.es:
DUO GRACIAS A DIOS
Este grupo está formado por doña María Eusebia, de 45 años de edad es casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil, en la capital, tiene 3 hijos, que viven con ella todavía, ella solicita la ayuda de fape para su negocio que es la venta de ropa típica nueva desde hace 17 años, ella tiene una su máquina con la cual trabaja haciendo costuras y compra telas para hacer delantales y blusitas que luego sale a vender, por eso solicita el crédito porque para la semana santa tiene muchos encargos y nececita comprar mas materia prima para la elaboracion de blusas para la venta su capital no es suficiente, ella necesita un poco mas de dinero para surtir y tener a la venta diferentes estilos de ropa para vender,
texts.en:
Doña Maria Eusebia is one of the members of the Duo Gracias a Dios group. She is 45 years old and married. Her husband is a construction worker in the capital. She has three children who still live with her. 

She is requesting help from FAPE for her business. She has been making and selling original traditional clothing for 17 years. She has a sewing machine  which she uses to make the clothing. She buys fabrics in order to make aprons and blouses that she then goes out to sell. Consequently she is requesting a loan because she has many orders for Easter week and needs to purchase more raw materials in order to make blouses to sell. Her own capital is insufficient and she needs a little more money in order to stock up and have different clothing styles ready to sell.

loans.use: to purchase raw material to make traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto, tiene 29 años de edad, es casado, vive en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida junto a su suegra y esposa. Hace 8 años que estableció su propio negocio de pulpería y compra y venta de leche de vaca. Vende productos de la canasta básica familiar, como arroz, frijoles, carnes, lácteos, refrescos, también achinería, ropa y calzado. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para la compra de cilindros de gas de cocina, para darles un mejor servicio a los clientes. Su sueño es tener siempre estabilidad familiar.
texts.en: Jorge Alberto, 29, is married and lives in Arizona municipality in Atlántida with his wife and mother-in-law. Eight years ago, he started his own business selling groceries and buying and selling cow's milk. He sells basic goods like rice, beans, meats, dairy products, and soft drinks. He also sells low-cost goods, clothing, and footwear. He is asking for a 15,000 lempira loan to buy cylinders of cooking gas, to provide better service to his customers. His dream is to have family stability.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith de 29 años , es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 6 años al que cuida con esmero , actualmente vive en una casa propia construida a base de material rústico y se ubica en un anexo rural.
Edith se dedica a la agricultura desde que se separó del padre de su hijo ,ya que cuenta con terrenos propios que heredó de sus padres, en ellos produce maíz, arvejas, papas , entre otros. 
“La ventaja de sembrar varios productos es que se obtiene ingresos varias veces al año”, menciona.
El trabajo en el campo es cansando, por ello recurre al apoyo de trabajadores del lugar a quienes les paga por día , de esa manera optimiza su trabajo. Sus metas se enfocan al progreso y bienestar de su hijo.En esta oportunidad Edith necesita S/. 1000 soles para la compra de 2 bolsas de semillas de arvejas .Éste es el cuarto crédito con Kiva y se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su actividad agrícola.
texts.en: Edith, 29, is a single mother. She has a 6-year-old son whom she painstakingly cares for. Currently she lives in her own house, built from rustic materials, located in a rural area. Edith has worked in agriculture since she separated from the father of her son. Now that she has land that she inherited from her parents, she grows corn, peas, and potatoes, among other crops. "The advantage of growing various products is that you earn income several times a year," she says. Working in the fields is tiring, which is why she hires laborers from the area whom she pays daily. This way, she optimizes her work. Her goals are centered on the progress and well-being of her son. Edith needs 1,000 soles to buy two bags of pea seeds. This is her fourth Kiva loan and she is very grateful to the financial support that she receives to continue her agricultural work.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a 66-year-old married man who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been in the cocoa business for some time, and also gets a pension from government. With the money he earns, he has been able to buy land to expand his farming activities. Like most responsible fathers, he wants to educate his children to the university level and build a good house. Unpredictable weather and price fluctuations affect his business, but his dream is to become one of the leading cocoa producers in his area. Amos is requesting a loan to pay his children's school fees and hire workers to prune his land.

loans.use: to pay school fees and hire workers to prune his land.

loans.name: Fatuma's Group

texts.en: Fatuma is a twenty-five year old maize farmer and mother of eight children. Due to a lack of capital to invest in fertilizers such as manure and pesticides, the maize yields poor harvests. Fatuma is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because she wants to use the profits from her tree farm to educate her children.  She says, "I like KOMAZA because I am investing in trees for future improvement."

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong, 41, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver. Phuong has been running a food stall selling beef noodles for five years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying good quality beef and noodles to make better food to attract new customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income which will assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy beef and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia  is married, 42 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entreprenneur who earns a living by buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 18,000 from NWTF to buy additional vegetables in bulk to sell to her customers. Nelia has been in this business for three years, and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh, 46, a married mother of one son and two daughters, lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a security guard, while she has been selling oil-fired wood in front of her house for 15 years.

Linh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of wood to resell. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy oil-fired wood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy utensils to sell.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Hung is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to sell from the general store that she runs in front of her internet shop. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of products to stock her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy land for farming, which will supplement his salary from his teaching profession.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 51 years old and single. She has been running a stand in front of her door, selling sugar cane and milk, for four years. She started this business to cover her expenses. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hoa is requesting a loan to expand her business, by offering more soft drinks to customers, so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the investment of the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest, to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Shehnaz's Group

texts.en:
Ms. Shehnaz is a 55-year-old married woman. She has been in a sewing and embroidery business for five years. She started her own business by buying a sewing machine to support her family when her husband was the only working person in the family. With the passage of time, her sales and net income increased. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

Shehnaz, as a member of a five-person lending group, has applied for a loan to purchase one more sewing machine and embroidery materials. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and embroidery materials for her business

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a very ambitious man who grows cocoa and also owns rental houses. Unpredictable weather conditions affect his business while he dreams of educating his children up to the university level and expanding his farming activities. He sells cocoa directly to the factory, and his farm alone cannot provide enough cocoa; thus, he has to buy from other farmers. Julius intends to use the loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en: Hieu is a 54-year-old married woman. She lives with her one son, three daughters and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a security guard. For five years, she has run a food stall selling fried chicken and rice to people in her community. Hieu would like a loan to purchase better quality food at competitive prices from wholesalers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract new customers. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better quality chicken and rice at competitive prices.

loans.name: Saumu's Group

texts.en: Saumu is a 30-year-old mother of seven children, and an arid land farmer. She grows maize and cassava. Her crops are affected by pests and diseases, and she does not have the money for pesticides. When asked why she joined the KOMAZA microforestry program, Saumu replied, "I need to improve my life through KOMAZA, by planting money-generating trees. People speak good of KOMAZA, [saying] that it is assisting farmers to improve their lives, and I joined it." With the profits from her tree farm, Saumu will educate her children and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training, and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Boi

texts.en:
Boi would like to take a further loan to buy good-quality ingredients with which to make cakes. She will sell the cakes from her sales stall.

Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and further increasing sales. She also hopes that through the investment of the loan, she will be able to increase her income some more, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy good-quality ingredients with which to make cakes.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 55 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Josefina has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Josefina has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Sando

texts.en: Sando is 53 years old and lives in Paynesville, which is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County. She is a widow with six children between 17 to 39 years old. Only one is in school and lives at home. For the past six years she has been running a restaurant in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, fish, charcoal, vita, etc. for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, pepper, fish, charcoal, vita, etc. for her business

loans.name: Adera

texts.en: Adera is a fifty three year old widow with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Three of the children attend school. The ever-changing customer preferences coupled with inadequate capital affect her business growth. Adera's dream is to own a boutique and in the long run have a fashion house. Adera intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell and a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Hysen

texts.en:
Hysen is a 24-year-old married man who lives in a southern part of Kosovo. He is a maintenance worker in a restaurant. His wife is a housewife. Hysen’s family owns a small house that has not had any repairs or renovations in the last several years. 

The roof of his house is always leaky when it’s snowing or raining. The home is also therefore unable to retain the heat. It is very important for their health and wellbeing to be able to repair the roof for better living conditions and a comfortable life.
