Hysen requests a loan to pay for repairing the roof of his house. The loan will help him to ensure a better life. He hopes in the future to have children and to improve their living conditions. 

The help from Kiva lenders is greatly appreciated from the family.

loans.use: to repair the roof.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hog raiser in the Philippines. She has been in this line of business for ten years. In addition to raising hogs, she is involved in cultivating rice.

Marilyn would like to keep her hogs healthier, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. This loan amount will allow her to buy enough hog feed and essential vitamins for her hogs. Her earned income goes toward her family's daily consumption, maintenance for her rice field, and some savings. Marilyn believes that her goal will be realized someday, because of her hard work and determination in life.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and essential vitamins for the hogs she is raising

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is a responsible mother who aims to become financially stable in order to help her husband in satisfying their family's needs. She is 28 years old and has one infant-age child. While taking care of her baby, she runs a small variety store in order to generate income. She plans to improve her business, but she has inadequate capital. In this regard, she is asking for an additional PHP 10,000 to buy more canned goods, noodles, soaps, snack foods, seasonings and beverages to sell. In the future, she hopes that her business will grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: To buy more canned goods, noodles, soaps, snack foods, seasonings and beverages to sell

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dry goods business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 23,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional dry goods to sell in her stall.

Cleofe successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her dry goods business.

NWTF is featuring Cleofe's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dry goods to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en: Tam, 40, is married and has one son. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a worker for a local company. He has supported his family by running a business processing copper wires at his house for 20 years. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a great quantity of copper wires to better satisfy his customers. He hopes his business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income to help him improve his family's living conditions and send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy copper wire to sell.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 23-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has one daughter. She and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for several years. 

Phuong would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en: Lam is a 35-year-old married man with two daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. Lam earns money by producing plastic things such as plastic lids and plastic bottles. He has been involved in this business for five years. Now, Lam would like to take a loan to invest in his business. He plans to use this loan to buy a great quantity of plastic materials to serve more customers. He hopes that through this loan, he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. This will enable him to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a great quantity of plastic materials to serve more customers.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen would like to take out a further loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of rice to sell from her stall. Huyen's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of rice to sell

loans.name: Bertha Concepcion

texts.es:
La Sra. Bertha gracias al crédito anterior de Kiva ha podido invertir en su trabajo, dando buena alimentación a sus animales y así también tener mejores ingresos para dar a su familia lo que necesitan. Ella es una persona con gran vision y quiere seguir creciendo, es por eso que quiere seguir invirtiendo en su trabajo.
Solicita de un nuevo crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de alimentos para sus animales, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo y dar a sus animales una buena crianza y también para seguir dando productos de buena calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha, thanks to her previous Kiva loan, has been able to invest in her work by giving good quality feed to her animals.  She earned better income and could provide her family with what they needed.  She is a person of great vision and wants to keep growing her business.  Which is why she wants to continue investing in her work.
Sra. Bertha is requesting a new loan to be able to invest in the purchase of animal feed.  With it, she will be able to continue her work, raise her animals well and also keep offering good quality products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is a married father of three children between the ages of 1 and 6 years old.  He lives in the Ashkali community in the southern part of Kosovo.  This loving family lives in unacceptable conditions.  They live in a small house with serious problems with the roof, windows, and doors.  This is especially problematic during the rainy season and winter.  He works, as the main source of income, by carrying goods (wood, furniture, etc.) for local members of the community. 

Ramadan is in need of a loan to buy windows and doorframes to renovate his house and, therefore, improve the living conditions of his family.  He hopes to offer a better life to his children.

Ramadan is grateful to Kiva lenders for improving the family's conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy windows and door frames for renovation.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. These purchases will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of products, such as sugar, milk, soft drinks and snack foods, to sell from her store.

loans.name: 03-0064-013 Group

texts.es:
Buenas días este es el grupo  “LAS SEMILLITAS” conformada por 7 personas emprendedoras, Que pasan  al ciclo 13  cada uno de los integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades del comercios. Ana es presidenta del grupo  ella es casada con dos hijos ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega. El préstamo que le dieron los inversionistas KIVA lo  uso en la compra de abarrotes en general. Su mayor deseo es tener una bodega más grande. Ana  es la segunda del lado izquierdo viste con un polo celeste.

Good morning this is the group "the little seeds" formed by seven entrepreneurs, who spend at each cycle 13 team members engage in various activities of businesses. Ana is president of the group she is married with two children, she has a small winery. The loan KIVA gave investors use it to buy groceries. His greatest wish is to have a larger warehouse. Ana is the second on the left wears a blue polo.
texts.en: Hello.  This is the communal bank "Las Semillitas" (The Little Seeds).  It is made up of seven entrepreneurs.  They are entering their 13th lending cycle.  Each of the members of the communal bank engage in different lines of work.  Ana is the president of the group.  She is married with two children.  She has a small grocery store.  She will use the the loan given by the KIVA investors to buy general grocery items.  Ana's greatest wish is to have a larger grocery.  In the photo above, she is the second from the left and wearing a blue t-shirt.

loans.use: with the purchase of groceries (rice, sugar, cooking oil).

loans.name: Duc

texts.en:
Duc is a 50-year-old, married man, who has a son and a daughter. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. Duc earns money by working as a turner; he has run his turning shop for thirty years. ["Turning" is a metal cutting process for producing a cylindrical object.]

Now, Duc would like to take a loan to invest in his business. He plans to use this loan to buy tools and materials for his turning shop, so he will be able to serve more customers. He hopes that through the investment of this loan, he will be able to increase the sales of his business. This will enable him to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy tools and materials for his turning shop

loans.name: Mala

texts.en:
Mala is 36 years old and lives in Paynesville South, which is one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a driver. The couple has seven children, between the ages of 2 and 21 years. Four of their children are currently in school and live at home.

For the past five years, Mala has been selling soft drinks in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks to resell. Her plans are to build a house and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is a 41-year-old woman with two children.  She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.  She and her husband have been running a business making and selling grass brooms for twenty years.  Hong would like a loan to buy a greater quantity of raw materials to make brooms.  She hopes this will enable her to meet the needs of her existing customers and to attract additional customers.  She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make brooms.

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en: Tuyen, 28, is married and has two sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income repairing motorbikes in front of their house. She started running a beauty salon three years ago. She is requesting a loan to buy hairdressing tools and equipment to expand her business, and to buy a computer for her sons' learning. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing tools and equipment, and a computer for her sons' learning.

loans.name: Lac

texts.en:
Lac is 36 years old and is married. She and her husband have been running a general store in front of her door for three years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her two children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Lac is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more food and many kinds of soft drinks to sell from her store so that she can increase her sales. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy food and soft drinks to sell from her store

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh is a 41-year-old man with one son.  He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City.  He and his wife have been running a business making and selling grass brooms for twenty years.  Anh would like to take a loan to buy a greater quantity of raw materials to make grass brooms.  He hopes this will enable him to meet the needs of his existing customers and to attract additional customers.  He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and help to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making brooms.

loans.name: Uyen

texts.en:
Uyen is 33 years old, married, and has one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Uyen runs an electrical goods shop, to earn her living. She started her business three years ago.

She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business, by buying a greater quantity and variety of electrical products to attract more customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity and variety of electrical products

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be is a 44-year-old, married woman. She lives with her daughter and husband, in Ho Chi Minh City. For fifteen years she and her husband have operated a cafe in front of their house.

Be would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages, including coffees, to stock her cafe. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers, and to attract additional customers. She also hopes that, through the investment of this loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties that may face her family.

loans.use: To purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages to stock her cafe

loans.name: Solidario Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO DIOS ES AMOR
Don Clementino se dedica a la agricultura y además en sus tiempos libres se dedica a la barbería que tiene en su propia casa,el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace años, es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la comora de mercaderia en cosmeticos para su barberia espera que le puedan ayudar atravez del credito para que el pueda seguir luchando para salir adelante.
texts.en: For the Solidario Dios es Amor (Caring God is love) group: Clementino works in agriculture and in his free time works in a barber shop that he has at home. He has been doing this activity for years. For that reason he is requesting a loan to purchase cosmetics merchandise for his barber shop. He hopes that he can be helped through this loan so that he can continue working to move forward.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics merchandise for the barber shop

loans.name: Shama's Group

texts.en:
Shama is a 53-year-old married woman.  She has been running a beauty parlor for many years.  She has received much appreciation through her work.  She is very talented and knows the art of makeup very well.  People prefer her for their bridal makeup and she makes enough to support her family well.

Due to an increase in the number of customers, she requires more beauty products to cater to many customers at a time, such as utensils and facial creams.  For this purpose she has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan to meet the requirements of her parlor.  This will ultimately help her to generate more income. 

Shama desires to expand her parlor and intends to spend part of the income on the improvement of her house.  She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products, utensils, and facial creams for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is 50 years old and lives in Tsakhkunq village, in the Sevan area, with his wife and three sons.  He is a mechanic who, until 1990, has worked as a tractor-driver in his village.  But afterwards, to meet his family’s demands, he engaged in animal breeding and field-husbandry.

He has extensive land, four cows, two calves, 25 lambs, two horses, and many chickens.  Gagik’s wife and sons help him in animal breeding.  This farming activity is the main source of his family’s income.  As he confessed, to keep such animals is very hard but at the same time, pleasurable and profitable. 

Gagik requests 500,000 Armenian drams to buy two horses which will help him in farming.

loans.use: to buy two horses.

loans.name: Quy

texts.en:
Quy is a 56-year-old married woman. She lives with three children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn money running a business selling paint products and tools. They started this business four years ago.

Quy would like a loan to purchase better quality paint products at competitive prices from wholesalers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of paint products to sell

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara tiene 39 años, esta casada con José, con quien tiene tres hijos; de 23, 18 y 15 años. Juntos, viven en su casa propia construida a base de material rústico y se ubica en un anexo rural.Clara es una mujer de apariencia frágil pero de gran fuerza y coraje para el trabajo. Ella se dedica a la agricultura , razón por la cual tiene sus propios terrenos de cultivo y aprovecha los buenos suelos que posee su localidad para sembrar maíz , papas de distintas variedades y arvejas. “A veces también siembro flores y verduras, pero solo en mayo y noviembre”, menciona. Lo que le conviene más es la producción de arvejas y maíz ya que ha logrado dominar muy bien estas siembras . Solo cultiva las variedades más especiales y requeridas por el mercado y aunque necesiten más cuidados, ella no se hace problemas y se esmera cada dia más. Ésta vez tendrá que sembrar arvejas por ello requiere de su apoyo financiero ya que los S/. 2000 soles los invertirá en la compra de abono orgánico y semillas para la siembra.
texts.en:
Clara is 39 years old, married to José, and they have three children who are 23, 18, and 15 years old. The live together in their own home, which is constructed with rustic materials and is located in a rural annex. Clara is a woman with a fragile appearance but with much strength and courage for work. She works in agriculture, the reason for which she has her own land for cultivation. She takes advantage of the good ground that the land has to sow corn, potatoes of distinct varieties, and peas. 

"Sometimes I also sow flowers and vegetables, but only in May and November, " she mentioned. What is better for her is the production of peas and corn, since she has gained control over sowing these crops. She only cultivates the varieties that are special and most needed for the market, even though they need to be watched over more carefully. She does not have problems and she goes to a lot of efforts every day. This time she will have to sow peas, for which she requires financial support. She will invest the 2000 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer and seeds for sowing.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is 46 years old and is married with two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband is a security guard. Huong has been running a shop selling soft drinks and fruit juice in front of her door for 20 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Huong is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to stock her stall.

loans.name: Muoi

texts.en: Muoi is requesting a new loan to buy ingredients to make food to sell. Muoi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres. Ella es estudiante de la carrera de contabilidad, está iniciando su terce ciclo de estudios, le faltarían res años y medio pata terminar su carrera. Una de sus metas es poner su propio estudio contable y asi trabajar de forma independiente. Paralelamente a sus estudios trabaja como auxiliar de contabilidad uno de los motivos por lo que eligió estudiar esta carrera profesional. Está muy agradecida de sus padres ya que son ellos su mayor apoyo, asimismo agradece a los inversionista de Kiva por su respaldo ya que gracias a ello podría concretar su sueño el de llegar a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is 20 years old. She is unmarried and lives with her parents. She is studying accounting and beginning her third year. She has three and and a half more years till she finishes. One of her goals is to start her own accounting firm so she can work for herself. In addition to her studies, she also works as an accounting assistant, which is one of the reasons she chose this career path. She is very grateful to her parents, who have provided her with so much support, and to Kiva investors for their backing, since it is because of them that she will realize her dream of becoming a successful professional.

loans.use: to pay for the third year of her accounting degree.

loans.name: Ingrid Vanessa

texts.es: Ingrid, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo y tiene tres hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa. Hace dos años que ella estableció su propia pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios como granos básicos, churros, manteca, harina, productos de limpieza, otros abarrotes y venta de pescado. Con el préstamo que solicita que es por 13,000 lempiras va surtir de productos alimenticios y va comprar unos estantes que necesita para colocar productos. Ella tiene como plan seguir trabajando con su negocio y ser ejemplo para sus hijos.
texts.en: Ingrid, who is 25-years old, lives with her husband and has three children.  She lives in an area of the municipality Santa Cruz de Yojoa.  Two years ago, she opened her own small grocery where she sells food products like basic grains, churros (a doughnut-like sweet), butter, flour, cleaning products, other grocery items and fish.  With the loan she has requested of 13,000 lempiras ($675 USD), Ingrid is going to stock up on food stuffs and purchase some shelving that she needs to put out her products.  Ingrid plans to keep working in her store and to provide a good example for her children.

loans.use: to stock up her business with food products to sell and to purchase shelving to display more products.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is a 32-year-old single woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. For two years, she has operated a cafe in front of her house.

Huong would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of coffee and food ingredients to stock her shop. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

Huong also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of coffee and food ingredients to stock her shop.

loans.name: Rezo

texts.en:
Rezo is 36 years old from Ozurgeti district. He is married and lives with his wife and two children. Rezo requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business startup but without success. The only source of the income for the family has been from the clothing Rezo buys and resells to villagers. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

The reason Rezo was rejected for a loan was because of the family’s low income and poor living conditions. In most cases the rural poor do not have access to loans because they are regarded as high-risk borrowers. Startup loan programs, however, envisage providing startup and restartup loans for such people.

Rezo applied for a 600 USD loan from Credo to open a shop where he will sell footwear. His loan request was approved through the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. With his loan Rezo plans to buy a stock of footwear to sell in his newly-opened shop. The new startup loan financed by Kiva will significantly improve the income and living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of footwear to sell in his newly-opened shop.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang would like to take a further loan to decorate her shop and buy more cellphone accessories to sell from her stall. Hang's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to decorate her shop and buy a larger quantity of cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Joaju Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Aty joaju está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se esfuerzan. Ellas están muy emocionadas por trabajar juntas y aprender mucho. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación, y quieren poder mejorar la economía de todas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Agustina, quien se dedica a la cría, venta y también a faenarlos. Cuenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que debe de estar pendiente siempre de sus animales para que no les falte nada, pero pese a ello siempre se esfuerza por seguir y hace su trabajo con mucho amor.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de Cerdos, para faenar y vender  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank called "Kuña Aty Joaju" is in its first lending cycle with the Foundation.  They all work and put in a lot of effort.  They are very excited about working and learning a lot together.  They are doing the elimination survey and want to be able to improve all the members' finances. 
One of the members of the communal bank is Sra. Agustina.  She makes her living raising, selling and also slaughtering pigs.  She says that it is very hard work, as she always has to be on top of her animals' care and make sure they have everything they need.  But in spite of that, she always works hard and does her job with a lot of love. 
Sra. Agustina is requesting this loan in order to purchase pigs to slaughter and to sell, which will help her to firm up her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to sell and to slaughter.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia is a 37-year-old married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. For the past ten years he has owned and run a retail shop. He raised the capital to start this business by selling his crops. The main challenges he faces in his business are price fluctuations and theft.

Matia used his previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. Matia is now applying for a 1,500,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to buy dried cassava and secondhand clothes to sell. His ambition is to educate his children to university level and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy dried cassava and secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with eight children and one of her children goes to school. She has no additional family members. She is a poultry farmer. She has been in business for the last 30 years. She works six days a week.  She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy vaccines, poultry feed, and feeding trays. Her major business challenges are seasonality, transportation of chicken feed and electricity. Her goals and aspirations are to increase her poultry farm, to build more rental rooms and expand her production. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed, vaccines and feeding trays

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is a 47-year-old woman living in Tetrtskaro district with her 52-year-old husband, son and retired mother in-law. The main income for the family is from farming. They have 3 milk cows, 5 calves, 9 pigs and 22 chickens. They are milking the cows to produce cheese to sell locally as well as in the capital city. They also sell piglets and eggs at the local markets and get a small monthly income. The family has been in this business for 10 years. Nana requested a loan for renovating a shed and purchasing more calves. She wants to develop her farming, raise calves and make more cheese in the future to increase her family's income. The profit will help the family to renovate their house to have better living conditions.

loans.use: To renovate a shed and purchase calves

loans.name: Giau

texts.en:
Giau’s previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a better income to support her family. She is now applying for a loan from CEP of 15,000,000 VND, which she will use to buy a larger quantity of tea, soft drinks, glasses and cups to sell from her stall.

Giau’s ambition is to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and make more in sales. By doing so she hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tea, soft drinks, glasses and cups.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man with eight children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He trades in agriculture produce and practices farming to earn a living. He has a banana and sugar cane plantation and he uses the proceeds to brew alcohol to sell. Unfavorable weather conditions and stiff competition affects his businesses while his dream is to be the leading farm producer in the region. Peter intends to use the loan to buy maize and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and  ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Ms. Sajida is a 39-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with the support of her husband. They have 12 years of experience in the field. She provides a valuable service to her community by selling milk to many of her neighbors. Sajida looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family.

She has five children and they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make more profit, they requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. They hope to have an increase in their production capacity, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Thabu's Group

texts.en: Thabu is a 31-year-old mother of four children. She prepares and sells mandazi, a local baked good, to earn money to support her family. Her sales are limited by not having many customers. With the profits from her tree farm, Zawadi plans to educate her children.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Musim

texts.en:
Musim lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children, only one of whom goes to school. She has no other family members. She lives in a rented house that has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

For the past two years Musim has sold GNLD homecare products from a shop where she works six days a week. She earns an additional income through a teaching job. Transportation is her major challenge.

Musim is applying for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy cosmetics, syrups and energy drinks. Her ambition is to become a wholesaler and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, syrups and energy drinks.

loans.name: Zawadi's Group

texts.en: Zawadi is a 27-year-old mother of three children and a dryland farmer. Her husband is a farmer too and they grow maize, cowpeas and cassava. Their agricultural business faces the challenge of having pests infest the crops, which results in a low harvest. Zawadi is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because, in her words, "I loved what KOMAZA is doing and I wanted to be part of it." With the profits from her tree farm, Zawadi plans to educate her children, buy goats, and build a house.

loans.use: to pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, se dedica a la granja de pollos de engorde, siembra de granos básicos y venta de madera. El vive actualmente con su esposa, sus 2 hijos los cuales estudian y dependen de ellos, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. 
El realiza las actividades agropecuarias como crianza de pollos de engorde, siembra de los granos básicos que son necesarios para subsistir, al igual a la venta de madera, el trabajo lo aprendió por la misma necesidad económica y lo desempeña desde las 6:00 de la mañana hasta por la tarde. El crédito lo invertirá en el pago de maquinaria para moler maíz y posteriormente  comercializarlo. 
Este préstamo le permitirá obtener ingresos extras, mejorar su negocio y las condiciones de vida. Su sueño es seguir trabajando de la mano de la institución, para mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos económicos y optimizar las condiciones de vida para su familia y personalmente.
texts.en:
Concepción operates a poultry farm, grows basic grains, and sells wood. He currently lives with his wife and their two dependent children who are studying. Concepción does not have any family members who live abroad.

He engages in farming activities such as raising chickens for fattening and growing the grains that are needed to maintain them. At the same time, he also sells wood and learned this type of work out of necessity. Concepción begins his work at 6:00 A.M. and continues into the afternoon. His loan will be invested in the payment of machinery for grinding the corn so that he can sell it later.

This loan will allow him to earn extra income, grow his business, and improve his living conditions. His dream is to continue working closely with PADECOMSM so that he can improve and increase his earnings, as well as optimize the living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay the cost of grinding the corn he produced so that he can sell it later.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 51 years old and lives in Sevan city with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Her son sometimes is able to work as a waiter. In the past Aida graduated from medical school and for many years worked as a nurse in Sevan’s hospitals.

But after the collapse of the Soviet Union, her husband lost his job. In order to support her family Aida started her own business in 1993 selling fruits and vegetables from a rented shop in Sevan. She buys much of her produce from villagers and then uses the family car to take it to her shop. Aida's husband works with her in this endeavor.

Aida is applying for a 900,000 AMD from Nor Horizon to buy greater quantities of vegetables and fruits to sell. Although the work is very hard, the income makes it worthwhile. It supports Aida's family during this time of economic crisis in the region where they live.

loans.use: To buy lot of vegetables and fruits for trading

loans.name: Dallendyshe

texts.en:
Dallendyshe is married and a member of the vulnerable Egyptian community. She lives with her husband in southern Albania, in a rural area. Selling used items has been her activity and the only source of income for the past seven years. 

“Even though, we don’t have children to raise and feed, we still need money for ourselves. Growing older, we’ve got more medical bills to pay and living in poverty makes us get sick more often,” she said. “We haven’t got any pensions yet, so we need to work until then,” Dallendyshe added.

A loan of 80,000 Albanian Lek will help Dallendyshe to buy more second-hand items to resell in the local market.

loans.use: to buy second-hand items to resell.

loans.name: Arpine

texts.en:
Arpine, a citizen of Tsaghkunk village, continues to run an animal breeding and land cultivation business in her village. She uses the income from this activity to meet her family's needs. With her first loan from Kiva, Arpine bought fodder for her animals and oat seeds, as she uses oat for her animals as a feed.  Thanks to this loan, her food productivity has increased, especially the dairy products. Because her farming expanded, Arpine decided to increase the number of her animals, especially the number of cattle.
 
Arpine needs a new loan to buy two cows and some fodder to further increase her food productivity. Arpine intends to accumulate money for her children's good future.

loans.use: To buy two cows and some fodder

loans.name: Evaket

texts.en:
Evaket is a 28-year-old married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a beauty salon which she has operated for the past three years, and her clientele is steadily growing. Customers not paying on time has been her main problem.

Evaket used a previous loan to buy dryers and steam machines for her salon. With her increased earnings, however, she has been able to open a spare parts shop. Evaket is now applying for a 1,000,000 UGX loan from HOFOKAM to buy more parts.

In addition to increasing her stock of parts Evaket would like to move her salon to a more permanent location. Her ambition is to build a house and educate her children so they might attend higher institutes of learning.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Doris Marlendi

texts.es:
DOÑA DORIS MARLENDY
Ella es originaria del municipio de Tecpan Guatemala ella tiene 28 años de edad, se dedica a una tienda de venta de artículos de consumo diario y a la compra y venta de afrecho, granillo y maíz, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace algunos años. 
El esposo de ella se dedica al comercio y gracias al apoyo de el ella sigue adelante con su negocio, desde temprano y hasta tarde ella atiende su negocio que esta ubicado a 1 km. De donde ella vive.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio, surtirlo con mas variedad de productos y asi  obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar su calidad de vida. esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Doris Marlendi is a native of the municipality of Tecpan, Guatemala and is 28 years old. She has a store selling everyday grocery items, and she buys and sells bran, grain, and corn. She’s been doing this work for some years.

Her husband works in the store, and thanks to his support, she continues moving forward with her business. From early morning until late, she attends to her business, which is located 1 kilometer away. 

Her dream is to expand her business, stock it with a greater variety of products, and in this way obtain better earnings and improve her quality of life. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of everyday grocery products.

loans.use: to purchase everyday grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Luz De Luna Group

texts.es:
DUO LUZ DE LUNA
Este dúo lo forman doña Julia, quien es casada, de 54 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos que viven con ella pero que 3 de ellos ya trabajan y la ayudan, también su esposo trabaja como posero y lo mandan a diferentes lugares, ella se dedica desde hace mas de 1 año a la venta de colchas, cubrecamas, sabanas, manteles, cortinas en el sector de patzanes, solicita este crédito porque necesita comprar un poco de cortinas y sabanas ya que para la época de semana santa se venden este tipo de cosas, además compran sabanas porque comienza la época de calor entonces necesita comprar diferentes estilos y colores para vender y aumentar sus ganancias,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos de usos domesticos, sabanas,cortinas,colchas,cubrecamas, etc.
texts.en: Duo Luz de Luna. This duo includes Julia, 54, who is married and has five children who live with her. Three of them already work and help her. Her husband also works with wells and they send him to different places. For more than a year, she has worked selling bedspreads, sheets, blankets, and curtains in the region of Patzanes. She is applying for this loan because she needs to buy some curtains and sheets because these kinds of things sell during Holy Week. They will also buy sheets because the hot season is starting. So they need to buy different styles and colors to sell and increase their profits. She is applying for this loan to buy domestic products, like sheets, curtains, bedspreads, etc.

loans.use: to buy products for domestic use, like sheets, curtains, and bedspreads.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Don julio, tiene 60 años de edad, es soltero por viudez, tiene dos hijos y vive con ellos y una nuera, reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Quimistan, Santa Bárbara. Hace 20 años que don Julio se dedica a la venta de medicinas en su casa, vende todo tipo de pastillas, vitaminas, antibióticos, jarabes etc. El negocio lo ha mantenido activo por la inversión de varios préstamos, actualmente solicita el séptimo préstamo con el cual va comprar más medicamentos para surtir y estar mas solvente con el negocio. Su sueño es que sus hijos se preparen profesionalmente en el área de medicina.
texts.en: Julio, 60, is a widow. He has two children and he lives with them and a daughter-in-law. He lives in a village in Quimistan municipality, Santa Bárbara. Julio has worked selling medicines in his house for 20 years. He sells all kinds of pills, vitamins, antibiotics, syrups, etc. He has kept the business active through several loans. Now he is asking for his seventh loan, with which he will buy more medicines to stock his business and make it more solvent. His dream is for his children to become professionals in medicine.

loans.use: to stock his business with medicines like pills, syrups, antibiotics, vitamins, etc.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
Gabino de 54 años, es un hombre soltero y vive con su madre a la que cuida con mucho cariño. Además educa a su hermano menor. Ellos viven en una casa propia construida con material rústico y se ubica en un anexo agrícola.Gabino se dedica a la agricultura desde que era niño, por eso adquirió buena experiencia la cual se ve reflejada en sus buenas producciones. Cultiva arvejas, maíz y papas, pero las arvejas le traen mayores satisfacciones. Siembra en terrenos que arrienda de otros campesinos, por eso su producción es abundante. “Son muchos años que trabajo así, por eso tengo que contratar camiones para bajar mi cosecha hasta el mercado”, dice. Tiene la ventaja de ser conocido por los compradores quienes trasladan las hortalizas hacia la ciudad de Lima. Le agrada su trabajo y piensa continuar labrando la tierra por mucho tiempo.Este es su crédito número 8 con Kiva, por ello se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
Con los S/.2000 soles solicitados podrá adquirir abono orgánico y semillas de arvejas para iniciar su siembra.
texts.en: Gabino, 54, is single and lives with his mother, whom he affectionately cares for. He is also educating his younger brother. They live in their own home, built out of rustic materials, located in an agricultural zone. Gabino has worked in agriculture since he was a child. He gained a lot of experience because of this, which is reflected in his good production. He grows peas, corn, and potatoes, but the peas bring the greatest satisfaction. He plants on land that he rents from others in the area. For this reason, his production is large. "I've worked this way for years, so I have to hire trucks to take my harvest to market," he says. He has the advantage of being known to the buyers who take the crops to Lima. He likes his work and he plans to continue working the land for a long time. This is his eighth loan with Kiva. He takes care to be on time with his monthly payments. With the 2,000 soles he is applying for, he will be able to get organic fertilizer and pea seeds to start his planting.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pea seeds.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas es de la cuidad de Encarnación,  está en su ciclo numero 10, donde todas se unieron con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio de ese trabajo dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan.
La Sra. Edil es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la confección de todo tipo de prendas, con lo que está ayudando a su familia y tiene los medios para ayudarlos. Edil es muy talentosa en lo que hace, y es por eso que le está yendo muy bien con su trabajo. Tiene ya muy buena clientela, pero se esmera por cada día ir creciendo más.
Edil solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de hilos, telas, gomas y demás insumos para seguir confeccionando sus pedidos y cumpliendo con sus clientes, a la vez que va creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en: This group, Mujeres Unidas (Women United), is in the city of Encarnación. It is on its tenth loan cycle. They are all united with the goal of helping each other and giving their families everything that they need through this work. Edil is part of this group. She works sewing all kinds of articles of clothing, through which she helps her family and has the means to help them. Edil is very talented at what she does, and this is why her work is going well for her. She already has a good customer base, but she works every day to grow more. She is asking for this loan to investing it in buying thread, fabric, elastic, and more supplies to keep sewing her orders and meeting her customers' needs, while she grows as a micro-businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, and more.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a 55-year-old woman from Khoni district, West Georgia. She is married and lives with her husband and a pensioner mother-in-law. Manana is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, she has two milking cows whose milk is used in cheese production. She produces cheese and sells it at local markets at a good price. Besides that, she has a pig and sells piglets seasonally. 

Manana is a very hardworking woman and has a rich experience in her business. She requested a loan for purchasing a milking cow. After purchasing an additional milking cow, she will be able to increase her cheese production. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. Manana awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Samedin

texts.en:
Samedin wants to thank all Kiva lenders for the previous loan, which helped him to increase and continue his business. With the previous loan, he had repaired the air conditioner in his vehicle and he reinforced the vehicle doors, which was able to increase his business profit. 

Samedin used these profits to help his family, and he managed to improve the conditions for his family life. He is very satisfied with his business, and he plans to continue in the future. 

Now he is requesting a second loan for the same business. With this loan, he will repair the vehicle and he will install a new air conditioner. He is hoping to provide better transport services to his passengers and generate more income.

His goal is to provide a secure life for his family. Samedin wants to thank again Kiva lenders for their second support!

loans.use: To repair his vehicle and install a new air conditioner.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: Esther de 47 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia construida a base de adobe y se ubica en un anexo rural.Esther se dedica a la agricultura y es una actividad que le agrada realizar. “En el campo me siento libre, además todo lo que tengo es gracias al sudor de mi frente”, menciona. En sus terrenos siembra arvejas, habas, maíz y papas, las que comercializa en el mercado mayorista (a 20 minutos de la zona). En estas labores recibe el apoyo de sus hijos mayores y de su esposo. Para cada siembra debe realizar una gran inversión, por ejemplo un saco de abono orgánico le cuesta entre 120 a 140 soles, ella requiere de 5 a 10 sacos. Además las semillas también son costosas, pero al final, recupera lo invertido gracias a un trabajo coordinado y sacrificado. Ahora requiere de su ayuda para iniciar una siembra de arvejas y maíz.Este es su crédito número 2 con Kiva y da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Con los 2000 soles solicitados podrá adquirir semillas de arvejas y maíz, para iniciar una siembra.
texts.en:
Esther is 47 years old; she is married and has four children who she lives with in her own house, which is built from an adobe base and is located in a rural annex. Esther works in agriculture, which is an activity that she is pleased to do. 

“In the fields, I feel free. Also, everything that I have is thanks to the sweat from my own forehead,” she says. 

On her land, she grows peas, beans, corn, and potatoes, which she sells in the wholesale market 20 minutes from her neighborhood. She receives support in her work from her older children and her husband. 

For every planting, she has to make a big investment. For example, a sack of organic fertilizer costs between 120 and 140 soles, and she needs 5 to 10 sacks. In addition, the seeds are also costly, but in the end she recoups everything that she invested due to coordinated and self-sacrificing work. 

Now, she needs your help in order to begin planting peas and corn. This is her second loan with Kiva, and she gives her word that she will be punctual in making her monthly quota payments. With the 2000 soles that she requested, she will be able to obtain seeds for peas and corn in order to begin planting.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for peas and corn.

loans.name: Rwashamaire Tukore Group

texts.en:
Fausta is a resident of Rwashamiri East Town Council, Ntungamo District. She is a widow who lost her husband in 1998 and was left with five children. She has managed to educate her children with so much struggle.

Fausta operates a small retail shop in the trading center with low-capital merchandise and sells fried cassava to residents. However, the state of her residential house is in bad condition. She has approached Ugafode through the group for 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings to enable her to renovate the house, which is almost collapsing on her children. She will save a small portion to buy household-use items for the shop to encourage continuity in the business.

loans.use: To renovate her house, which is almost collapsing on her children.

loans.name: Zohrab

texts.en:
Zohrab is 52 years old, married and has three children, a 15- and an 18-year-old daughter, and a 21-year-old son. His daughters go to school and his son helps his father at work. He wants his daughters to become doctors and his son to be an electrician. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. 

Zohrab has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now he lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. He started his business 10 years ago to be an electrician. Now he needs a 2000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy new apparatus and instruments. His instruments are so old, and if he buys a new apparatus and instruments, he will do his work quickly and better, and he can to do more work. This will be more profitable for his business. He wants to use the money from his business to help his family. In the future, he wants to teach how to be an electrician to his own apprentices. He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy new apparatus and instruments.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en:
Ayda is a 56-year-old, married woman, who has been working as a baker for 30 years. She is an expert in her field. She used to help her husband in his bakery, until she opened her own in 2004. Ayda is a hard worker, who invests everything she gets for the sake of pleasing her children as much as she can. Her bakery is well known in the region, for her special, traditional Mankousheh. (Mankousheh is a traditional food made with breakfast, lunch, or dinner folded dough, and special thyme, cheese, or minced meat toppings).

Ayda is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to pay for her son's wedding expenses. She did the same for his brother, but this time she can't provide the funds directly in cash from her business. That's why she applied for her first loan, and she is happy that she got introduced to Al Majmoua, which made her dream of seeing her son a groom come true. She said that this is the best gift parents can provide to their children, and she hopes to stay in good health to see her grandchildren, too.

Ayda hopes to develop her business more in the future, by making necessary decoration, and by updating the tools and machines she uses in her work.

loans.use: To pay for her son's wedding expenses

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri is 53 years old and lives in a small village of Khoni district. She is married and lives with her husband, son, and pensioner father-in-law. Her husband is an artisan and earns a small monthly income. Meri is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, she has two milking cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. She milks the cows and produces the cheese for selling. In addition, she has eight pigs and sells piglets seasonally. The family also has a vineyard and a hectare of agricultural land.

Meri is a very hard-working woman, and she has a rich experience in her business. She requested a loan for renovating the family's house. After their house has been renovated, the family will enjoy better living conditions. Meri awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate her family's house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 35 years old and lives in the Paynesville South, one of the populous areas in Montserrado County. She and her boyfriend, who is a college student, have two children, aged two and 18 years old. Their children are currently in school, and they all live at home. Since 2009, she has been selling palm oil in the local market. She makes lots of profits and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Ijevan city, presently with her husband and daughter. Anahit’s son is now in the military, serving in the Armenian Army. Her daughter is unemployed. Anahit’s husband goes to Russia from time to time, for seasonal work. But right now, he is jobless.
  
Anahit has been engaged in bakery production, in her house in Ijevan city, since 2000. She produces buns, bread, Armenian traditional bread (lavash) and many sweet cookies. With profits from her baked goods, she has provided for her family's needs, including paying for her son’s education, and buying household appliances that her family needed.

This loan will help Anahit to buy lots of flour and other raw ingredients for dough. The anticipated profits from using the loan, she will use to support her family, conserving some money for her children's future. She prefers to receive a Kiva loan, because her first loan was very successful for her.

loans.use: To buy lots of flour and other raw ingredients for dough

loans.name: La Puissance 2 (1) Group

texts.en:
Euloge, age 46, is representing the La Puissance 2 (1) group. He is married and has four children, ages 8 to 25 years. All four of the children are currently going to school or university. Euloge has a small grocery stall, where he sells a variety of foods. He has had this business for over 10 years.

Euloge will use his portion of this loan to buy inventory for his stall, including oil, peanuts, sugar, and soap. His business strategy is to offer friendly service to his customers. If they feel wanted and appreciated, they will likely return.
 
Euloge has received four previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes his grocery stall will become a large store, eventually enabling him to create a finance institution like HOPE Congo. He hopes his children will succeed in their studies.

loans.use: to pay for grocery inventory to resell, including oil, peanuts, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 43 years old. She lives in Mukhiani village, Tskaltubo district, with her 44-year-old husband, Merab, and their 10-year-old son, Aleksandre. The family has three milk cows and one pig. They make dairy products and sell piglets. Also, they own a plot of agricultural land. They use a small part of the land to grow greens, which they sell locally at the markets, together with the dairy products and piglets.

Leila requested a loan to build a greenhouse. She wants to use the empty part of the plot of land that they own, and develop their agricultural business. In the new greenhouse, she will grow different kinds of vegetables, which she will sell locally at the markets to get additional income. The profit will be reinvested in the same business, and Leila will have more income to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To build a greenhouse

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman, who has two children. Her business is located in Central Business District of Nairobi. She proposes to use this KES 50,000 loan to buy more handbags to sell, so as to boost her business.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. She repaid the previous loans successfully. In five years' time, Elizabeth sees herself running a big boutique. Also, she hopes that in future she will buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more handbags for her business inventory

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en:
Margret's group is comprised of four hard working women. Margret is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo. For the past two years, Margret has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh foods to sell, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young siblings. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods to sell in her restaurant.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 40 year old and lives in Paynesville South, one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have two children, aged 6 and 13, who are currently in school and live at home.

For the past eight years, Evelyn has been selling rubber dishes in the local market. She makes a lots of profit and has a growing number of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes for her business, such as bowls, plates and cups, etc. 

She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes for her business, such as bowls, plates and cups, etc.

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.ru:
Виталию 29 лет, он женат, есть один маленький ребенок.

Вот уже 10 лет как Виталий занимается тепличным хозяйством, На 60 сотках земли в теплицах и грунте выращивает ранние и поздние овощи: редис, помидоры, огурцы, картофель. Виталий - трудолюбивый и целеустремленный. Он хочет развивать свой бизнес дальше.

Сейчас Виталий готовит свои теплицы к сезону, чтобы получить максимальный доход с продажи ранних огурцов, помидоров, редиса, картофеля. Виталий просит предоставить ему кредит для покупки пленки и материалов для достройки новой теплицы.
texts.en:
Vitaliy is 29 years old, he is married and has one small child. 

Vitaliy has been in the greenhouse farming business for ten years now. On 60 acres of land in the greenhouses and soil he grows early and late vegetables: radish, tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes. Vitaliy is a hardworking and purposeful man. He wants to grow his business further.

Right now Vilaliy is preparing his greenhouses for the season so he can get a maximum profit from the sale of early cucumbers, tomatoes, radishes and potatoes. He is asking to provide him with a loan to buy film and materials to finish building a new greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy film and materials for a new greenhouse.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 51 years old. She lives in Batumi District with her 22 and 25 year old sons. Liana has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The family currently has no source of income. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Liana has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the credit received from Credo, Liana will open a grocery store. She will purchase grocery stocks and will work hard with her sons to increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Sahil

texts.en:
Sahil is 24 years old, and is a single. Sahil has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. He now lives with his mother in Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. 

He started his business three years ago as a computer program maker. He now needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy a new computer for his business. His computer is broken and he can't work for now. If Sahil is able to buy a computer, he will be able to continue his work. This will be more profitable for his business. 

Sahil wants to use the money from his business to help his mother. In the future he wants to have his own office in which to work. Sahil wants to get married and to have his own family in the future. Sahil is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy a new computer for his business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 40 years old, married and a father of three children. For the last thirteen years, he has earned a living by selling clothes in Malindi. Stephen earns a monthly profit of KES 9,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by our credit officer, and is applying for his second loan of KES 30,000, to buy additional stock for his business, such as dresses, blouses, trousers and shirts to sell to his customers. 

Stephen will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children, as well as expand the business. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can help give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for his business such as dresses, blouses, trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a 39-year-old divorced woman, who has been working in selling cosmetics and perfumes since 2011 to make her living. She used to work as a nurse, but she preferred to start up her own business and operate from her house, and then she can develop it gradually.

Jackline is applying for her first loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business capital with a specially released spring and summer collection.

Jackline is well known in her region for the good quality products she is selling. She is working hard and hopes to increase her business capital to open a small shop of her own in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business capital with a specially released spring and summer collection of cosmetics and perfumes.

loans.name: Lovette

texts.en:
Lovette lives in Paynesville. She is 40 years old, and married with six children, aged between 2 and 23 years old, who are currently in school and live at home. 

For the past twenty years, Lovette has been involved in business. Currently, she sells slippers in the local market. She started this business with a small amount of money received from her husband. 

Lovettee says that she enjoys selling to her customers, and the money that she generates from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cartons of slippers so that she can enlargen her business. She plans to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cartons of slippers so that she can enlargen her business.

loans.name: Nowa

texts.en:
Nowa is 39 years old, and is married with five children, who are all at school. 

As a way of taking good care of his family, Nowa started up a hardware business as a major source of income.The business is located at Karuguza, on the outskirts of Kagadi town, and his customers are residents of the area.

Nowa is always challenged by the means of transport from his home to his business. The cost of transport consumes much of his profits, which he would be using to look after his family.Therefore, he would like a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy a motorcycle, which will ease his transport. This will help put him in position to save some money.

He hopes to grow his business and be in a position to educate his children up to higher institutions of learning. He is a hard working and committed man.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to ease his transportation movements.

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en:
Aslan is a 57-year-old man from Batumi, West Georgia. Aslan used to be a sailor, but nowadays he has no source of income. 

Aslan has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start-up a family business, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of their low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Aslan requested la oan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

Aslan has decided to open a workshop, where he will make furniture. He has one years experience in this field - he had worked as an artisan in a furniture workshop and decided to open his own workshop in his house. With the credit received from Credo, he will purchase raw materials and equipment for the workshop. His business will help to increase his income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve Aslan's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and equipment for his new furniture workshop.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 42 years old and lives in Khoni district with his 37-year-old wife Ia, brother, two children and retired mother. 

The main source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. They own a plot of land where they grow nut trees and maize. Harvested products are sold locally at the markets. In addition, Gocha is working as an artisan on the construction of private orders to get a small monthly salary. 

He will use part of the loan to purchase a milking cow. They will milk the cow to make cheese and sell it locally at the markets. With the other part they will renovate the house. Selling the cheese will bring the family more monthly income and the renovated house will give them better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milking cow to make cheese to sell, and to renovate the house.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 27 year old and lives in Paynesville South, one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is a mother of three children, who are in school and aged between 4 and 9. Their fatherdoes not currently work. 

Oretha manages her home by working at her business. For the past ten years, she has been selling fresh fish in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has more and more customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fish for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is 30 years old and lives with his father, wife and son in Vanadzor. Up until a few years ago he worked as a laborer. After his marriage he couldn't provide his new-created family with their basic needs on his salary. He did his best to find a solution for this difficult situation.
He started to breed animals in barn near his house. He breeds cows, sheep and horses. In winter his animals stay in the barn and in the warm season the roam the pasture, where they stay until November. Meat and dairy products, which come from his animals, he sells to his townsman's in Vanadzor. He has many customers and the profit from his activity allows him to meet his family’s needs.
So Stepan is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy four cows. This will allow him to enlarge the quantity of dairy products which Stepan can produce on his farm. By doing this Stepan can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy four cows.

loans.name: Modayma

texts.en: Modayma lives in Paynesville which is one of the more populated areas in Montserrado County. She is 41 years old, and is married with three children between 7 and 23 years old. Her children are currently in school and live at home. For the past ten years she has been selling charcoal in the local market, she started this business with a small amount of money received from her husband. She enjoys selling to her customers and the money that she generates from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to expand her business. He hopes to build a house with the profits.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 24 years old, married and a father of two children. He operates a butcher shop in Malindi where he earns a monthly income of about KES. 10,500.
Alfred was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and he has applied for a loan of KES. 20,000 to add more meat to his butcher shop. The additional income will provide the basic needs for his family.
He intends to continue growing his business and hopes that one day he will own a well-established meat depot in the area.

loans.use: to add more meat to his butcher shop.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергею 33 года, он женат, есть один маленький ребенок. Вот уже 15 лет как Сергей занимается тепличным хозяйством, На 40 сотках земли в теплицах и грунте выращивает ранние и поздние овощи: редис, помидоры, огурцы, картофель. Сергей - трудолюбивый и целеустремленный. Он хочет развивать свой бизнес дальше. 

Сейчас Сергей готовит свои теплицы к сезону, чтобы получить максимальный доход с продажи ранних огурцов, помидоров, редиса, картофеля.  Сергей просит предоставить ему кредит для покупки пленки и материалов для достройки новой теплицы.
texts.en:
Sergei is 33 years old, married, and has a small child. For the past 15 years, Sergei has been a greenhouse farmer. On his 0.4 hectares of land, in greenhouses and in the open air, he cultivates early and late vegetables: radishes, tomatoes, cucumbers and potatoes. Sergei is hard-working and driven, and would like to continue developing his business.

Presently, Sergei is readying his greenhouses for the growing season in order to maximize his profits from sales of early cucumbers, tomatoes, radishes and potatoes. He is requesting a loan to purchase plastic film and other materials for the construction of a new greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy plastic film and other materials for a new greenhouse

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 28 years old and lives in Paynesville South, one of the more populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and her husband is a police man, they have four children between 3 and 15 years old, who are currently in school and live at home.  For the past four years she has been selling rice, oil, pepper, etc. in the local market. She makes a profit and has a large number of customers.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 46 years old, and live in Paynesville South, which is one of the more populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married with six children between the ages of 20 and 31, two of which are attending school and live at home. For the past 20 years she has been selling charcoal in the local market. She makes more profit some of the time, but most of the time business is slow. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plans for the future are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Alyona

texts.ru:
Алене 24 года, она замужем, детей пока нет. Уже 3 года как Алена самостоятельно занимается выращиванием ранних овощей в теплицах и на открытом грунте. Основные культуры для теплиц - помидоры и огурцы, для открытого грунта - картофель, кукуруза и капуста. По возможности Алена расширяет свою ферму, увеличивает площади, применяет новые технологии.

Сейчас Алена готовит теплицы к сезону.  Ей нужно закупить пленку, удобрения и материалы для мелкого ремонта теплиц. Благодаря кредиту Алена сможет получить доход с продажи ранних огурцов, помидоров и заработает на нужды семьи и бизнеса.
texts.en:
Alyona is 24 years old and married, so far without children. For the past 3 years, Alyona has been independently cultivating early vegetables in greenhouses and in the open air. Her main greenhouse plants are tomatoes and cucumbers, while potatoes, corn and cabbage grow in open ground. With every opportunity, Alyona grows her farm, expands the area under cultivation, and applies new technologies.

Presently, Alyona is readying her greenhouses for the growing season. She needs to buy plastic covering, fertilizers, and materials for minor greenhouse repairs. Thanks to this loan, Alyona will earn a profit from sales of early cucumbers and tomatoes, thus taking care of her family and of her business.

loans.use: to buy plastic greenhouse covering, fertilizers, and materials for greenhouse repairs

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр занимается выращиванием помидоров и огурцов на своем участке в с Водяное уже 16 лет. Живет с женой и дочерью в своем доме. Всего имеют два участка земли.

Последнее время в этом бизнесе появилась такая тенденция - летом резко падает цена на овощи. Поэтому Александр решил следать отопление,чтобы начинать торговать еще весной по более высокой цене. Ему нужно докупить уголь и пленку для утепления.

Александр - трудолюбивый и общительный человек. В планах на будущее - доделать отопление в новых теплицах, сделать еще один парник, закончить ремонт в доме.
texts.en:
Alexander has been cultivating tomatoes and cucumbers on his plot of land in the village of Vodyanoye for the past 16 years. He lives with his wife and daughter in their own house. The family owns two plots of land.

Recently, a certain pattern has developed in the farming business - the price of vegetables falls sharply in summer. For this reason, Alexander has decided to install heating in his greenhouses so as to be able to start selling his produce in spring at better prices. In addition, he needs to purchase coal and plastic covering for greenhouse insulation.

Alexander is a hard-working and sociable person. His future plans include installation of heating systems in his new greenhouses, construction of a new greenhouse, and completion of repairs in his home.

loans.use: to install a heating system in his greenhouse and to purchase coal and plastic film

loans.name: La Esperanza 3 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Esperanza III está en su ciclo número 4, donde las 26 mujeres de este grupo está muy entusiasmado por salir adelante y trabajar para poder ayudar a su familia.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elva quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres.  Ha mejorado bastante, ya que se esfuerza siempre para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesita. Elva se dedica a la venta de asaditos (churrascos), y cuenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela gracias a que sus productos son muy ricos. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo para mejorar sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de palitos de brochetas, carne, mandioca y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus churrascos y teniendo los ingresos que la ayuda con su familia.
texts.en:
This group’s name is ”La Esperanza III” and is in its fourth cycle. All 26 women that are part of the group feel enthusiastic and want to get ahead and work to help their families.

One of the group’s members is Mrs. Elva, who was found to be living in poverty level 3 in the last survey she took. She has improved a lot, by working hard in order to give her family all they need. Elva sells “asaditos” [grilled meat, churrascos] and says that she has a good customer base that loves the taste of the food she makes. Her goal is to continue growing to improve her income and help her family.

Elva is requesting a loan to buy skewers, meat, cassava and other supplies needed to continue preparing her churrascos and generating income to help her family.

loans.use: to buy skewers, meat, cassava and other supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Semillas De Esperanza Group

texts.es:
DUO SEMILLAS DE ESPERANZA
