ESTE DUO ESTA CONFORMADO POR DOÑA ANA DELFINA, MUY RESPONSABLE, LUCHADORA Y TRABAJADORA, DOÑA ANA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE CERDOS Y CONCENTRADO DE CRECIMIENTO, ELLA LLEVA YA MAS DE SEIS AÑOS DEDICANDOSE A ESTA LABOR YA QUE EL AREA DONDE VIVE ES APROPIADA PARA ESTA LABOR Y TAMBIEN ESTOS ANIMALES TIENEN MUCHA DEMANDA EN EL MERCADO SAN MARTINECO, Y SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE CERDOS Y CONCENTRADO PARA LA CRIANZA Y ENGORDE.
texts.en:
Semillas de Esperanza Duo

This duo is made up in part of Ana Delfina. She is very responsible, a fighter and hardworking. Ana is asking for the loan to buy pigs and growth concentrate. She has spent more than six years now doing this work, since where she lives is appropriate for it, and these animals are much in demand in the San Martineco market. She is asking for the loan to buy pigs and feed concentrate to raise them and fatten them up.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Dúo Joyas Valiosas Group

texts.es:
DUO JOYAS VALIOSAS

ESTE DUO ESTA CONFORMADO POR DOÑA FILOMENA DE 43 AÑOS DE EDAD DESDE HACE YA MAS DE CINCO AÑOS SE HA DEDICADO A LA ELABORACION DE COSTURAS A MAQUINA Y ES MUY RECONOCIDA POR EL BARRIO, YA QUE ES BIEN RESPONSABLE PARA ENTREGAR SUS TRABAJOS ELLA SOLICITA EL CRDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE TELAS PARA COSTURAS Y MATERIALES PARA COSER.ESPERA QUE LE PUEDAN AYUDAR CON EL CREDITO SOLICITADO.
texts.en:
Joyas Valiosas Duo

This duo is made up in part of Filomena, who is 43 years old. For more than five years now, she has been making items on a sewing machine and she is very well known in her neighborhood. She is very responsible delivering her work. She is asking for the loan to buy fabrics and other materials for sewing. She hopes to get help with the loan she has asked for.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make traditional weavings.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Sijense Group

texts.es:
La señora Marta de estado civil casada, cuenta con 40 años de edad, ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos que no estudian, ella se dedica a la confeccion de prendas de vestir, inició este negocio confeccionando con máquinas domesticas y hasta el momento tiene 10 años de experiencia en confeccionar; también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien tambien se dedica a confeccionar.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamos que lo utilizará para la compra de una máquina industrial, en el futuro quiere ver su negocio grande y contar con empledos para producir mas prendas de vestir y vender por mayor. Los demás integrantes de grupo se dedican tambien a la confeccion de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Marta is 40 years old and married. She didn't have the opportunity to go to school. She has 2 children who are not in school. She works making clothing and started this business with household machines. She has 10 years experience sewing and has her husband's support. He also sews. 

She is organizing a group to ask for loans that she will use to buy an industrial machine. IN the future, she wants to see her business grow and have employees to produce more clothing and sell wholesale. The other members of the group also work making clothing.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Manan

texts.en:
Manana is a 44 year old woman.  She lives in Asureti village, Tetrtskaro district with her husband and two children who are students.  

The family has two milk cows, two calves, two pigs and ten chickens.  They milk the cows to make cheese and sell it together with piglets and eggs locally at the markets.  In addition, Manana is working as a babysitter for a small monthly income.  She requested a loan to purchase two calves and to renovate a cattle shed.  She will grow the calves and later milk them to produce more cheese and increase the family income.  Increased family income will be used to renovate the house so the family can have better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase two calves and renovate a cattle shed

loans.name: Tarlan

texts.en:
Tarlan was born July 6th, 1970 into a family of farmers.  She is married and the mother of two children ages of 12 and 21.  She currently works with livestock.  Since 2003 she has worked on breeding cattle as well as farming.  Her husband helps her with her work. 

Not only does she have practical experience with livestock, but also theoretical skills.  She treats her responsibilities with great respect.  As a result of hard work her spouse was able to build a market where they can sell milk products.  She now has 2 cows, one calf and has a small barn where she has everything required to keep cattle.  Tarlan has applied for a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy one cow with its calf to increase her income from selling them.

loans.use: To buy one cow with its calf.

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya is 48 years old and married.  She has a son and a daughter who are both married.  Her son & his family live with her. 

Nadiya is engaged in agriculture, she is in this business for more than 15 years.  Her husband, and her daughter-in-law help her with the business. When Nadiya's daughter was getting married, to provide her with a decent dowry she sold almost all of the cattle in the stable.  Two years ago she was able to increase the number of animals.  Currently she raises animals and farms. 

She has a very honest and goal oriented personality.  Everything that she has achieved is thanks to her diligence.  She plans to have a big herd and to enlarge the stable for cattle.  She came to Kiva partner VFAC for a 500 AZN loan for repairs.  Nadiya wants to improve her housing conditions.  She related how she would like to increase sales, improve her family's well being and ensure that her children will have a bright future.

loans.use: To improve housing conditions.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is a 43 year old woman from Kilgoris.  She is married to Joseph and supports a family of eight people.  She is blessed with six children aged between  21 and 10 years old respectively.

Rodah is a farmer within her location she has been doing this for the last 20 years and makes a monthly income of KES 40,000.  She is taking her third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more farm inputs and pay for laborers.  She will use the anticipated profit to grow her business into a large scale.

She has a dream of growing her business such that she will earn extra income that will help her support her family and pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, pay laborers and ploughing

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa live in Paynesville, that is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  She is 40 years old, and she is married with four children between 6 and 22 years old.  They are in school and live at home. 

For the past 20 years she has been selling palm oil, salt, onion, vita, etc in the local market.  She started this business with a little amount received from her husband.  She enjoys the buying from her customers and money that she generates from her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, salt, onion, vita, etc to enlarge her business.  In the near future she wishes to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, salt, onion, vita, etc to enlarge her business,

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
San francisco es un grupo muy trabajador, y lo demuestra ya que están en su ciclo numero 14. Todas las integrantes están muy contentas de formar parte de este desafío. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y muestra que necesitan de seguir trabajando.
Limpia es una de estas mujeres, quien cuenta que tiene una modesta peluquería, en la que trabaja todos los días atendiendo de una buena manera a sus clientes. Comenta que empezó tímidamente, pero que después fue ganando terreno y hoy en día ya tiene una clientela bien formada, que siempre va junto a ella y son muy fieles a su salón. La meta de Limpia es seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo, y es por eso que solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, spray, tintes, y demás insumos para poder seguir dando un buen servicio  a sus clientes.
Este crédito también la ayudará a invertir en su trabajo y de esa forma tener mejores ingresos para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
San Francisco is a very hardworking group, demonstrated by the fact that this is their 14th loan cycle. All the members are very happy to be part of this challenge. They are doing the eliminate poverty survey and it shows that they need to continue working.

Limpia is one of the women in the group. She has a modest hairdressing business. She works there every day and serves her customers well. She says that she started small, but over time she gained ground and now she has a strong customer base who use her service regularly and are very loyal to her salon. 

Limpia’s goal is to continue working, as she has done until now. For this reason she is requesting this loan, in order to invest in the purchase of shampoo, rinses, sprays, dyes and other supplies. This will enable her to keep providing her customers with a good service.

The loan will also help her to invest more in her work so that she can improve her income and keep helping her family.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, rinses, sprays, dyes, etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is married with five children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family (relatives). She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for 8 years, selling to all categories of people. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works at the market and sells both on wholesale and retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.   Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to sell on a wholesale basis only and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 34 years old and lives in Paynesville, one of the populated areas in Montserrado County; she is married and has three children between the ages of one and 12 years old. They all live at home, and only two attend school. She was unfortunate not to attend school, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is a businessman. From 1998 she has been selling foodstuffs like rice, pepper, oil, vita, salt and other item in the local market,. Now she faces no problem. She sells every day and spends 8 hours on her business, which she started with the little income she received from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, salt and other items for her business. She hopes to build herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, salt and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to rebuild her working capital by purchasing clothing for resale.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: El Sr. Marcelo  tiene 22 años casado, el se dedica a la venta de comida  junto a su esposa quien es la que elabora la comida y el Sr. Adrian le ayuda a vender ellos tiene un puesto de venta en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad de El Alto,  Este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución El Sr. Marcelo  va a usar este préstamo para Invertir en la compra de una lap top para su uso personal que también lo usara para su negocio en registrar sus ventas diarias,   Su razón para solicitar este préstamo por la falta de capital, El Sr. Marcelo  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos, para la elaboración de sus comidas, El Sr. Marcelo  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo  brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que les permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Marcelo, 22, is married and makes a living selling food alongside his wife, who makes the food, and Adrian, who helps him with the sales. They have a stall on a very busy street in the city of El Alto.

This is his first loan with the institution. Marcelo will use this loan to invest in the purchase of a laptop for his personal use. He will also use the laptop for his business by registering his daily sales. His reason for applying for this loan is his lack of capital. 

Marcelo will use his earnings to continue buying ingredients to make his food. Marcelo is a very hardworking person. He is happy and grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him, since this business is the only activity which allows them to maintain themselves.

loans.use: to buy a laptop.

loans.name: Santiago Aurelio

texts.es:
Aurelio tiene 28 años de edad su estado civil soltero vive con su familia vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos
La VRC  Solidaria, se 
encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Gabriel, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Aurelio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y a la crianza de animales como los patos, cerdos, pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida. 

Con la ayuda del cerdito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura. La compra los realiza en Ventanas.  El sueño es comprar un terreno. Los desafíos a los que enfrenta es  a las plagas del   cultivos. En su tiempo libre le gusta cocinar. Hacer deportes.
texts.en:
Aurelio, 28, is single and lives with his family in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. His rural solidarity group is located in the village of San Gabriel in the canton of Ventanas. Its members make a living in the fields of agriculture and livestock.

Aurelio works in agriculture, planting corn, and rice, and raising animals such as ducks, pigs, and chickens. He has applied for this loan to buy urea, liquid pesticide, and insecticide. 

With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy necessary agricultural supplies. He buys his products in Ventanas. His dream is to buy a plot of land. The challenges which he faces are infestations in his crops. In his free time he likes to cook and play sports.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquid pesticide, and insecticide.

loans.name: Kelyn Cecibel

texts.es:
Kelyn, decide optar nuevamente por otro crédito, por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio de la tienda, lo cual le servirá para la compra de churros, sodas, pan, cereales entre otros.
Con el anterior préstamo mejoraron sus ventas y por ende aumentaron sus ingresos, al igual un crecimiento en la clientela, también la optimización económica de su familia y del negocio.
texts.en:
Kelyn has decided to apply for another loan due to the necessity to invest further in her business, which is a store. This loan will help her to buy churros, sodas, bread, and cereal, among other products.

With her previous loan, she improved her sales and therefore increased her earnings. Her clientele also grew and she was able to improve her family's finances and that of her business.

loans.use: to buy churros, sodas, bread, and cereal, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to rebuild her working capital by purchasing clothing for resale.

loans.name: Luvenia

texts.en: Luvenia is 36 years old and lives in the Paynesville South area of Monrovia. She and her boyfriend have a six-month-old child. She is a college student, and she has been selling palm oil in the local market for the past seven years. She makes a lot of profits and has many customers, so she is requesting a loan to buy more palm oil for her business. Her plans are to build a house and to educate her child.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 40 years old, a single mother of four children. She runs a retail shop, and this has been her income-generating business for the last six years. She receives an average monthly income of KES 40,000. She has taken out a loan of KES 30,000 to buy more stock for her retail shop, including plastic containers, brooms, face towels, sugar, wheat flour and tea leaves. She anticipates receiving increased profits, which she will use to expand her business by adding more items to meet client demand. Elizabeth hopes and dreams of improving her living standards and being financially stable; she also wants to save money to enable her to pay college fees for her children, as well as to expand her business to a general goods wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy goods to restock her business inventory.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is married with five children who are all school-going and he is in charge of paying their school fees plus meeting all the basic needs of the family. He is into an agricultural trade business and it is from this that he has managed to take care of the needs of his family. In addition to agricultural trade, Tadeo trades in local brew commonly known as 'waragi' to supplement his income.

He wants a loan of 2,000,000 UGX. With the loan he will be able to renovate his residential house that is in a sorry state as witnessed in the picture. Apparently he is not safe from rodents like rats and ants which access his house easily due to the aged wood. He also wants to renovate the leaking roof because the children are continuously hit by rains, more so in this rainy season. 

His dream is to construct a permanent house for the family in the near future. He will use the proceeds from his business to repay the loan. He still has challenges of limited capital and the fluctuation of agricultural products on the market. In the photograph is Tadeo with the UGAFODE Credit officer.

loans.use: To renovate his residential house.

loans.name: Tuniyaton

texts.en:
Tuniyaton is a Javanese artisan who specializes in tooled leather handbags and accessories. She would like to invest in the purchase of leather to continue with her production. She has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is her story:

"My father died when I was born and mother did her best, but I only went to elementary school. I married and we had three children. A friend who sold leather inspired me to sell raw leather and leather goods. In 2011, I lost my youngest son to brain cancer. Life was so difficult. My first and second marriages failed. Now, my focus is on my children and the people who work with me, as well as designing and crafting leather goods. Both of my children are also involved in this venture, and I love seeing them continuing what I worked so hard to get started."

"I am so grateful for the opportunity to receive this microcredit to buy material. This will help me a lot to make my small business grow, and you will soon see my new products. Thank you for all your support; it means a lot to me and all the people who work with me."

Use the link below to view Tuniyaton's leather handbags and accessories on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8467

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of leather to continue with her production.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 31 years old and lives in the Paynesville South area of Monrovia, which is one of the populous parts of Montserrado County. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have an eleven-year-old who is in school and lives at home. For the past ten years, she has been selling vegetable oil in the local market. She makes lots of profits and has many customers, so she is requesting a loan to buy more vegetable oil for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetable oil for her business,

loans.name: Hermelindo

texts.en:
Hermelindo is a Guatemalan artist who would like to invest in brushes, canvases and oil paints to create more paintings. He has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"I remember well my first painting, watercolor on paper. I still recall my father's words: 'My son is going to be an artist!' I come from a village of artists, many of whom are well known and they inspired me to walk on this path of life. Part of my work requires research on my ancestral Maya culture. To them art held a place of great importance and they left many teachings that should be adopted and transmitted from generation to generation."

"Many thanks to all of you for helping me and many other artists. This microcredit will help me continue working and creating. An artist's life can be very difficult. It depends on whether you like our work and, when sales are slow, it can be hard to feed our families. I hope you continue to support us artists from around the world."

Use the link below to view Hermelindo's oil paintings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7325

loans.use: to invest in brushes, canvases and oil paints to create more paintings.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.es: Rosemary desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche trabaja diariamente con el fin de apoyar el bienestar de su familia ayudando a su esposo con el sustento diario, para entre los dos cumplir el sueño de darle a su hija estudios profesionales de calidad con el fin de que sea exitosa. Rosemary no trabaja de empleada, pues  tiene  en su domicilio su propio negocio, mediante el cual vende artículos de miscelánea como papelería bisutería, productos de papelería, perfumería, calzado y todo aquello que le solicite su clientela. Su miscelánea o variedad inició desde hace 6 años y con disciplina, calidad en el servicio y oportunidad en la oferta de productos lo ha podido sostener. Rosemary compra cada vez en mayores volúmenes porque su clientela se ha ensanchado y esto hace que esté pendiente rápidamente de la mercancía que mas rota para irla a mercar, hay artículos como las papelería que necesita estar en sus inventarios constantemente y esto es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cartulinas, lápices, esferos, cuadernos, temperas, hojas , sacapuntas, pastas con argollas etc. Con su nueva inversión espera ampliar su capital de trabajo, flexibilizar sus procesos de compra y aumentar las posibilidades de conseguir precios que trasladará a sus clientes fieles con el fin de lograr nuevas y permanentes compras.
texts.en:
Rosemary works every day from 7 am to 9 pm in order to support her family’s wellbeing. She helps her husband with the daily sustenance, and together they want to make their dream come true: to give their daughter access to higher education so that she can be successful in the future.

Rosemary is not employed, but she runs a business at home selling varied supplies, such as stationery, imitation jewelry, perfumes, shoes and other items that her customers might order. She opened her store six years ago and with discipline, and good and timely service she has been able to keep it going. Rosemary buys increasingly large amounts because her customers are hooked. She carefully follows the stock levels of those items that have a faster turnover in order to buy them on time. Stationery items, for instance, are constantly sought after, so she must keep them in stock.

This is why she is requesting a credikiva to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the first time. She will buy cardboard, pencils, pens, notebooks, tempera paints, paper sheets, pencil sharpeners and covers, among other things. With this investment, she hopes to expand her working capital, make her purchasing process more flexible and improve her bargaining possibilities, which will benefit her loyal customers and result in new and continuous sales.

loans.use: to buy cardboard, pencils, pens and other stationery items.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: Betty's Group is composed of nine hard-working women. Betty is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Betty has been working hard to manage her poultry farm. To help expand her business, Betty has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicks and chicken feed, and it will help Betty to generate greater profits and improve her family’s welfare. Betty hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. Betty is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married and has six children, only four of whom go to school. She also takes acre of additional family members (two cousins). She has a business selling local gin and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy more jerry cans of local gin. She generates additional income from renting out rooms. She works in a shop that handles rentals and also sells on both a wholesale and retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires to build more rental rooms and also to acquire a delivery van to facilitate transportation. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more jerry cans of local gin for her business.

loans.name: Bukurije

texts.en:
Bukurije lives in Kosovo with her husband and their three children, who are between the ages fifteen to nine years old. All of them are attending school. Bukurije has been operating a tailoring business for more than 7 years. She makes tablecloths, curtains, skirts and dresses for her local customers. She really enjoys her work. Her husband works in construction.

Bukurije is requesting a loan in order to do renovation for her business and to buy a new sewing machine. She works a lot to earn a living. She hopes to earn a higher income and to expand her business in the future. She is happy for the financial support because it helps her to secure a stable future for her family. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To renovate her business and buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is a married housewife and the mother of five adult children. She lives in a southern part of Kosovo in the Ashkali community. This family is very poor and lives in unacceptable conditions. Their house is small and during the rainy season and winter time they have a problem with the windows and doors. The main source of income comes from her husband who works in construction for a very low salary. 

Mira is in need of a loan to buy windows and door frames and to renovate her house. The loan will help her to improve their living conditions. She hopes in the future to offer a better life to her children. Mira is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for improving the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy windows and door frames and to renovate her house.

loans.name: Elizabeth G.

texts.en: Elizabeth is 42 years old, and lives in Congo Town in Montserrado County which has the largest Free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have three children between 4 and 22 years old that live at home and attend school. In the market she has been selling bread, oil, and milk. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business allows her to save more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, bread and milk for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, bread and milk for her business.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, tiene una granja de pollos de engorde. Ella tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su esposo de 48 años y con sus 3 hijos los cuales estudian y las edades de 5, 8 y 15 años.
Ella posee una pequeña granja de pollos en donde tiene 3 años de existir, trabaja todos los días y esto lo aprendio desde joven con su mama. El préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de 100 pollos pequeños, concentrado y vitaminas, también para el mejoramiento de las instalaciones del negocio (granja).
Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos y aumentar el inventario. Su objetivo es fortalecer el negocio, ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida su familia.
texts.en:
Ana has a farm for fattening chickens.  She is 46 years old and lives with her 48-year-old husband and her three children who are in school.  They are 5, 8, and 15 years old.  She has had her small chicken farm for three years and works every day.  She learned this as a young woman from her mother.  

She will use the loan to buy 100 small chickens, concentrate, and vitamins.  She will also use it to improve the facilities of her business (the barn).  This investment will help her to increase her income and grow her inventory.  Her goal is to strengthen her business and to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy 100 small chickens, concentrate, and vitamins.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla is 30 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Free-port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with four children between 1 and 13, who attend school and live at home. She has been selling rice, oil, garlic, soap, etc. for the past 4 years. She started this business with money given to her by her mother, she also learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, garlic, soap, etc. for her business. In the future she wants to build house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, garlic, soap, etc for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 40 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is married with 8 children that are living on their own. She has been selling palm oil, beans, rice, garlic, etc. for the past three years. She says her main challenge is the transportation costs. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her money and it makes her proud that it enables her to take care of their home. She is requesting this loan to purchase more palm oil, beans, rice, garlic etc. to enlarge her business. She hopes to build a house for their family in future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, beans, rice, garlic etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna is 24 years old and lives in Paynesville, one of the more populated areas in Montserrado County. She and her boyfriend have a four year old who is currently in school and they all live at home. Since 2010 she has been selling palm oil, rice, pepper and bitter-ball in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper and bitter-ball for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper and bitter-ball for her business.

loans.name: Jeton

texts.en:
Jeton is married and has two children. They live in a southern part of Kosovo. Jeton works in a car wash. He is the family's main source of income. They are very poor and live in very bad conditions. The money he generates is not enough to pay for the renovation of his home. His house has not had any repairs or renovation for several years. 

The house needs immediate renovation of the windows and doors. Jeton asked for a loan to renovate the windows and doors. This loan will help him to keep his house warm during the wintertime, which is very beneficial for his family. He hopes in this way to improve the family's living conditions. He is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy windows and doors.

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: Alimatou est une jeune dame de 37ans qui vit avec son conjoint chauffeur et leurs enfants à Lomé. Elle exerce son activité de revente des produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique et s’approvisionne chez les grossistes au grand marché de Lomé. Afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES pour achat de marchandises. Le profit tiré de la vente lui permettra de renforcer son activité  et d’assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Alimatou, age 37, is a young woman who lives in Lomé with her spouse, a driver, and their children. She runs a general food store, and she buys her merchandise from wholesalers at the Grand Market of Lomé. 

She is seeking a first loan from WAGES to meet the needs of her customers. She will use the funds to stock up on merchandise for her store. 

The profits earned will help her to strengthen her activity and to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy general food products for her store.

loans.name: Yamah

texts.en: Yamah is 31 years old and lives in Paynesville South, one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is unmarried and her boyfriend is a businessman. They have two children, an 8 month old and a 10 year old. One of them is currently in school and they both live with their parents. For the past three years Yamah has been selling charcoal in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is 32 years old and lives in Paynesville South, one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She and her children's father live together with their four children, ages 10, 12, 14 and 17, who all currently attend school. For the past three years she has been selling dried fish in the local market. She makes a lot of profit and has many customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase dried fish for her business. Her plans are to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her business.

loans.name: Welleh

texts.en:
Welleh is 33 years old, single, and has two children who attend school.  She lives in Montserrado County, which is the largest free port and commercial county in Liberia.  She has been operating a shop for 15 years where she sells coal, oil, onions, rice, peppers, etc.  She started this business with help from her friends and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that every day she makes a profit. 

Welleh is requesting a loan from BRAC, which she will use to purchase more goods such as coal, rice, onions, peppers, and oil for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as coal, rice, onions, peppers, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 41 years old and lives in Paynesville, one of the populated areas in Montserrado County. She is married and has four children between the ages of 6 and 19 years old. They all live at home and attend school. Esther was unfortunate and did not attend school, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is a businessman. 

For the past three years Esther has been selling soft drinks in the local market. She sells every day and spends 12 hours a day with her business. She started this business with a little money she received from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks to sell. She hopes to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: José Mauricio

texts.es:
José tiene 64 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica  a la crianza de ganado, rozar caña de azúcar; también realiza viajes a distintos lugares en su pick up cuando lo contratan otras personas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 1,000 ladrillos, cemento, arena, entre otros materiales para construir las paredes de su casa y una pila para almacenar agua.  De esta manera su casa estará más cómoda, ventilada y segura.
texts.en:
José is sixty-four years old, is in a relationship, and has two children.  He makes a living in raising livestock and in clearing land for sugar cane.  He also makes trips to different places in his pick-up truck when other people hire him to do so.  

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy 1,000 bricks, cement, sand, and other materials to construct the walls of his house and a cistern to store water.  In this way, his home will be more comfortable, ventilated, and safe.

loans.use: to buy 1,000 bricks, cement, sand, and other materials to construct the walls of his house and a cistern to store water.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 39 years old and lives in Congo Town in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Musu is married with two children, ages 4 and 15 years old, both of whom are in school and live at home.  

For the past 4 years Musu has been selling fufu made with cassava. She started this business with money given to her by her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that she makes a good profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fufu for her business. In the future she wants to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more fufu for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
12 mujeres forman el grupo Mujeres unidas de la ciudad de Ybycui, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, de donde se muestra que una de las miembros está por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marcelina, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, y comenta que ya tiene muy buena clientela, que se ha formado con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo. Marcelina desea que con el tiempo pueda tener un puesto grande donde poder tener una mejor comodidad para sus clientes y también eso le va a ayudar a tener mayores ganancias.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carne, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende y así también poder seguir deleitando a sus clientes.
texts.en:
12 women make up the Mujeres Unidas (United Women) group in the city of Ybycui.  They are completing the survey for poverty elimination, where it is shown that one of the members lives below the poverty line.

One of the members is Señora Marcelina who makes a living selling food of all kinds and says that she already has good customers, which she has formed with much sacrifice and effort.  Marcelina hopes that over time she will be able to have a large place that has greater comfort for her customers, which will also help her to get higher profits.

She asks for this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of vegetables, meat, seasoning, and other ingredients to continue making the food that she sells and thus also continue pleasing her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, seasoning, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 48 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Sarah is single with four children between the ages of 2 and 13, all of whom attend school and live at home. 

She has been selling rice, oil, candy, biscuits, etc. for the past 5 years. She started this business with money given to her by her boyfriend, and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her a good profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, candy, biscuits, etc. for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, candy, biscuits, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 69 years old, married and blessed with four children aged 29, 25, 22 and 17 years respectively. He is a farmer who started farming 30 years ago and earns 120,000 KES from farming each month. 

He has requested a fifth loan worth 75,000 KES to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs to prepare for the planting season. He dreams of becoming a renowned farmer in this region.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs to prepare for the planting season.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en: Lili is a 46-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows breadfruit and taro, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Lili has requested a loan to help her pay her children's educational bills. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, she hopes to provide her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, shovels, gloves and weed killer.

loans.name: Korpo

texts.en:
Korpo is 39 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Korpo is married and has seven children between 11 and 23 years old, who all live at home and attend school. 

For the past ten years Korpo has been running a small shop where she sells charcoal, oil, pepper, biscuits, candy, peanuts, rice and soap. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. The business helps her to save more money. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, oil, pepper, biscuits, candy, peanuts, rice and soap for her business. Her plans are to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, oil, pepper, biscuits, candy, peanuts, rice and soap for her business.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
El señor justo  es originario del estado de Veracruz, es una persona dedicada a su trabajo y a su familia; en el pasado ha tenido créditos con KIVA los cuales ha utilizado  para invertir en su negocio. Ahora esta solicitando un préstamo para  terminar la construcción de un cuarto  en la parte alta de su casa, ya que será para sus hijos que son adolecentes y  desea brindarles más comodidad  y para que cada uno tenga su propio espacio y privacidad en la casa. 
El señor Justo y su esposa la señora Antonia tienen ya más de 12 años dedicándose a su negocio el cual empezó con un pequeño puesto de venta de tacos y ha ido creciendo con el paso del tiempo. Ahora tiene 3 camionetas equipadas para la venta de tacos de barbacoa.   Con los ingresos de su negocio planea pagar el préstamo sin descuidar los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hijos. También desea  seguir ayudando a otros miembros de su familia a quienes les da empleo en su negocio de venta de tacos de barbacoa.
texts.en:
Justo is from the state of Veracruz.  He is very committed to his work and his family.  In the past, he has received loans from Kiva which he has invested in his business.  He is requesting this loan to finish building a room on the upper floor of his house.  This room will be for his teenage children who he would like to provide with more comfort so that each one can have their own space and privacy in the house.

Justo and his wife Antonia have been working in their business for more than 12 years.  They started out with a small taco stand but the business has grown over the years.  They now have three small trucks which are fitted out for selling beef barbacoa tacos.  With the income from his business, Justo plans to repay his loan and cover both his family expenses and his children's school expenses.  He would also like to continue helping other members of his family by providing them with jobs in his taco business.

loans.use: to finish building a room on the upper floor of his house

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Ayawa vit avec son conjoint retraité et leurs enfants à Lomé. Âgée de 53ans, elle se bat chaque fois pour permettre à sa famille de mieux s’épanouir.  C’est pour cela, elle revend des produits d’alimentation générale à domicile. Elle s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé  et n’arrivant plus à satisfaire ses clients, elle fait un premier prêt à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Elle souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer le bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
Ayawa, age 53, lives in Lomé with her retired spouse and their children. She strives to ensure her family’s well-being. To that end, she sells general food products from her home. She buys her merchandise at the Grand Market of Lomé. 

Unable to meet customer demand, she is seeking a first loan from WAGES to replenish her stock. 

She wants to expand her activity and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals and other general food products for resale.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is 76 years old and married with 10 children. She runs a small business selling cabbages and cucumbers in her community and has been doing this for many years. Malia has requested a loan to buy new tools for her business. She joined SPBD many years ago to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Malia will expand her business to provide her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, vegetable seeds, a wheelbarrow and gloves.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
Brigida de 60 años, esta casada con Eusebio de 65 años ,con quien tiene 4 hijos. Posee una vivienda construida a base de material noble como fruto de muchos años de trabajo y esfuerzo.
Al caracterizarse como una mujer de amplia capacidad laboral logró abrir un negocio en donde se dedica a la venta de diversas prendas para vestir.Todo inició al hallarse desempleada y con la necesidad de aportar firmemente a la economía de su hogar y gracias a la motivación de su esposo y con un capital acumulado abrió su puesto en una mini feria local ubicada en su localidad .
Comenta que optó por este rubro al ser una actividad sencilla y porque la mercadería a comercializar no es perecible a diferencia de los otros negocios,  además de ser  un negocio que le permite hacer muchas amistades a medida que expende sus productos los cuales adquiere en la ciudad de Lima al por mayor, motivo por el cual realiza un  viaje mensual para abastecer su negocio.
A medida que van pasando los años espera ahorrar lo suficienta para aperturar una tienda en otra ubicación de la ciudad, logrando de esa manera brindar una mejor atención  a su fiel clientela quienes son principalmente personas dedicadas a actividades agrícolas.Para esta ocasión requiere contar con 4,000 nuevos soles esperando adquirir un lote de prendas de vestir el cual incluyen pantalones, blusas, polos y uniformes escolares.
texts.en:
60-year-old Brigida is married to 65-year-old Eusebio, with whom she has four children.  She owns her own home which, through many years of hard work and effort on her part, she has managed to build from solid materials.

Brigida describes herself as a woman with a great capacity for work and, as such, when she found herself unemployed and needing to provide for her household, she responded to encouragement from her husband and used a little money they had saved up to open a stall in a small local market in her town.

Brigida says that she chose her business because it is a simple one and because the merchandise is not perishable unlike that which is sold in other businesses.  In addition, it is a business that allows her to make many friends while she sells her products, which she buys wholesale in the city of Lima.  She makes a monthly trip to the city in order to stock her business.

Over the years, Brigida hopes to save up enough money to open a store in another location in her town so that she can better serve her loyal customers, who are mainly farmers.  On this occasion, Brigida needs to borrow 4,000 soles so that she can buy a consignment of clothes which includes pants (trousers), blouses, polo shirts and school uniforms.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: complete the construction of a bedroom

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 27-year-old woman who is married with a child. She has a small business, serving the public with bus transportation. She has many years of experience with this business. 

Gloria needs a loan to buy tires, oil, engine oil and brakes for the bus. She will use her profits to help her family's income. Gloria joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, oil, engine oil and brakes for the bus.

loans.name: Toefuataina

texts.en:
Toefuataina is a 39-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro plants and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Toefuataina has requested a loan to buy equipment and fertilizer for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Toefuataina hopes to save more money to pay her children's school fees and to extend her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives and fertilizers.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: El Señor Juan es un pequeño agricultor dedicado a la siembra de frijol, y maíz tiene más de diez años de experiencia en tal actividad, la zona objeto de inversión es optima para el establecimiento y desarrollo de este rubro por ser suelos fértiles y con buen drenaje, el requiere de fuentes de financiamiento para la siembra de sus cultivos, pago de alquiler de terreno así como para compra de alimentos para sus familias ya que las fuentes de ingresos son las ventas de sus cosechas con lo cual pagan sus deudas dejando una cantidad de la cosecha para completar sus gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Sr. Juan grows beans and corn, a job he’s had for more than ten years.  The land where he plans to invest more money is very good for agriculture as it is fertile and has good drainage. Juan requires a loan so he can plant more crops, pay the rent for the land, and also buy food for his family. His income comes from selling his produce, and at this time he will pay off his debts leaving part of the money for household expenses.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies, pay rent for his land, and buy food

loans.name: Santos Evaristo

texts.es:
El Señor Santos es un pequeño agricultor dedicado a la siembra de frijol, trigo y maíz tiene más de veinte años de experiencia en tal actividad, esto porque desde pequeños sus  padres  lo incursionaron en la siembra de estos rubros de gran valor nutritivo en la dieta de los nicaragüense ya que el primero constituye el ingrediente básico para nuestro famoso gallo pinto y los dos últimos para elaborar las ricas tortillas los cuales son infaltable en nuestros alimentos.

 Agradece a personas que apoyan esta noble causa con préstamos para que agricultores emprendedores puedan cumplir sus sueños sin esta oportunidad no podrían crecer o por lo menos mantener el sustento de sus familias.
texts.en:
Santos is a small-scale farmer who grows beans, wheat and corn.  He has more than 20 years experience in this line of work because his parents started him growing these crops when he was young.  They are highly nutritious foodstuffs which form an important part of the Nicaraguan diet as beans are the basic ingredient of the traditional dish 'gallo pinto', and wheat and corn are used to make the delicious tortillas which are indispensable to Nicaraguan cuisine.  

Santos is grateful to the people who will support him in his noble cause by providing loans to entrepreneurial farmers so that they can fulfill their dreams.  Without this opportunity, they would be unable to grow their businesses and support their families.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, to pay the rent on his land and to buy food

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 40 years old. She is running a kiosk, and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as papaws, bananas, tomatoes, maize and onion. Her husband is a teacher.

She is making a good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: To buy papaws, bananas, tomatoes, maize and onions.

loans.name: Poposavaii

texts.en:
Poposavaii is 54 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling pork buns in her community, and has been doing this for four years. 

Poposavaii has requested a loan to buy everything she needs to make pork buns. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Poposavaii will plan to expand her business and to save more money for a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, cooking oil, a frying pan and pork.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia de 59 años , esta casada con Tito con quien tiene dos hijos . Juntos residen en una vivienda construida a base de material noble  como fruto de muchos años de esfuerzo y dedicación.A manera de elegir un rubro con el cual fuera posible sacar adelante la economía de su hogar al igual que su esposo, optó por dedicarse a la venta de prendas de vestir.Lleva casi 35 años en el rubro y en todo este tiempo ha logrado consolidar su negocio como un buen sustento para su economía familiar.
Todo comienza con seleccionar las diversas prendas de vestir para luego transportarlas hasta las zonas aledañas a su localidad logrando obtener buenos precios , lo complicado de su labor según narra es el tema del transporte puesto que posee una  pequeña lesión en las piernas la cual limita su normal desempeño, no obstante siempre cuenta con el apoyo de los transportistas pero a pesar de los inconvenientes se siente muy contenta con lo logrado y espera seguir teniendo una salud estable para lograr sus objetivos los cuales incluyen contar con una tienda propia en donde pueda seguir ofreciendo su mercadería de manera más cómoda.Recurre a MFP con la esperanza de contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería consistente en pantalones Jeans, polos de algodón y uniformes escolares.
texts.en:
Delia is 59 years old, married to Tito, and has two children. They live together in good solid house, the result of hard work and dedication. In order to work in a job that would help the family’s finances and improve their prospects, Delia chose to earn her living by selling clothing, a job she’s now had for 35 years. During this time it has become a successful business providing a source of income for the family.

All begins with a selection of various clothes which are then transported to nearby areas to sell at good prices. The problem is, according to Delia, the transportation. She has a small injury to her legs which limits her normal level of activity. However, as she can always count on the drivers to help out, she feels very happy with what she has achieved. She hopes that her health will stay stable so she can reach her objectives which include having her own store where she can sell her merchandise in a more comfortable manner. 

Delia is hoping that MFP will provide her with a loan of 2,000 soles to buy merchandise such as jeans, cotton t-shirts, and school uniforms.

loans.use: buy jeans, cotton t-shirts, and school uniforms

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as noodles, eggs, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, sugar, coffee, books and cigarettes. 

She opened her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of $500. Leonora is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, eggs, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, sugar, coffee, books and cigarettes.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 44 years old and married with two children who are currently in school. Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Elma runs a charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Elma has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Elma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 56 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Melissa buys and sells recycled materials in the Philippines, and requested a 26,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials to sell.

Melissa has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Melissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials to sell.

loans.name: Juana Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Juana es comerciante de mariscos en las costas de masachapa en san Rafael del sur, compran el producto a personas dueñas de lanchas que diario se aventuran mar adentro para pescar las diversa especies de mariscos de los cuales solo una parte de ello es vendido en panas el resto son entregados en acopios para venderlos a un precio mejor en los mercado convenidos.

 En dicho negocio tiene un experiencia de más de quince años y fue heredados de su familia las cuales se dedicaban al comercio de mariscos. Es por tal motivo que requiere de financiamiento para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana sells seafood on the Masachapa coast in San Rafael del Sur.  She buys her produce from people who own fishing boats which they take out to sea every day to fish for different types of seafood.  Only some of their catch is sold to individuals.  The rest is delivered to processing plants where they will be sold on for a higher price in pre-established markets.

Juana has more than 15 years experience in her business which she inherited from her family who also sold seafood.  She needs this loan in order to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy seafood

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Marco Antonio esta solicitando un préstamo para la construcción de una losa de concreto y acabados del exterior, ya que por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar la materia y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
El señor Marco Antonio es empleado de una empresa trasportista como chofer de un camión de carga, es como genera los ingresos para sacar a su familia adelante ya que tiene dos hijos de edad escolar, el mayor esta estudiando la preparatoria y su pequeña hija esta en preescolar. 
El señor  Marco Antonio  y su esposa la señora Ana Maria quien es la persona que lo esta acompañando en la foto desean que sus hijos un patrimonio seguro y en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio is applying for a loan for the construction of a concrete slab and finishing touches for the exterior of his home since at the moment he does not have the necessary money to buy the materials nor to pay the person who performs the home improvements.

Marco Antonio is employed by a transport company as a freight truck driver. This is how he generates an income to keep his family going since he has two school-aged children. The oldest is studying in preparatory school and his small daughter is in preschool.

Marco Antonio and his wife, Ana Maria, who is the person accompanying him in the photo, wish for a financial future that is secure and in good condition for their children.

loans.use: to create a concrete slab in the backyard and apply finishing touches to the exterior of the home.

loans.name: Khosrow

texts.en:
As a young professional soccer player in Italy, Khosrow never dreamed he would one day be a business owner in the US.  After living in Italy and France for 35 years, Khosrow wanted to provide a better life with more opportunity for his daughter and moved his family to the US in 2002.  It was not an easy move, but the struggle to start a life in a new country empowered Khosrow to start his own business. 

Having lived in the south of France for many years, Khosrow had a deep appreciation for the specialty tablecloths and napkins from the Provence region.  His enthusiasm sparked a business idea—to provide quality tablecloths and impeccable service to Americans. Khosrow’s idea quickly flourished into a successful local shop, Desire. 

The recent recession pushed Khosrow to move his business to farmers’ markets and close his shop in 2007.   Although a major decision, Khosrow found that he still retained much of the business he had established and enjoyed the personal interaction with customers at the markets.  His daily motto is, “If you are good and honest, people come back to you.”

However, in 2008, more disaster struck.  A break-in occurred at Khosrow’s warehouse and over $97,000 in inventory was stolen.  Devastated, Khosrow picked up what was left of his business and started over using all that he had left.  His loyal clientele stood behind him and bit-by-bit Khosrow was able to regain some of his losses.

Since then, Khosrow has continued to work almost every day selling his specialty tablecloths, napkins and other Jacquard fabrics from Provence.  With this Kiva loan, Khosrow will be able to purchase more inventory to be able to open another booth at a secondary market every day, reaching more customers.  Khosrow’s goal is to hire an employee and teach them his daily motto and the benefits of being a smart business owner.

loans.use: to buy more inventory and open a second booth at the farmer's market

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Help Patricia purchase additional bounce houses and update her company's website to better serve her clients!

Patricia has always loved working with children and has always enjoyed seeing kids have fun. In 2009,  she decided to begin her own business, All Star Bounce Inc, a company that organizes thematic and recreational parties for children.  While she began her business with just one bounce house, she now has over 40 houses and employs three part-time contractors. Patricia is looking to expand her business and wants to update her website to provide online ordering for her clients.

Visit Patricia’s website: http://www.allstarbounce.net.

This loan will help Patricia purchase new equipment and build her website.

loans.use: To purchase more bounce houses and a computer to maintain invoices.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as crosscut chicken, papaws, onions, eggplants and cabbages. She opened her kiosk in 2007 with her own working capital of $50. Cecilia is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy crosscut chicken, papaws, onions, eggplants and cabbages.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Wilma is borrowing 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials like bamboo, wood and fishing net for her fishing business.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials like bamboo, wood and fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена торгует детской одеждой и обувью. Работает на базаре в качестве рыночного предпринимателя уже 14 лет. У нее свое собственное торговое место для работы. 
Елена планирует использовать полученные от КИВА средства суммой в 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить товар к весеннему сезону под реализацию, а именно платья, кофты и легкую удобную обувь.
texts.en: Yelena sells children's clothing and shoes.  She has worked as a trader in the bazaar for 14 years and she has her own trading stall.  Yelena plans to use her Kiva loan of 10,000 hryvnas to buy goods for the spring season on a wholesale basis, especially dresses, sweaters and light walking shoes.

loans.use: to buy wholesale goods for the spring season, especially dresses, sweaters and light, comfortable shoes.

loans.name: Marlene Heleodora

texts.es:
La Sra. Marlene vive en Guayaquil, tiene 34 años. Empezó esta actividad porque le gustaba hacer artesanías en fomix, poco a poco se dio cuenta que podía ganar dinero por hacer algo que le gusta. Tambien tiene otra actividad que comenzo para tener mas ingresos que es vender almuerzos. 

Actualmente realiza su trabajo todas las mañanas organizándose en ir a comprar al mercado, para poder cocinar temprano y entregar los almuerzos a tiempo, las ventas de las artesanías lo realiza en sus tiempos libres o en ocasiones en la tarde.

Le dificulta de su trabajo el transito en las calles ya que la atrasa un poco para poder entregar los almuerzos y las artesanias en fomix.Esta casada, su esposo se dedica al alquiler de un vehículo y labora como taxista. Tienen 3 hijos en los cual dos de ellos estudian en colegio fiscal puesto que la otra hija tiene dos añitos. 

Con el prestamo quiere comprar viveres para hacer almuercos y fomix. Lo que quiere lograr en el futuro es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y con el tiempo poder tener un bazar con las hermosas artes que elabora.
texts.en:
Marlene, age 34, lives in Guayaquil.  She started this business activity because she liked making crafts from ‘fomix’ [craft foam].  Little by little, she realized that she was able to make money by doing something that she likes.  She also has another business activity that she started in order to get more income.  She sells lunches.

She now works every morning, organizing herself to go to the market to make her purchases.  She does this in order to be able to cook early and to deliver the lunches on time.  She sells her crafts during her free time or sometimes in the afternoon.

The difficult part of her work is the traffic on the streets.  This slows her down a bit in being able to deliver the lunches and the fomix crafts.

She is married, and her husband rents a vehicle and works as a taxi driver.  They have three children.  Two of them attend public school, and the other daughter is two years old.

She wants to use the loan to buy supplies to makes the lunches and fomix.  What she wants to achieve in the future is that her children continue their education.  In time she wants to be able to have a store with the beautiful crafts that she makes.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make lunches and fomix.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 49 years old. She is a widow with three children. It's been five years since her husband died due to cardiac arrest. Gemma stands as both father and mother to her three children.

Gemma manages her fish-selling, hog-raising and corn farm businesses. She is thankful with God because through her patience and hard work, she is able to manage her businesses well.

Gemma's gained income goes toward their daily necessities, allowance of her youngest child and maintenance to her hog-raising and farming business.

This time, she struggles with a shortage of income due to an abrupt increase in their household and hog-raising expenditures. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), which will allow her to buy additional kilograms of tilapia for her fish-selling business. She hopes to get this amount of loan to educate her youngest child and sustain all their basic necessities in life.

loans.use: to buy additional kilograms of tilapia for her fish-selling business.

loans.name: Mitchel

texts.en:
Help Mitchel reach more clients by purchasing online advertising and building a website for his auto-repair shop!

It was always Mitchel’s dream to own his own business. In October 2011, the young entrepreneur opened Mitchel’s Auto Glass Corp, a home-based car repair, glass tinting and auto detailing company. Mitchel gains many of his contracts by working closely with insurance companies to assist customers in replacing windshields, mirrors and door windows. He additionally does his own signature work for clients, adding tinting and detailing aesthetic designs to auto-bodies. 

Mitchel operates his business from his home and works out of his van, paying house visits to his clients. Because he runs a mobile business, Mitchel reports that the greatest challenge has been the weather, as he is unable to replace glass or do detailing work in the snow or rain. Mitchel hopes to eventually open his own auto-body shop in order to expand his business and be able to work year round.

Mitchel needs a loan to purchase advertising materials, build a website, and buy more tools and materials in order to better serve his clients.

loans.use: To purchase online advertising and build a website and to buy needed tools

loans.name: Shelfa

texts.en:
Shelfa works hard to support her family. Shelfa is married and has a dried fish business in the Philippines.

Shelfa requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Shelfa has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Shelfa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Help Luis recover from Hurricane Sandy!

Luis emigrated to the U.S. from Puebla, Mexico over 22 years ago. He worked as a gardener in New York City until 2011 when he decided to invest all of his savings to open a general discount store in Coney Island.  Luis’ business was thriving and provided Luis enough to support his wife, three children and his mother, who still lives in Mexico. Then Hurricane Sandy struck New York City. Luis’ store has been closed ever since. 

Both the store front and Luis’ entire inventory were completely ruined. While the landlord is covering the costs of the building repairs, Luis needs a loan to repurchase his lost merchandise so that he can once again open his store.

loans.use: To re-open store and buy inventory to restock shelves after loss from Hurricane Sandy

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 58 years old and a widow with two children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy-and-sell charcoal business for ten years and also earns an income from raising pigs and poultry. Evelyn aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Enhbat

texts.en:
Mr. Enhbat is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three sons in a house in Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife Dulamjav, age 40, has just started running a used clothes retail business. His sons Buyanjargal, Buyantogtoh and Buyanhishig study at local schools. 

The borrower has been a herdsman for years and over the last few years of harsh winters and lack of forage, his livestock has decreased a lot. His wife started business to increase the family income and he is now requesting 800,000 MNT to purchase forage and vitalized food for his livestock and support his wife's newly starting business. Both the borrower and his wife are welcoming, hardworking and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase forage and vitalized food for his livestock and support his wife's newly starting business

loans.name: Yair

texts.en:
Help Yair purchase inventory to expand his local pharmacy!

Interested in owning his own business and contributing to his community in Hialeah in Southern Florida, Yair opened Alcazar Pharmacy over seven months ago. Originally from Cuba, Yair has always dreamed of being his own boss. Alcazar Pharmacy is already seeing success and Yair currently has four employees.  

Yair now needs a loan to purchase inventory in order to expand his pharmacy and take his business to the next level. 

Yair hopes to continue to grow his business to create more jobs for his local community.

loans.use: To purchase inventory to increase supply of medicines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es: Dionicia de 38 años , está casada con Félix , con quien tiene 3 hijos pequeños . Posee una vivienda construida a base de madera en donde comparte sus vivencias familiares.Inicialmente se dedicaba a la producción de cacao y café orgánico pero con el paso del tiempo y con la necesidad de brindar una buena educación a sus hijos optó por reunir capital suficiente y proceder con la apertura de una tienda de abarrotes .Dionicia lleva 4 años en este negocio y gracias al apoyo de su familia ha logrado habilitar un ambiente en su vivienda .Es así que considera a está actividad muy rentable , a su vez le permite compartir más tiempo con sus hijos quienes aun necesitan de todo su apoyo.En un futuro desea ampliar su negocio y lograr el sueño de iniciar la construcción de su vivienda a base de ladrillos y cemento.En esta ocasión requiere contar con 1,000 nuevos soles y abastecer su negocio con la compra de abarrotes como son fideos, gaseosas, enlatados de pescado, arroz y azúcar esperando incrementar su clientela.
texts.en:
Dionicia, 38 years old, is married to Felix, with whom she has three small children. She owns a home constructed of wood where she shares her family experiences. 

Initially, she worked in the production of cocoa and organic coffee but with the passing of time and the necessity of providing a good education to her children, she opted to raise sufficient capital and proceed with the opening of a grocery store. Dionicia has worked for five years in this business, and thanks to the support of her family, she has been able to carve out a business space in her home. This is why she considers this activity very profitable. At the same time, it allows her to share more time with her children who still need all of her support. In the future, she wishes to expand her business and achieve her dream of beginning the construction of her home with bricks and cement. 

On this occasion, she requires 1,000 Nuevo Soles to stock her business with the purchase of groceries such as noodles, soft drinks, canned fish, rice, and sugar, hoping to grow her clientele.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Virginia Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora Virginia desde muy pequeña se vio en la urgencia de desarrollar la habilidad de hacer negocios porque sus padres vendían mariscos en panas para el sustento de su familia hoy en día es también una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos para su hogar, ella vende en las costas pescado por libras o chuleteados a personas que se dedican al comercio en panas en la zona de Managua y san Rafael del sur. 

Hoy en día requieren de fuentes de financiamiento para poder resolver la demanda de sus clientes que cada día son más las personas que se dedican a este tipo de comercio por ser un producto de alto contenido de omega tres que ayudan a la prevención de enfermedades del organismo.
texts.en:
Virginia had to learn how to work and do business at a very early age in order to help her parents who sold seafood to support the family.  That same business is now one of the main sources of income in Virginia's own home.  She sells cleaned fish by the pound to salespeople in Managua and San Rafael del Sur.

Virginia needs a loan in order to meet customer demand for her products.  More and more people are starting to work in this business as the produce is high in Omega 3 which helps prevent disease.

loans.use: to buy seafood

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Nenita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing equipment for her business

loans.name: Lycie

texts.en:
Lycie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lycie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Lycie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Dulce requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. She has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Dulce would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Namuun-Aizam

texts.en:
Namuun-Aizam is 25 years old lives with his wife and son in a ger in the Hentii province of Mongolia. His wife, Tuya, is 27 years old and works at a local grocery store. Namuun-Aizam's son, Erhembayar, is five years old and goes to a local kindergarten. Namuun-Aizam has been working as a carpenter and he also works from time to time making furniture at home during his free time.

Namuun-Aizam is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase inventory for his new business making traditional Mongolian furniture items at home. He is a hardworking, diligent, and positive man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to make traditional Mongolian furniture items at home

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is a married parent with three children. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Crisanta works hard to support her family. She has been sustaining her business activities through her previous 19 loans from NWTF.

Crisanta is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business. In the future, she hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en: Wilfredo, 59, is unsatisfied with the income from his 'sari-sari' business because it is not enough to cover the family's necessities. With this in mind, he is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, vinegar, cooking oil and soft drinks.  He hopes that someday, they will experience a better standard of living through the enhanced income from his business.
