She considers her work a bit exhausting, but at the same time quite energizing, as she has managed to get to know all kinds of people and make herself very well known through the sale of her items.

Her long-term goal is to open a large store in the same business line, as she knows her customers' needs. On this occasion she needs to have 3000 nuevos soles so that she can buy more merchandise, such as glasses, cutlery, trays and other kitchen utensils.

loans.use: To buy dishes, cups, pots and other household utensils.

loans.name: Buyan

texts.en:
Mr. Buyan is 36 years old and still lives with his wife and daughter, in a house in Bayanhongor province, Mongolia. His wife, Nyamhuu, helps her husband to run their family business. They sell clothing and general consumer products, at rental counter in the local market.

Borrower has been running his business since 2006. He has a lot of experience and regular customers. Now, he is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase seasonal inventory to sell to local customers. He is a hardworking and honest man, who says "My daughter will soon be a university student, and we need to save from now on, for her further education."

loans.use: to purchase seasonal inventory to sell to local customers

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a single mother with three children, all of whom are still attending school, her oldest son at an institution of higher learning. She is 43 years old and lives in Bitabago trading center with her children.

Alice has a stall in the trading centre where she sells matooke, pumpkins, sugar cane, cassava, yellow bananas, etc. She is also an agriculturalist specializing in crop farming. She works seven evenings a week at the stall, and six days a week in her garden. Alice started the stall as a way to pay tuition fees for her children and provide for the basic needs of the family.

Describing herself as a hardworking lady, Alice hopes to enable all of her children to achieve the highest levels of education from her available sources of income, and plans to build rentals in Bitabago trading centre to earn additional income. She needs this loan specifically to pay tuition for her son.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has operated her welding business for more than five years. She is married and has two children. Mary Jane's spouse is her helper in running her welding business. She is glad because her spouse is supportive in every decision in her life.

Mary Jane aspires to have a better way of living, to improve her financial stability, and to have a stable source of income. To make her dreams possible, she is seeking a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will allow her to buy a welding rod, a round bar, a flat bar, and a sander for her welding business. She believes that through complete materials and good service provided to her customers, she can earn more income and attract more customers. Mary Jane is hoping that her welding business will grow to be able to sustain her family needs and improve her financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy a welding rod, a round bar, a flat bar, and a sander for her welding business

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 31 years old, married, and has two children. She is a hog-grower and a vendor, too. From her businesses, she gains about PHP 5,000 each month, just enough to sustain meals for her family and revolving capital in the business. 

She hopes to keep improving her income. That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to invest in her food stall. She will buy meat, fish, vegetables, and hot dogs, to cook and sell. 

Flordeliza hopes to keep improving her sales and gain customers' loyalty that will help her achieve financial stability someday.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, vegetables, and hot dogs, to cook and sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa, de 42 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Evaristo y sus hijos en su casa propia ,la cual fue comprada hace algunos años. Desde las primeras horas del día se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas donde siembra diversos productos como: papa, maíz y demás alimentos, su principal ayuda se la brinda su esposo, “juntos nos dirigimos a los terrenos agrícolas, ahí realizamos diversos trabajos como quitar la maleza de los surcos o abonar los alimentos”, afirma. El trabajo lo realiza de lunes a sábado pues los días domingos vende comida en la feria del pueblo donde obtiene un ingreso extra. Ahora desea mejorar sus sembríos ya que dentro de poco podrá cosechar y vender a buen precio.  Este es el primer préstamo con KIVA y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual, a su vez agradece la oportunidad financiera ya que le ayudará a mejorar su actividad agrícola. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles para la compra de abono orgánico para mejorar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Elisa, 42, is a hardworking woman living with her husband, Evaristo, and their children in a house of her own that was bought some years ago.  She heads out to her fields at the day's first hours where she grows various products like potatoes, corn and other foods.  Her husband is her main helper.  “We head out to the fields together to do various chores like weeding and fertilizing the foods,” she affirms.  

She works Monday through Saturday because on Sunday she sells food in the town’s street market earning extra income that way.  Now, she wants to improve her crops because she’ll be able to harvest soon and sell at a good price.  

This is her first loan with Kiva and she commits to make her payments punctually.  At the same time, she’s grateful for the financial opportunity since it will help her improve her agricultural work.  On this occasion, she’ll request 1,500 soles to buy organic manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Pueblo Viejo Group

texts.es:
La señora Irma Yolanda de estado civil casad, de 49 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educacion primaria, ella se dedica a la venta de medicina, inicó este negocio trabajando como comadrona en la comunidad, hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un prestamo que lo utulizará para la compra de medicamentos para surtir su negocio, en el futuro quiere tener una farmacia grande; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio y a tienda de artículos de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Irma Yolanda is married and 49 years old. She completed all six years of primary education. She works selling medicine, and started her business working as a midwife in her community. She so far has ten years of experience and the support of her husband, who works in retail.

She has organized a group  in order to request a loan, which she will use to purchase medicine to stock her business. She wants to have a large pharmacy in the future.

The other members of this group work in retail and have a store that sells staple goods.

loans.use: to purchase medicines.

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria is a 57-year-old, married woman, and a mother of four grown children, from Getafe, Bohol. She is engaged in buying and selling bamboo. Bamboo is used for house renovations, in a typical Filipino house. Her husband works as a farmer.

Cesaria is asking for a loan to buy more bamboo to sell. In the future, Cesaria hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing (RTW), in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her RTW business. She has been in this business for seven years. She earns additional income from a restaurant.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money, to expand her buiness in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready-to-wear clothing stock to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.en:
Etelvina lives in Dili with her family. She opened her fruits and vegetables stall in 2011 with 250 USD of her own money. She is earning a good income from her business.

Etelvina is applying for a 1000 USD loan from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy produce such as eggplant, papaws, onions and other vegetables. Her ambition is to see her business grow bigger with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy produce for her stall.

loans.name: Maia

texts.en:
Maia is 34 years old, from a small village in the Sachkhere district. She is married and lives with her husband and two children who are10 and 12 years old. Maia requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, without any success. Her loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular they have a plot of agricultural land, where maize and haricot are grown. Manana’s husband cultivates the land and does all the agricultural works to insure a good harvest. In addition they have a milking cow. Manana milks the cow and produces dairy products. It is hardly enough to supply food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Maia requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of a business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Maia will begin selling cheese. She plans to purchase cheese from the wholesalers and then resell it at higher prices in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. This will be hard to do for the young woman, but this will increase the income of the family and she will do her best to improve the living conditions of her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase cheese.

loans.name: Félix Noel

texts.es:
Félix Noel es un joven Sauceño, trabajador padre de familia de una niña que a temprana edad empezó a trabajar como obrero fuera del Sauce para poder ayudar a su madre, ya que son personas de escasos recursos pero muy decentes y honrados.

Desde la edad de 14 años se fue a trabajar a El Salvador para recoger y comprar un moto taxi y así poder venirse a su país con el fin de tener su propio negocio y no andar rodando fuera de su hogar.

Después de tantos años de sacrificio y con la ayuda de los créditos hoy logró comprar una Moto taxi con la que puede hacer viajes a las diferentes comarcas aledañas al municipio lo que ha mejorado sus ingresos, además que es menos cansado porque ya no tiene que dar pedal en el trici taxis para brindar este servicio.

Se siente muy agradecido con los inversionistas de Kiva porque gracias a estos créditos que le han otorgado a través de Ceprodel hoy tiene su propia vivienda y su medio de trabajo por el cual que lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para comprar repuestos para mejorar aún más la moto taxi con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Félix Noel is a young man from El Sauce.  He’s a hardworking father of a little girl. He started working at a very young age as a laborer outside of El Sauce to be able to help his mother since they are people of scarce resources but who are very decent and honest.  He went to work in El Salvador at the age of 14 to earn money to buy a mototaxi and then return to his country to have a business of his own and no longer roam about abroad.

After so many years of sacrifice and with help from loans he was able to buy a mototaxi that he’s able to make trips to various adjacent districts with thus improving his income.  In addition, this is less taxing because he no longer has to pedal a rickshaw to provide this service.

He feels very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the loans they’ve granted him through Ceprodel he now owns his house and has a means of working to provide daily bread at home.  He’s currently asking for a loan to buy spare parts to improve his mototaxi still more aiming at providing better customer service.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his mototaxi.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce habita doña Flora desde hace 12 años, originaria del caserío de las Mercedes ubicado a 14 km de dicho municipio quien decidió trasladarse a vivir a la parte urbana por el bienestar de sus hijos porque iniciarían el estudio en la universidad, además que quería iniciar su propio negocio para generar sus propios ingresos.

Decidió dedicarse a vender granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, sorgo y maíz y adquirió un pequeño tramo en el mercado municipal donde trabaja en conjunto con su esposo.

La mayoría de sus clientes son las comerciantes que elaboran tortillas y venden frijoles cocidos las cuales le compran al por mayor este tipo de granos.

Por la gran demanda que tiene doña Flora está necesitando un financiamiento para invertir en más granos como arroz, sorgo, maíz y frijoles y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

Pide la ayuda a los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le otorguen este financiamiento y así poder llevar a cabo su inversión. 

Agradece por el apoyo que pueda brindarle esas  personas de buen corazón que ponen un granito de arena para la superación de las personas de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Flor has lived in the municipality of El Sauce for 12 years.  She’s originally from the hamlet of Las Mercedes located 14 kilometers from said municipality.  She decided to move to the urban zone for her children’s well-being because they were about to start university; in addition, she wanted to start her own business to generate her own income.  

She decided to start selling basic grains like rice, beans, sorghum and corn.  She acquired a small space in the municipal market where she works with her husband.  Most of her customers are merchants who make tortillas and sell cooked beans and who buy these types of grains at wholesale.  Because of the high demand, Flor needs financing to invest in more grains like corn, sorghum, corn and beans to meet customer demand.

She’s asking for help from Kiva lenders so that the loan will be granted through Ceprodel so she can carry out her investment. She’s grateful for the support good-hearted people may provide who contribute their little grain of sand so that people of scarce resources can improve.

loans.use: to buy rice, sorghum, corn and beans.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina, de 41 años es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora vive en compañía de su esposo José, ambos tiene 7 hijos, pero solo viven con 4 de ellos en la casa que heredó hace 20 años. Ella se dedica a la agricultura por está razón siembra papa, maíz, olluco, habas , entre otros. Comenta que este es su principal actividad económica ya que desde muy joven comenzó a sembrar en los terrenos que le fuerón heredados y en los que ahora trabaja con mucho esmero, “de los 7 días de la semana me quedo 3 días en Lima, donde comercializo mis alimentos y si no me alcanza compro de otros agricultores, así  logró obtener mayor ganancia”, comenta alegre, además posee 6 vacas lecheras de las cuales elabora queso para que también los comercialice.Este es el primer préstamo con KIVA, durante todo este tiempo demostró responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas, agradece está oportunidad financiera ya que le ayudará a mejorar. 
Paulina, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para así mejorar sus cultivos, pues en esta campaña espera obtener buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Paulina is 41 years old. She is a simple and hardworking woman. She lives with her husband José and together they have seven children, but only four of them live with them in the home they inherited twenty years ago. She works as a farmer, growing potatoes, corn, ulluco, and fava beans, among other crops. She says this has always been her main business, since she started farming at a young age on the plots of land that she inherited, which she still works on with much dedication. "Out of the seven days of the week, I spend three of them in Lima, where I sell my products. If I run out, I buy from other farmers. That way I manage to obtain a higher profit," she mentions joyfully. She also owns six milk cows and makes cheese to sell. 

This is her first loan through Kiva. During all this time she has proven to be responsible in paying her installments. She appreciates this financial opportunity because it will help her improve. Paulina will invest the money in buying organic fertilizer so that she can improve her crops, and she expects to obtain good results this season.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Bacley Tatiana

texts.fr: Bacley est une femme de 27 ans , mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle possède et gère un comptoir de vente de vivres secs (arachide, oignons, riz, huile de palme et raffiné, etc)dans un quartier de la ville depuis 1 an et demi.ce crédit va lui permettre de renforcer son stock de marchandises afin d'augmenter ses ventes et ses profits. les bénéfices ainsi générés vont lui permettre d’accroître son activité (diversification de produits) et de contribuer à l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Bacley is a 27 year old woman, married, and the mother of three children. She owns and manages a booth where she sells food (peanuts, onions, rice, refined palm oil, etc.). Bacley has been running her booth in a district of the city for the past year and a half.

This loan will allow her to increase her stock of merchandise with the aim of increasing her sales and income. The income Bacley generates with her loan will enable her to expand her business through product diversification. She will also be able to help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 42-year-old businesswoman. She is married to Obadiah and blessed with three children. She has been selling sweaters and blankets for the past seven years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

After being introduced by an existing client to KADET, Beatrice is applying for a 30000 KES loan to buy more sweaters and blankets to sell. She intends to plow her increased profits back into the business.

Beatrice’s hopes and dreams are to expand her business and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more sweaters and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 42-year-old, married woman, and the mother of six children. She is a farmer and has been in the rice farming business, together with her husband, for more than 10 years. This is the source of their income.

Maria is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. In the future, Maria and her husband will be able to improve their farm and their harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
Aisha's group is comprised of two hard-working, young women. Aisha is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mityana, in Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past three years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her fish pond, where she produces and sells fresh fish. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase feed and chemicals for the fish, and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and expand the business into a very big fish pond. Aisha hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy land and build a house. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase feed and chemicals, to use in her business of fish farming

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: El joven Joel  tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres. Con sacrificio el término la carrera de administración de empresas ya que comenta que quiere brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres. El sueño de Joel es dejarles un buen patrimonio a sus padres de tercera edad ya que en la casa que actualmente viven, está muy dañada en cuanto a cables eléctricos y teme por la vida de ellos. Es por eso que necesita ayuda por medio de kiva para poder realizar una reinstalación eléctrica a su vivienda y brindarles seguridad a las personas más importantes en su vida; sus padres.
texts.en:
Joel is 27 years old, is single and lives with his parents.  Through his sacrifices he was able to complete his degree in business administration.  He says that he wants to be able to provide a better quality of life to his parents.  His dream is to provide a comfortable life for them in their old age.

In the house where they currently live, the electrical wiring is heavily damaged, and he fears for his parents' lives.  For this reason he needs help through Kiva so that he can replace the electrical wiring and thus provide greater security for his parents, who are the most important people in his life.

loans.use: to replace the electrical wiring in his home.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 26-year-old, married man. He has a child, who is three years old. He operates a retail business, selling baked goods, which he delivers by motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 14 years. His business is located at a viable business area, and his primary customers are local residents from the peri-urban area around Nairobi.

He says his biggest business challenge is stiff competition within the area. He will use the KES 21,370 loan to buy a water dispenser and a television. His business goal is to improve his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will run a bakery and be the best supplier of cakes in his area. George has taken three previous loans from SMEP DTM, which he has managed to repay successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water dispenser and a television

loans.name: Ndoro

texts.en:
Ndoro is married and lives with his wife and six children, three of whom attend school, while three are still too young for school. Ndoro has his own business of grinding maize for flour, which he bought with a lot of effort. His wife also works for the family business and helps him with the household expenses.

They live in their own home. Thanks to the work they are doing, they are able to buy everything they need for the family. He is seeking a loan to buy fuel for his machinery and maize that is greatly needed for his posho mill business.

loans.use: to buy fuel for his machinery and maize.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana is 57 years old, married and had four children. Two are still in college. Valeriana makes use of her skills in sewing curtains and school and office uniforms for income. She has been in the business for over 10 years now and still wants to improve it. 

She is now asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to invest in her business and keep improving her output. She will buy threads, scissors and fabrics to use in her business. 

Someday, Valeriana hopes to maintain good sales and income to keep extending better services to all her customers. This will also help her achieve the financial security necessary to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy threads, scissors and fabrics to use in her business.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, 39, runs a shop in front of her house near a school. Students and many other customers come by to shop and buy, as her business is in a strategic location. She is making good money.

Juliana is applying for a 600 USD loan from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) which she will use to buy more stock for her shop such as noodles, coffee, oil, sugar, cookies, salt and shampoo. Anticipating greater profits, she hopes to take a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Antoine Gilbert

texts.en:
Antoine lives in Les Cayes, the capital of the South Department of Haiti with his wife and child. He has had a business in the city for 3 years and he has started to sell clean energy products with EarthSpark. He was really interested in selling kerosene stoves as many people in Les Cayes use charcoal stoves which are not only expensive, but cause pollution and are bad for their users’ health. He wants to continue to sell clean energy products because they contribute to protecting the environment in Haiti.  
With his first Kiva loan, Antoine was set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills. He used this “business in a bag” to launch a clean energy entrepreneurship with EarthSpark. He sold out of his products so quickly that he has paid off his loan and is now coming back to us for another loan. This time, he would like to continue his business and is asking again for 
400 USD. With this money, he will continue to sell kerosene stoves.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52-year-old lady who is a widow and a mother of seven children, five of them being over 18 years old. The last two are 10 and 14 years old respectively. She is from Kisumu District.

Mary has selling secondhand shoes and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more stock of shoes for ladies to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children and also to expand her business.

She has a dream of having a big business since her children are almost completing their education

loans.use: she wants to purchase ladies shoes for sale

loans.name: Medgar

texts.en:
Medgar is 22 years old, from the small village of Chiatura district. He is married and lives with his wife and parents. Several times, Medgar requested loans from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, the family has 0.45 hectares of agricultural land where different kinds of products are grown. In addition, they have three milking cows. Medgar’s wife milks the cows and produces dairy products for sale. The income is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Medgar requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits, with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high risk borrowers' because of low income. 

With the received credit, Medgar will trade in animals. He plans to purchase cows from the wholesalers and then resell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase cows to sell.

loans.name: Lillian's Group

texts.en: Lillian is a thirty-five-year-old mother of nine children and is a dryland farmer. Her husband is a farmer, too, and they grow maize, cowpeas, coconuts and cassava. Their agricultural endeavors are hindered by pests, but they lack the money to buy pesticides. Lillian is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program because, as she says, "I heard of the benefits I will get if I plant trees from KOMAZA." With the profits from her tree farm, Lillian plans to educate her children and to purchase a dairy cow for milk sales in her village. Lillian enthusiastically shares, "The trees KOMAZA is giving farmers grow fast, and I love it."

loans.use: To pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is a 43-year-old farmer from Getafe, Bohol. She is a married woman and has seven children. She works in the farm with her husband. Teodora is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm and its harvest.

Teodora hopes of expanding her farming business so that it will generate more income necessary for the needs of her family, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is married and has four children who are young and depend on her. She lives with her husband in Tiribe, Kenya.
Zuhura is an artisan who has been involved in weaving since she was very young. This gives her a good income. She learned the profession from her mother, who is also a weaver. Zuhura has been weaving for 3 years.
Zuhura says she has very good hands for handicrafts. She says that she sells her products in Tiribe and Mombasa. Her neighbors say she is responsible and hardworking, important values for making progress in life.
She is applying for the loan in order to purchase thread, needles, dyes and additional materials that are essential for weaving. She is thankful to Yehu Microfinance Trust for the opportunity it has given her.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, dyes and additional materials that are essential for weaving.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a 42-year-old married man with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. For seventeen years now he has been a teacher and he was inspired into service by his desire to nurture young people. To supplement his low salary he practices farming and grows mainly food crops and sells the surplus. Price fluctuation and unpredictable weather conditions affect his crops while his dream is to expand his agricultural practices. Lawrence intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 27 años esta casada con Oscar de 31 años, con quien tiene un niño de tan solo 1 añito. Vive junto a su familia en una casa construida  a base de adobe .Actualmente Hermelinda cultiva y administra unas parcelas de cacao orgánico las cuales  heredo de sus padres para sustento de su familia.Lleva 7 años en este rubro y a su vez cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros .Comenta que le agrada su trabajo ya que tiene la oportunidad de brindar una oportunidad laboral a otros jóvenes de su localidad.Por otro lado cuenta  con el apoyo económico de su esposo quien se dedica a transportar pasajeros.Con el deseo de brindar un buen mantenimiento a sus cultivos desea contar con un apoyo financiero , para así proceder con el primer deshierbo a la campaña productiva, la cual es indispensable para optimizar la producción final.Tiene como objetivo a largo plazo mejorar  la construcción de su vivienda y asi brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.500 soles para contratar 4 trabajadores y proceder con el deshierbo a las plantaciones de cacao y a su vez se siente  agradecida el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo.
texts.en:
Hermelinda, 27, is married to Oscar, 31, with whom she has a child just a year old.  She lives with her family in an adobe house.

Currently Hermelinda grows and manages some plots of land of organic cacao that she inherited from her parents to support her family.  She has been in this field for seven years and also has the help of day laborers.  She says she enjoys her job because she has the opportunity of giving work to other young people in her town.  She also has the economic support of her husband, who makes a living in passenger transportation.

She wants some financial support to maintain her crops so she can proceed with the first weeding of the growing season.  This is indispensable to make the most of her final crop.

Her long-term goal is to improve the construction of her house to give her family a better quality of life.  Currently she's going to request 500 soles [PEN] to hire four workers to continue with the weeding of her cacao fields. She feels grateful for the financial support that she receives.

loans.use: to pay workers

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict is 51 years old and married to Susan who also contributes to the family income. He has been running his butcher shop for a period of about five years with an income of approximately KES.10,000.
This is his second loan after successfully repaying the previous loan. He wants to buy more beef to sell. He hopes to give his family a comfortable life and have a chain of butcher shops.

loans.use: to increase his quantity of beef to sell.

loans.name: Jasitas

texts.en: Jasitas is a 32-year-old married man with one child living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a sports and video hall which has been in operation for a period of two years. He says he started this business due to the demand of such services in the area and to develop himself and his family. He would like to work hard and become rich and then build a permanent house for their residence. Inefficient power supplies is the biggest factor affecting his business, while his dream is to buy a solar panel and install digital television services to attract more customers. Jasitas intends to use the loan to buy digital television services to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy digital television services to attract more customers.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 19 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in Uganda. For the past two years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small food business, in which she sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh foods such as pumpkins to sell, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and own another business in another center. Sarah hopes that in the future, she will be able to build rental houses. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods such as pumpkins to sell.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia es una mujer de 51 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que lamentablemente perdió a su amado esposo, desde entonces ella se ha convertido en el pilar principal de sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Dionisia no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar, en especial cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación Dionisia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, en especial frituras, como salchipapas, salchipollos, hamburguesas y otros, adicionalmente también trabaja alquilando una mototaxi a otros choferes que brindan servicios de transporte, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Dionisia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un pequeño puesto de ventas en el mercado central de su ciudad, de esta manera podrá conseguir mayor cantidad de clientes y podrá atenderlos en un lugar adecuado.
texts.en: Dionisia is a 51-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pisco with her two children, whom she loves very much and who are her main reason for living. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person. She dedicates all of her efforts to providing a better life for her family. Sadly, she lost her beloved husband. Since then, she has become the principal pillar of support for her children. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources she had to work from the time she was very young, so she was not able to pursue a degree in nursing. In her free time she likes to cook. She especially enjoys making the delicacy Carapulcra con Sopa Seca (a dish made with chicken, pork and noodles) to share with her family. On her own initiative, with much sacrifice and dedication, Dionisia runs her own small business selling fruit, especially fried items such as salted potatoes, salted chicken, hot dogs and hamburgers. She also has a business renting out a mototaxi to other drivers. She works every day for approximately 10 hours. She believes that things are going well thanks to the good flavor of her food and the friendly service that she provides to her customers. Dionisia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to purchase a small stand in the central market of her city. In this way she will be able to reach a larger number of customers and will be able to attend to them in a more suitable environment.

loans.use: to buy a stall for selling food.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
Isidora es una madre de amplia capacidad laboral, viuda y con la satisfacción de haberle brindado a sus 3 hijos una buena educación.Reside en una vivienda construida a base de material noble que construyó con el fruto de su esfuerzo.Gran parte de su familia tuvo incursión en las actividades agrícolas concernientes a la producción de cacao y café orgánico. No obstante al tener una pequeña oportunidad económica decidió cambiar de rubro e iniciar su propio negocio consistente en una tienda de abarrotes.
Lleva 4 años con su negocio y hasta el momento ha logrado consolidarlo a base de su esfuerzo.Le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que le ha permitido hacerse muy conocida y a su vez ganar muchas amistades.Dentro de los productos que ofrece ,las gaseosas y productos de limpieza personal son lo que tienen mayor demanda por esta razón desea contar con capital de trabajo para surtir nuevamente su negocio con mercadería.Su objetivo a largo plazo es terminar la construcción del segundo piso de su vivienda ya que desea alquilar habitaciones a profesionales que vienen a trabajar a la zona esperando de esta manera tener un ingreso fijo en su vejez..Con los 500 nuevos soles surtirá su negocio con la compra de gaseosas, jabones, y demás productos cuya demanda es mayor en su negocio.
texts.en:
Isidora is a hard-working mother and widow, who is feels satisfied to have given her three children a good education. She lives in a house build of wood and cement which she built with the fruit of her efforts. Many members of her family made a living in agriculture, producing organic cocoa and coffee. However, thanks to coming into a small amount of money she decided to change direction and begin her own grocery store business.

She has had this business for four years, and has today managed to make it successful thanks to her hard work. She really enjoys her work, since it has helped to to become well-known and make many friends. 

Of the products she offers, fizzy drinks and toiletries are the best-selling, which is why she wants working capital to restock her store with goods. Her long-term goal is to finish building the second floor of her home, as she wants to rent rooms to professionals who come to work in the area. She hopes that this will provide her with a fixed income in her old age. 

With the 500 new soles she will restock her business, buying fizzy drinks, soap, and other best-selling products in her store.

loans.use: to buy toiletries and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita raises hogs and grows rice in her local community of Pangal Norte Echague. She has been a hog raiser for four years. Teresita is 51 years old, married to a farmer, and blessed with one child.

Teresita aspires to have a stable source of income someday because she's getting old already, but she still has the resources and strength to manage her hog raising and farming business. Teresita makes sure that all of her efforts and strategies are effective in the realization of her goal.

Teresita would like to take out a loan of PHP 7,000, allowing her to buy the necessary hog feed and essential vitamins to her raise hogs. She hopes to get this loan so she can continually improve her hog-raising business and obtain a greater income for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy hog feed and vitamins for her raised hogs

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is requesting a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married and has four children. Maria is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as rice, noodles, cigarettes, milk coffee, sugar, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite and eggs. She opened her kiosk in 2006 with her own working capital of $200. Maria is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a larger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, cigarettes, milk coffee, sugar, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite and eggs.

loans.name: Jesibel

texts.en:
This is Jesibel, who has a variety store which she opened a few months ago. A previous loan with CCT was a big help in her business. She was able to buy additional sacks of rice and more cell phone credits. Her store is where she is focusing now, although she still sells electronic loads.

Jesibel is applying for a 35,000 PHP loan from CCT to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She feels that the more items displayed in her store the better and that greater profits will be the result. These will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this increase in profits with gladness and thankfulness in her heart and dreams of growing her business.

All CCT community clients are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy stock for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Mardonio

texts.es:
Mardonio tiene 58 años, viudo y con 4 hijos, posee una vivienda construida  a base de material noble.Inicialmente se dedicaba a las actividades agrícolas concernientes a la producción de cacao orgánico. Posteriormente optó por vender sus parcelas y se inicio en el oficio de planchado y pintado de vehículos .Es una actividad cuya paciencia y precisión son factores primordiales para lograr brindar un servicio de calidad.Le agrada mucho su trabajo puesto que a parte de generar buenos ingresos económicos para su familia puede estar al pendiente de sus hijos.
A manera de cumplir con el pago de un equipo de oxigeno para soldadura en general solicita 4,000 nuevos soles para cancelar su deuda pendiente y seguir trabajando con total normalidad ,a su vez se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .Su objetivo a largo plazo es culminar el segundo piso de su vivienda para ponerlo en alquiler y tener un ingreso fijo para su familia.
texts.en: Mardonio is a 58 year old widower. He has 4 children and owns a solidly constructed house. He used to grow organic coffee, but after his wife died he sold his land and started doing auto body work, repairing and painting vehicles.  This work requires patience and precision in order to provide quality service. He is very grateful for this job because, in addition to generating a good income, he is able to watch over his family. He is requesting a loan of 4,000 nuevos soles to pay off his outstanding debt for oxygen soldering equipment he purchased and continue with business as usual. He is committed to making his payments on time. His long term goal is to finish the second floor of his home so he can rent it out and provide a steady income for his family.

loans.use: pay off his loan for oxygen soldering equipment he purchased.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul, 34, is married and the father of two children. He has been a fisherman for the past six years, working hard to provide for his family.

Raul is applying for a 5000 PHP loan from CEVI to buy more fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other fishing gear. With new equipment he will be able to increase his catch and sell more at the market. His ambition is to make his business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more fishing gear.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 33ans, Akouwa vit avec son conjoint et leur enfant de 03ans à LOME. Pour prêter main forte à son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle revend du jus et des glaçons à domicile. Son souhait est de satisfaire une clientèle encore plus vaste c’est pour cela elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter un congélateur, de régulateur et de la glacière pour la vente de glaçon et de jus. Comme perspectives d’avenir, Akouwa veut agrandir son commerce et prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: A young woman, 33 years old, Akouwa lives with her husband and their 3-year-old child in Lomé. To help out her husband in covering household expenses, she sells juices and ice out of her home. Her wish is to satisfy her expanded customer base, so she is taking out a WAGES loan to purchase a freezer, and a valve, and cooler (insulated container) in order to sell ice and soft drinks. As for the future, Akouwa wants to expand her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer, a valve, and a cooler

loans.name: Hlm Ndiambour Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de HLM Ndiambour est créé depuis le 14 décembre 2008. Le groupe PS est constitué de trois femmes qui habitent le même quartier, elles sont très solidaires, elles mènent plusieurs activités dont la principale est le commerce. 

Madame Salimata la responsable, trésorière du Banc Villageois est très dynamique, âgée de 32 ans, c'est une femme mariée mère d'une filles et vit chez ses parents.Elle capitalise une bonne expérience, elle a démarré son activité bien avant d'intégrer le BV.Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite et a levé la main gauche. 


Elle s'active dans le commerce,achète ses marchandises( habits et produits cosmétiques)à Dakar en grande quantité pour revendre à des femmes commerçantes qui sont dans des villages aux alentours de la ville.

Son prêt reçu lui servira d'augmenter les produits cosmétiques et les habits pour satisfaire ses revendeuses et pour se faire encore plus de revenus.

Avec ses bénéfices elle participe aux dépenses familiales (santé, nourriture, habillement); renforce son épargne.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois of HLM Ndiambour was created on December 14, 2008. The group consists of three women who live in the same district and who are very supportive of one another. They are involved in several types of businesses, the principal one being commerce.

Salimata is the manager of the group, as well as the treasurer of the Banc Villageois. She is very dynamic, 32 years of age, and is a married with one daughter. She also lives with her parents. Salimata is an experienced merchant, and she started her business well before the Banc Villageois was formed. She is shown standing one the right in the photo, with her left hand raised.

Salimata is an active merchant, and purchases her supplies (clothes and cosmetics) in large quantities from Dakar. She then resells them to women merchants in the surrounding villages. Salimata plans to use her loan to increase her stock of cosmetics and clothing so that she can satisfy her clients and increase her income. With the income she earns from this loan, Salimata plans to help pay for her family's expenses (health, food, clothing), and increase her savings.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: I Made

texts.en:
I Made has been engaged in a service business, transporting goods by truck. The usual stuff to be transported are materials to build houses, such as stone, cement, sand, and wood. He started this business around the time he got married, four years ago. In this business pursuit, I Made is assisted by two workers who are paid on a daily basis, the amount depending upon the amount of work done during the day.

Today I Made received contracts for the procurement of stone, cement and sand, to build a store. He needs additional funding to meet customer demand. With his 3MM IDR loan, I Made can provide building materials quickly, to satisfy the customers. He will use the loan to purchase stone, cement and sand. He hopes his business can thrive and succeed. The profit of this effort will be saved, for venture capital for future endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase stone, cement and sand, to supply to his customers.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es: Zaida, de 35 años, esta casada con Roy con quien tiene un hijo de 12 años y vive junto a ellos en su casa de material noble , el cual construyo con mucho esfuerzo.El trabajo de Zaida consiste en la venta de golosinas y productos de consumo de preferencia para los niños, razón por la cual posee un pequeño puesto en donde realiza sus ventas, este se encuentra ubicada en el frontis del lavadero de vehículos de sus suegra, su día normalmente comienza a las 8 de la mañana y termina pasada la 6 de la tarde, entre todo este tiempo aprovecha algunos minutos de poca venta para ir a ver a su hijo, quien todavía necesita mucha atención, esta es una de las cosas que le complican en su trabajo, pero también es algo que sabe que pronto podrá superar ya que su niño crece cada día mas.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para realizar otras actividades, a la vez que cuida su puesto de golosinas, lleva 03 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que permanecer bajo el inclemente sol todo el día, espera que con el tiempo pueda poner una tienda donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes.Este será el crédito número 02 con Kiva razón por la cual espera que le puedan brindar el préstamo ya que será un respaldo para seguir aumentando su negocio, esta convencida que seguirá siendo una socia muy puntual y pagara sus cuotas a tiempo .Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles, comprará mas variedad de golosinas tales como caramelos, galletas, chicles, entre otros para poder ofrecer a sus clientes .
texts.en:
Zaida is 35 years old and married to Roy. They have a 12-year-old son who lives with them. The family built and owns its own house made from good materials. Zaida works selling sweets and snacks for children from a small stand located in front of her mother-in-law's car wash. Zaida normally works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. She is able to sneak away during slow times to check on her son, who needs a lot of attention. This can make her work difficult, but it is also something that she knows will improve because her boy is growing more each day. 

What she likes most about her business is that she is able to do other things while she runs her sweets stand at the same time. She has been working like this for three years, and says that hardest part of this work is standing out in the sun all day long. Zaida hopes that in the future she will be able to open a store to better attend to her customers. 

This is Zaida's second Kiva loan. She is requesting a loan in order to keep growing her business. She pledges to remain punctual and make her repayments on time. Zaida will use the 1000 soles to buy a variety of sweets, such as caramels, cookies, gum and other items to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy sweets such as cookies, caramels, etc.

loans.name: Siliver

texts.en: Siliver is 24 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He describes himself as a hard-working man. He is operating a produce business dealing in maize, beans and groundnuts, which he has operated for a period of one year. The business is rural-based. He started it to enable him to get daily income, to provide for a smooth running of his family. He would like to set up business in nearby towns, in the future. Siliver is requesting a loan, to buy beans and maize to resell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to resell.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.en:
This is Cecilio; he previously obtained a 10,000 PHP loan, which he used to buy spare parts and accessories, and to maintain the moto-tricycle unit. His earnings with the moto-tricycle were a big help for the support of his family. 

He would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of 15,000 PHP, to buy spare parts and to maintain the moto-tricycle unit, and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to meet his family's daily needs and pay the educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Cecilio dreams of having another unit of moto-tricycle and hopes that his youngest child will complete their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their moto-tricycle unit, and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna tiene 42 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Su casa está ubicada en un anexo rural y está construida a base de adobe. Cada día, después de atender a sus hijos y esposo, se dirige a sus cultivos, ya que se dedica a la agricultura hace 22 años. Sus principales cultivos constan de maíz y arvejas, para ello cuenta con terrenos que compró gracias a mucho esfuerzo. Pero hay temporadas de siembra que alquila sus terrenos, especialmente en los meses de setiembre, octubre y noviembre , “estos meses las ventas son buenas porque los compradores llegan de distintas partes del país”, menciona. Su esposo la apoya en esta cansada actividad, pero también contrata trabajadores, porque a veces ellos no pueden cubrir con todas las actividades.Éste es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente contenta de recibir un apoyo financiero que le permite continuar con su trabajo y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.En esta oportunidas Reyna solicitará S/.2000 soles para la compra de abono orgánico y semillas de arvejas..
texts.en:
Reyna is 42 years old, is married and has two children. Her house is located in a rural annex and is built from a base of adobe. 

Each day, after attending to her children and husband, she works on her crops because she has been working in agriculture for 22 years. Her main crops consist of corn and peas. For this she relies on land she bought thanks to a lot of effort. But there are planting seasons that she rents her land, especially in the months of September, October and November. "In these months sales are good because the buyers come from different parts of the country," she says. Her husband supports her in this tiring activity, but she also hires workers, because sometimes they can't do all the tasks.

This is her second loan with Kiva and she feels happy to receive financial support that allows her to continue with her work. She promises to be punctual with her repayments. In this instance Reyna will ask for 2000 soles for the purchase of organic fertilizer and pea seeds.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pea seeds.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson, a 31-year-old married father of four children, two of whom attend school, lives in Mabale-Kidda village where he is a farmer as well as a businessman. As a farmer since 2007, Peterson grows passion fruits and tomatoes, and as a businessman, he has a veterinary shop specializing in farm supplies in Mabale-Kidda trading center. Working six days a week, he sells his agricultural products to city traders who usually take them every two weeks.

Peterson hopes to become the leading producer of passion fruits and tomatoes in Mabale, but he has problems with pests and disease which attack the crops, and weather conditions which are unpredictable. He is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his passion fruits and tomatoes.

Peterson, who describes himself as a hardworking man, is shown in the above photo in his passion fruit garden.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 27-year-old, married woman. She has three children. She is a warm woman.  She operates a business, where she sells cereals, clothes and plastic items. She has been involved in this business for seven years, and she employs one staff member. Her business is located at a strategic business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is having problems transporting the cereals.

She will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a solar lamp. Her business goal is to run a wholesale, general store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy a pickup truck, which would aid her in transporting cereals to her business, where they can be resold.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 60 years old and is a single mother with two grown-up children. She has been running her retail shop for a period of about three years with an income of approximately KES 6,000 a month.

This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. and she wants to use it to buy a stock of sugar, cooking oil and detergents.She hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to add a stock of sugar, cooking oil and detergents.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 53 years old and is married to Christine who contributes to the family income. He has been running his motorcycle transport business for the last 12 years with an income of approximately  KES 6,000 a month.

This is his sixth loan from KADET Ltd. and he will use it to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. He hopes to be a wholesaler and expand his motorcycle transport business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona works hard to support her family. Chona is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Chona requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, egg, sugar, soap, noodles, etc..

Chona has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

Chona successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and raising livestock businesses.

In the future, Chona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell like shampoo, spices, egg, sugar, soap and noodles.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a very hard-working and responsible woman. She was born and raised in Tiribe, and is now married. She lives in her own home with her husband and four of her children.

Salama has been working in her goat meat business for more than seven years. She began with only two goats, but today, thanks to her effort and dedication she has 10 goats which she fattens and then resells at a profit. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase two goats, so that she can expand her customer base and earn more income, and meet all the her needs and those of her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase two goats to fatten and resell at a profit.

loans.name: Adanou

texts.fr: Homme de 50ans, Adassou est marié et père de 03 enfants tous scolarisés. Ils sont âgés de 17,14 et 10ans. Il est tradithérapeute.  Ses produits sont connus sur le marché et il les expose dans une baraque. Aidé par 03 personnes, il sollicite un second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des plantes afin de les transformer en médicament pour les patients. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il espère ouvrir d’autres baraques de vente des médicaments et suivre l’éducation des enfants. Il a une ancienneté de 17ans.
texts.en:
Adanou is a 50-year-old married man and the father of three children, all of whom attend school. They are 17, 14 and ten years old. Adanou is a tradipractitioner. He has been practicing for 17 years. His products are well known in the market and he exhibits them in his booth.

Assisted by three people, Adanou is seeking his second loan from WAGES so that he can purchase plants and turn them into medicine for his patients. In the future, he hopes to open more booths to sell his medicine. He also wants to be active in his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase the plants needed to fabricate medicines.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is a hard-working and responsible woman. She is married and has four children. Her spouse is an Overseas Filipino Worker(OFW). Despite her situation as a temporary single parent to her children, still she is able to make her time flexible.

Ma. Cristina's retail store is not yet a stable source of income for her family, because it's still in its first year of operation. With regard to her situation, Ma. Cristina is requesting to borrow additional capital of PHP 5,000. The loan will enable her to buy grocery items to resell in the store, such as sugar, milk, soft drinks, instant noodles, cooking oil, eggs, and assorted biscuits. She hopes that her requested loan amount will be granted, so she could improve her financial stability and secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy grocery inventory for her recently-opened retail store

loans.name: Gatakaa

texts.en:
Gatakaa is a 49-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 14 years to 25 years. She describes herself as a determined and focused woman. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Her business is located at a conducive business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy cereals to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business three times within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after managing to pay back a loan of KES 20,000 successfully.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bungohko in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past two years Sandra has been working hard to manage her retail store, where she sells sugar, flour, rice and others. 

To help expand her business, Sandra has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add capital to her business and buy more items such as sugar, flour, rice and others to sell, and will help Sandra to generate greater profits and save money to pay fees for her siblings. Sandra hopes that in the future she will be able to help the business to grow. 

Sandra is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to add capital to her business and buy more items such as sugar, flour, rice to sell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
This is Sofia. Her previous loan was a big help not just in her business but also in her family. She was able to buy more hogs and feeds thus generating  more income. Piggery is her business for five years now. She and her husband who is a farmer work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to loan to buy additional hogs and feeds needed for her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sofia hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of having a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional hogs and feed.

loans.name: Topista

texts.en: Topista, 53, is a married woman who has 11 children. She resides in Kagadi, Uganda. She operates a produce business, where she sells beans and groundnuts. She has been in business for seven years. She also does farming, to supplement her income. Her dream is to build a permanent house for her family, while her business plan is to own a food store that can sustainably supply the region all year round, despite inadequate capital. Topista intends to use the loan to buy beans and groundnuts to resell.

loans.use: to buy beans and groundnuts to resell.

loans.name: Bint Ndawa

texts.en:
Bint Ndawa is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her mat weaving business. She is requesting the loan to buy materials to make baskets and mats to be able to fill the orders she has received.

The loan will give her business a better profit margin, which will help her to improve her standard of living and that of her children, since she has two of her children who still attend school.

loans.use: To purchase materials to weave mats and baskets.

loans.name: Silivia

texts.en:
Silivia is a married woman and a mother to three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop in the same town, a business she has done for two years. She also earns extra income from selling sugar cane.

She dreams of educating her children to attain degrees as minimum qualification and buy land for farming. Silivia intends to use the loan to buy sugar, soap and general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is 45 years old and married to Stephen, who also contributes to the family's income. She has been a commercial farmer for about 15 years, with an income of approximately KES 10,000 per month.

Rodah was introduced to Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) by a credit officer and she is applying for her first business loan from KADET. She will use the entire amount to buy farm inputs (e.g., fertilizer, insecticides, and some seedlings) and also prepare the land for planting.

Rodah will reinvest the anticipated profits in the business. She hopes to be financially stable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (e.g., fertilizer, insecticides, and some seedlings) and prepare the land for planting.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria runs a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods and commodities to the people in her neighborhood. This is the source of her income. Victoria is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soda, soap and toiletries and other items. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers in her store thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soda, soap and toiletries and other items.

loans.name: Gracilla

texts.en:
Grecilla is 48 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school.
Grecilla is in the agricultural business of buying and selling livestock in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Grecilla requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.
Grecilla has been buying and selling livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further expand her livestock and general store businesses.  She wants to purchase additional livestock to raise and then sell.
In the future, Grecilla would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is 27 years old and married to Dorothy who also contributes to the family’s income. He has been running his business for the last three years with a monthly income of KES 25,000.
This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he will use it to buy more medicines to sell. He hopes to improve his family’s standard of living and have a leading pharmacy in the area.

loans.use: to buy more medicines to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es: Diariamente Fátima de 31 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de Cartagena  tiene el gran desafío de atender las obligaciones derivadas de su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y sus dos pequeños hijos y la responsabilidad de generar ingresos mediante el  comercio de prendas de oro y de plata, actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 5 años, cuando una amiga le estimuló su espíritu empresarial. Fátima tiene una clientela fija a la cual vende de contado y a crédito, anillos, aretes, pulseras y cadenas de oro y de plata y está clientela poco a poco le ha ido refiriendo nuevos compradores, razón por la cual, muchas veces, su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder con oportunidad la demanda de estos artículos. En la actualidad se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, pues necesita invertir en prendas de oro encargadas, con las que planea aumentar su capital y así mismo su liquidez. Su meta más adelante, es tener un local propio donde exhibir sus productos y con ello generar ingresos suficientes, con los cuales contribuir a educar a sus hijos en instituciones de educación superior de mucho prestigio, pues ellos son el motor de su vida y la de su cónyuge. .
texts.en: Fatima, 31, who lives in Cartagena, faces the challenge of attending to her household obligations every day and the responsibility of earning income through selling gold and silver jewelry, an activity she has been doing since five years ago, when a friend awoke her entrepreneurial spirit. Her household is made up of her husband and two small children. She has a stable customer base, to whom she sells on cash and credit. She sells rings, earrings, bracelets, and gold and silver chains. Little by little, her customers have referred new buyers to her, which means that many times she doesn't have enough working capital to meet the demand for these articles. Now she has come to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for a Kiva credit. This is her first financing from the organization. She needs to buy gold jewelry, with which she plans to increase her capital and her liquidity. Her goal in the future is to have her own place to show her products and with this she can have enough income to send her children to very prestigious institutions of higher education. They are the driving force behind her and her husband's lives.

loans.use: to invest in gold jewelry.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Con la meta de mas adelante adquirir una casa propia, Daniel un esposo y padre de familia de 2 hijas de 18 y 22 años, trabaja diariamente desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la 6 de la tarde, por su propia cuenta: él vende mercancía variada, desde hace 3 años, especialmente ropa informal, idea que nació del reconocimiento que hizo de sus habilidades para el desempeño comercial. Con poco capital de trabajo y mucha disciplina inició ofreciendo artículos variados a vecinos y amigos, poco a poco sus esfuerzos dieron fruto, cuando creció su clientela. Hoy muchas veces su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para atender la demanda, porque vende a crédito y requiere mayor liquidéz para ser oportuno con su clientela y continuar sosteniéndose en el mercado. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará bermudas, camisetas, suéteres, y pantalones que han sido solicitados por su clientela, con ello planea reinvertir sus utilidades y ahorrar para poco a poco cumplir cada uno de sus sueños familiares.
texts.en: Daniel, a husband and father of two daughters, ages 18 and 22, works daily from 7 in the morning until 6 in the afternoon, on his own account, with the goal of buying his own home in the future. For three years, he has sold assorted merchandise, especially informal clothing, an idea that came about when he recognized his business capabilities. With a little working capital and a lot of discipline, he started offering assorted garments to neighbors and friends. Little by little, his efforts bore fruit, when his customer base grew. Many times his working capital is not sufficient to meet demand, because he sells on credit and he needs more liquidity to be timely with his customers and keep maintaining himself in the market. This is exactly why he is asking for a Kiva loan. This is his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy shorts, T-shirts, sweaters, and pants that his customers have been asking for. He plans to reinvest his profits and save to achieve each one of his family's dreams little by little.

loans.use: to buy shorts, T-shirts, sweaters, and pants.

loans.name: Luz Estella

texts.es:
Luz Estella a sus 55 años de edad, es una mujer con grandes proyecciones en la vida, por las cuales ha luchado y sigue luchando a fin de convertirlas en una realidad. Con su disciplina a alcanzado grandes logros. Montó un negocio en su residencia dedicado a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar y desde hace nueve meses vende comidas rápidas  los fines de semana. Labora diariamente en compañía con una de sus hermanas quien se encarga de la tienda mientras ella labora en su carro de comidas rápidas.
Su mayor sueño es poder independizar sus negocios de su vivienda y poder generar fuentes de empleo que le permitan beneficiar a otras familias de su localidad.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido para la tienda y el negocio de comidas rápidas, con el fin de incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luz Estella, 55, is a woman with big plans for life, and she has fought and will keep fighting to make them a reality. With her discipline, she has accomplished a lot. She started a business in her home selling basic goods, and for nine months she has sold fast food on weekends. She works daily with one of her sisters, who takes care of the store while she works at her fast food cart. Her greatest dream is to be able to move her businesses out of her home and to be able to create sources of employment that will allow her to benefit other families in her area. Currently she is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her store and her fast food business, with the aim of increasing her sales and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic products and ingredients for fast food.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen es una mujer casada, madre de 6 hijos en las edades e 16 a 30 años. Con el fin de generar ingresos para aumentar el bienestar de su hogar, ella inició su negocio de alquiler de lavadoras y venta de revistas mediante guías especializadas de productos, partiendo de las necesidades de estos servicios y productos, observadas en sus vecinos.  Su meta de crecimiento no se detienen y por eso necesita  comprar 2 lavadoras mas y una impresora para fortalecer su negocio de transcripciones. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante esta inversión planea ampliar un poco más su mercado y ganar más dinero, que beneficien el crecimiento de su negocio.  Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos que han generado referentes en el mimo barrio y en otros sectores de diversas comunidades cercanas. Con su buen servicio reflejado en oportunidad y calidad su negocio captará muy seguramente nuevos clientes que fortalecerán su inversión de credikiva.
texts.en: Carmen is married, and is the mother of six children between the ages of 16 and 30. With the aim of earning income to better her household's wellbeing, she started her business renting washing machines and selling magazines though specialized catalogue guides. She started with the needs for those products and services, which she observed in her neighbors. Her goal for growth does not stop and this is why she needs to buy two more washing machines and a printer to strengthen her transcription business. This is exactly why she is asking for a Kiva loan. This is her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with this loan she plans to expand her market and earn more money, which will benefit the growth of her business. Her main customers are her neighbors, who have made references in the same neighborhood and in other parts of various nearby communities. With her good service reflected in opportunity and quality, her business will gain new customers that will strengthen her Kiva credit investment.

loans.use: to buy two more washing machines and a printer.

loans.name: Garmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Garmaa is 43 years old, and she lives with her husband and three children in a ger, in the Bayanhoshuu area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Olziisaihan, works at a mining company as a driver. Her daughter, Davaajargal, age 20, is a university student. Oyun-Erdene, age 14, and son Gan-Erdene, age 8, go to local schools.

Borrower has been running a small retail store, in a rented place, for six years. She has gained a lot of experience and built close relationships with customers and suppliers over the years. She is now requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to pay her daughter's university tuition. She is a hard-working, optimistic and neat woman.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna has been engaged in clothes trading since 1996. She does this activity in a rented stall, in a market in Sevan. The merchandise she buys from Yerevan Wholesale Market, and then she transports them to Sevan for reselling. Her son helps her in this occupation. With the profit that she earns from her trading business, Susanna meets her family's needs.
