texts.en: Jose is 30 years old and has two children aged 3 and 6.  His business is producing charcoal from tree trunks.  He will use his loan money to build an oven for producing charcoal in large quantities which he will then sell retail.  Jose is a very hard-working and responsible person whose wish is to see his children become professionals and upstanding citizens.  He feels grateful to the institution for the financial support they are providing which allows him to enjoy a better quality of life and improve his business.

loans.use: to build an oven for producing charcoal

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es: El Sr. Ariel tiene 26 años, tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 9 y 6 años,  El Sr. Ariel se dedica a la venta de DVDs de música  en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en su misma casa que está en la zona de Santiago 1,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Ariel va a usar este préstamo para invertir en la compra de un televisor y un equipo de sonido, El Sr. Ariel enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de efectivo para la compra de estos equipos y va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos según la temporada para vender, su deseo para su negocio es crecer más y ayudar a su familia, ya que esta es la actividad con la que mantiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Ariel is 26 and has two children aged 9 and 6. Mr. Ariel sells music DVDs at home, which is located in the Santiago 1 area. This is his first loan with the institution.

Mr. Ariel will use this loan to buy a TV set and a sound system. The lack of cash makes it difficult for him to buy this type of equipment. He will make use of the profits for buying a wider variety of products according to the season. His goals are to help his family and to expand his business, which is his main economic activity.

loans.use: to buy a TV set and a sound system.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: La Sra. Maricela tiene 27 años, ella se dedica al servicio de entretenimiento tiene su salón de billar  que se encuentra ubicado  en la zona Tesorito de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Maricela va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para su  negocio ya que quiere implementar la venta de refrescos para brindar un servicio completo a sus clientes, La Sra. Maricela enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que por la zona existen varios salones de juegos, pero ella no se puede quejar ya que tiene clientela y utilizara los beneficios en la compra de mas mesas de billar  para equipar mas su negocio, La Sra. Maricela es una persona joven y muy trabajadora esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Maricela is 27 years old and owns a pool hall in the Tesorito zone in the city of Santa Cruz. This is her second loan with the organization. She is going to use this loan to buy tables and chairs for her business because she wants to start selling refreshments in order to offer her customers a more complete service. Competition is a challenge for Maricella because there are several game rooms in her area, but she can’t complain because she has customers and this will help her buy more pool tables for her business. She is a young and very hard working person. This is her only source of income for providing for her family. She is happy and thankful for the opportunity she has been given.

loans.use: purchase tables and chairs.

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es: El Sr. Juan tiene 21 años y se dedica a la actividad de la pesca  el vive en una isla Del lago Titicaca, centro turístico del departamento de La Paz donde ofrecen al público  artesanías  de totoras y en lana, la mayoría de los habitantes de esta isla se dedican a la pesca y el turismo, Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Juan va a usar este préstamo para compra de redes para usar en la pesca, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumentar la pesca e incrementar su capital  de trabajo, El Sr. Juan enfrenta retos en su negocio que son tener una mejor producción y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando, El Sr. Juan es una persona muy Trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is 21 years old and works as a fisherman.  He lives on the island of Del Lago Titicaca, a center of tourism in the Department of La Paz.  Handcrafted items made from cattails and wool are offered to the public in this area.  Most of the inhabitants of this island are either fishermen or work in the tourism trade.  

This loan is his first transaction with Emprender.  Sr. Juan will use the loan to buy fishing nets.  His reason for requesting this loan is so that he can increase his fishing business and acquire more operating capital.  Sr. Juan faces challenges in his business, such as having to increase production, so he will utilize the benefits of this loan so that he can keep improving.  He is a hardworking person and is pleased with the opportunity that has been given to him.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Yuly Maritza

texts.es: Yuly de 31 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y su pequeña hija de 4 años en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de la ciudad. Desde hace 10 años, con su tendencia maternal trabajó en un pequeño jardín escolar de su cuñada y adquirió mucha experiencia, que trasladó al municipio de Malambo al llegar a habitarlo, cuando observó que los niños no tenían la alternativa de participar en un jardín infantil, muy importante para la estructura social y de aprendizaje en el  crecimiento en la época de su primera infancia. Desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 11 está atendiendo a niños ofreciéndole calidad en su aprendizaje. Su reconocimiento se ha extendido en el pueblo y su estructura locativa no es apropiada para recibir mas infantes, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual remodelará y ampliará los espacios  educativos para lograr nuevos integrantes en su jardín y desarrollar una actividad formativa que resulte confortable para todos los que allí diariamente concurren.
texts.en:
Yuly is 31 and lives with her husband and small 4-year-old daughter in a metropolitan area of Malambo. For ten years, with her maternal nature she worked in a small preschool run by her sister-in-law and gained a lot of experience.  When she moved to Malambo, she observed that the children did not have the opportunity to participate in preschool, which is very important to children in the first years of life for learning and socialization.

From 8 am to 11 am she attends to the children, offering them a quality educational experience.  She has become well-known in the area, and her classroom is not large enough to receive more children.  This is her reason for seeking a loan through Kiva.  She will use the funds to remodel and expand her space so that she can accept new children into her program.  This will allow her to develop her program further and to have a space that is comfortable for the children who attend every day.

loans.use: to remodel and expand her classroom.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 37 years old. She sells different items such as cooking oil, corn flour, and sugar. With the loan, she wants to buy more rice and cooking oil for sale. 

With the profits from the business, she plans to pay school fees for the children. She is very thankful for the previous loan, which helped to support the education of her children without being chased out.

loans.use: To buy more rice and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is 35 years old. She owns a bar and has been running it for nine years. With the loan, she wants to buy more beers and sodas to sell. The profit from the business will be put toward her savings, with the intention of having a depot for beers in the future. She is making more money now compared to her previous business. She says,"Had it not been for the loan from Kiva, I wouldn't have gained the funds to set up this business."

loans.use: To buy more beers and sodas to sell

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a manufacturer from Vanadzor and lives with his parents, wife, son and daughter. 

Armen has been involved in furniture manufacturing for more than 10 years. Due to his hard work and kind attitude towards people, he has gained many loyal customers. Armen is the only breadwinner in the family, so his work is very important in providing for his family's needs.

Armen has applied for this loan to purchase equipment for making furniture. This loan is very important, as it will make the furniture-making process more efficient. It is very important for Armen to expand his business and ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: To pay for furniture-making equipment

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de Fatima está en su ciclo número 5to., donde ninguna de las 12 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, pero están dentro del segundo tercer nivel del semáforo de eliminación.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Jorgelina, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres. Comenta que con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y todo lo que tiene es fruto de su trabajo y de su sacrificio. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida en su casa, donde tiene todo tipo de productos con los cuales surte a sus vecinos y personas de otros lugares. El sueño de Jorgelina es pode seguir creciendo y el día de mañana poder tener una tienda mas grande.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra vegetales, carnes, legumbres, productos a granel y demás, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The "Virgen de Fatima" group is in its fifth cycle. None of its 12 members are living below the poverty line, but they are within the second and third levels of the "Semáforo" poverty elimination program.

One of the group members is Jorgelina, who was within the third level of poverty in her last survey. She says that with much effort, she is moving forward and everything she has is the fruit of her work and sacrifice. She has a well-stocked store in her house, where she supplies her neighbors and people from other places with many types of products. Jorgelina's dream is to continue growing and to have a larger store in the future.

She is applying for this loan to buy vegetables, meat, legumes, and bulk products, among others. With this help, she will continue working and helping her family as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, legumes, and bulk products, among others.

loans.name: Munkhbayar

texts.en:
Borrower Mr. Munkhbayar is a 32-year-old married man who lives with his wife and 8-year-old daughter in Erdenet city, which is the third largest city in Mongolia. He works at a local mining company and his wife works at a private company while their daughter attends primary school. 

The family's current house requires some renovation. He has already started to work on this housing project, but he needs more materials.  He is requesting a 3,800,000 MNT loan to purchase the necessary materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate his old house.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz Elena estuvo satisfecha con la inversión que hizo de su credikiva pasado, porque aumentó su producción de ajuar para bebe y dio mayor liquidez a su negocio. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante la línea de Kiva, con ella comprará al por mayor y de contado, telas, accesorios rellenos, silicona, estructuras metálicas. Con su credikiva tendrá un fondo de efectivo para hacer compras con mayor flexibilidad y esto la mantiene muy contenta. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje: “Muchos agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Dios los continúe bendiciendo para que me sigan apoyando:”
texts.en:
Elena was satisfied with the investment she made using the funds from her last Kiva loan, since she was able to increase her production of clothing and accessories for babies, and thus achieve greater profits.

She is currently seeking a new loan through Kiva.  She will use the funds to purchase goods at wholesale, such as cloth, stuffed animals, silicon and metal parts.  With her loan she will have a cash fund so that she can have greater flexibility to make purchases, and this makes her very happy.

She sends the following message "Many thanks to Kiva, the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. May God continue to bless you for your continued support."

loans.use: to purchase goods at wholesale, such as cloth, stuffed animals, silicon and metal parts.

loans.name: Victor Alfonso

texts.es:
VICTOR tiene 23 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los familiares en Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

VICTOR es oficial en un bus. Solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta.

El sueño es seguir comprando lo que le hace falta cómo refrigeredor, mesa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es luchar contra culquier problema que se le presente. En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirce con los amigos y familiares.
texts.en:
Victor is 23 years old and single, and doesn't have any children. He lives with his family in Chimbo, province of Bolívar.

Victor is a ticket collector in a bus. He requests the loan in order to purchase a television. With the help of this loan he'll be able to buy the things he's lacking.

His dream is to keep on acquiring the things he lacks, such as a refrigerator and a table. The challenge he faces is fighting any problems that arise. In his free time he enjoys getting together with his friends and relatives.

loans.use: to purchase a television.

loans.name: Ruth Salome

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 39 años de edad su estado civil casada vive con su esposo  tiene 3 hijos vive en la Ciudad de Ventanas en la Provincia de los Ríos.

La V.R.C. 25 de Febrero, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto el Guabito  de la Parroquia Zapatol, Pertenece al Cantón  Ventanas se Dedica a Labores Agrícolas.

Ruth  se dedica al negocio de cacao y la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de animales como gallinas, cerdo. Solicita el crédito para comprar de urea, liquido mata plagas, insecticida. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la agricultura para tener una buena producción. La compra los realiza semanal en Ventanas. 

 El sueño es trabajar para tener un negocio propio. Los desafíos a los que enfrenta es obtener salud. En el  tiempo libre le gusta ver  televisión.
texts.en:
Ruth, 39, is married and lives with her husband.  She has 3 children.  She lives in the city of Ventanas, in the Los Rios province.

The communal bank "25 de Febrero" meets in Recinto El Guabito, located in Zapatol parish in Ventanas canton.  The members work in agriculture.

Ruth grows cocoa, corn, and rice.  She also raises animals such as chickens and pigs.  She is requesting a loan to buy urea, liquid pesticides, and insecticides.

With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy the agricultural supplies she needs to have a good harvest.  She makes her purchases every week in Ventanas.

Ruth's dream is to work toward having her own business.   The main challenge she faces is to achieve good health.  In her free time, Ruth enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy urea, liquid pesticides, and insecticides

loans.name: Evenecer Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Evenecer, está conformado por 9  integrantes, madres solteras con 25 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona de norte del país. Son mujeres que se caracterizan por su responsabilidad, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente ellas no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos, lo cual se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad, por lo tanto luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

La coordinadora del banco comunal es Gloria argentina, gracias a su espíritu de emprendedor y sus ganas de salir adelante es que tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos y gallinas, en pie, negocio que lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar un lote de cerdos que se lo están vendiendo a buen precio. El banco comunal  Evenecer  agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de  escasos y países pobre como Nicaragua para tener un medio de
texts.en:
The communal bank "Evenecer" is made up of 9 members; they are single mothers who are responsible for a total of 25 children.  They are natives of El Sauce, a place that is located in the northern part of the country.  These women are known for their hard work, responsibility, and desire to excel.  Unfortunately, they were not able to attend school because of a lack of financial resources.  They all had to start working from an early age, and so they strive each day to provide a better future for their children.

The coordinator of this group is Gloria Argentina.  Thanks to her enterprising spirit and desire to get ahead, she has a business raising and selling live pigs and chickens. This business is located at her house.  Her goal for this loan is to invest in working capital so that she can buy a lot of pigs that they are selling at a good price.  The communal bank "Evenecer" appreciates the help that the Kiva lenders are providing to low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent means of earning a living.

loans.use: to buy live chickens and pigs to sell

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge de 42 años de edad  Habita en Santo Tomás, un municipio del departamento del Atlántico muy cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí tiene un restaurante y también se dedica al alquiler de silla y mesas para eventos además de la venta de ladrillos. Su negocio inició desde hace 8 años cuando quedó desempleado y decidió generar ingresos independientes vendiendo sopas a las que poco a poco agregó comidas corrientes y desde hace 6 meses empezó los negocios de venta de bloques y alquiler de sillas, para generar ingresos múltiples. La comunidad de Santo Tomás reconoce los negocios de Jorge porque su capacidad de servicio lo ha hecho ganar muchos clientes. Hoy requiere remodelar el local donde se encuentra el restaurante y esta es justamente la razón para acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  materiales de construcción y artículos para remodelar la cubierta del restaurante. Con ello brindará un mayor confort a su clientela que cada día se ensancha y requiere un mejor  servicio.
texts.en: 42-year-old Jorge lives in Santo Tomás, a town in the department of the Atlantic, very close to the city of Barranquilla. There he owns a restaurant and also rents out chairs and tables for events, in addition to selling bricks. He started his business 8 year ago, when he became unemployed. He decided to obtain an independent source of income by selling soups, to which he gradually added meals. Then, six months ago, he started selling bricks and renting out chairs, in order to have multiple income sources. The community of Santo Tomás gives recognition to Jorge's businesses, because his ability to serve has gained him many customers. He currently needs to remodel the venue where his restaurant is located. That's precisely the reason why he requests a Kiva loan, his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it he'll purchase construction supplies and other items so he can repair the roof of the restaurant. By doing that he'll provide more comfort for his clientele, which grows on a daily basis and demands better service.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies and other items in order to repair the roof of the restaurant.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a single gentleman who is 30 years old. Solomon runs a small photo studio business in Kabarnet town. He has been in this business for the last eight years, and makes an average income of KES 45,000 a month. 

Solomon has borrowed his sixth loan of KES 100,000 after successfully paying his previous loan.  With this loan he intends to buy film, photo editing software, photo printing papers and a computer.

With the anticipated profits he intends to expand his business as well as diversify his sources of income by opening a workshop for making picture frames. He will also pay school fees for his siblings who are still young. His future dream is to buy a plot in Kabarnet town to enable him to built rental houses.

loans.use: To purchase film, photo editing software, photo printing papers and a computer.

loans.name: Jeny Isabel

texts.es: Jeny de 45 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 12 y 16 años. Desde hace 4 años dio apertura a su negocio en su propia casa mediante el cual ofrece servicios de internet y llamadas, con el fin de generar ingresos para apoyar los gastos de su hogar. Ella ha ido poco a poco haciendo crecer su negocio, primero tenia una venta de minutos a celulares, al que fue agregando un computador tras otro hasta llegar a tener suficiente reconocimiento en su barrio y generar una clientela que hoy exige el perfeccionamiento de su oferta. En la actualidad está aplicando a un creidkiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará un nuevo computador y productos de papelería que complementen su servicios y generen mayor volumen de ingresos.  Su meta mas adelante es ampliar su local e instalar aire acondicionado, pues el inmenso sol del caribe aumenta el calor y sus clientes deben estar en un ambiente optimo, para lograr su fidelización. Su mayor fortaleza es su dedicación al trabajo, pues con el planea aumentar el bienestar de su familia cada vez mas.
texts.en: 45-year-old Jeny lives with her husband and her two children aged 12 and 16 years. Four years ago she started a business from her own house. She offers internet and call services in order to obtain an income and pay for her household expenses. She has gradually made her business grow. At first she sold cell phone minutes and then gradually added a computer, then another one, until she became sufficiently known in her neighborhood and got a clientele. Her customers currently demand the refinement of her services. She's currently requesting a Kiva loan, her fist loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she'll purchase a new computer and stationery items in order to complement her services and increase her profits. Her goal for the future is to expand her business premises and install an air conditioner, because the huge Caribbean sun increases the heat and her customers need to be in an optimized environment in order to remain loyal. Her biggest strength is her dedication to her work, because that's how she intends to continuously improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer and stationery items.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 24 years old and comes from a small village of Zestaponi district. He lives with his parents, aunt, and grandmother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Avtandil’s mother is a teacher at a local school and earns a monthly income. Avtandil requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Aside from his grandmother's pension and his mother's teaching salary, the only source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milking cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides, they have a plot of agricultural land, where 250 nut trees are grown. Avtandil sells the harvested nuts and the cheese locally, at good prices. But the family's income is hardly enough to provide food for the five-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Recently, Avtandil requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Credo approved his loan request, in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credit, with soft conditions, to the country's rural poor people, who do not have access to other credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.

With the received credit, Avtandil will trade in pottery. He plans to purchase pottery from the wholesalers and then resell it at higher prices. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy pottery from wholesalers, which he will resell at higher prices

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, 51, is married with seven children. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda, and describes himself as a hard-working man. 

For 14 years, William has operated a produce business that deals in maize, beans and groundnuts. He started this rural-based business to earn a daily income for his family. He intends to use this loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

In the future, he would like to set up business in nearby towns.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 19 and lives in the town of Bungohko in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past two years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells sugar, rice milk, and other things. 

To expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items such as sugar, rice milk, etc., which will help Winnie generate greater profits and acquire a plot of land. Winnie hopes that in six years, she will  become a landlord.

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as sugar, rice milk, and others things to sell in her store.

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel, 42, lives with her husband and son in a house in Selenge Province, Mongolia. She gave birth to her son a few months ago. Her husband Erdenebat, 36, works at a mining company as a driver. 

Odgerel has been running her organic vegetable and fruit retail business in a rental space for years. She is now requesting 2,000,000 Mongolian tugrik to purchase more organic vegetables and fruits to sell to local customers. She is a hard-working, responsible woman.

loans.use: to purchase organic vegetables and fruits to sell to local customers

loans.name: Yesid Rafael

texts.es: Yesid de 30 años vende a crédito carnes frías y también productos de perfumería, desde su propia casa ubicada al sur de la ciudad, donde habita con su familia. Inicialmente trabajó como vigilante de una constructora y algún amigo le sugirió dedicarse a la venta de carnes frías apoyándolo con su experiencia, negocio que inició y fortaleció cuando perdió su trabajo de vigilancia. En la actualidad tiene 2 años de haber iniciado y su capital de trabajo ha aumentado, así como los requerimientos de sus pedidos, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un creidikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mortadela, salchichón, chorizo y butifarra, productos que más vende diariamente y  también invertirá en perfumes que le han solicitado clientes especiales de sus marcas preferidas y muy rentables para Yesid. Su meta más adelante es abrir un local al público y comprar su propia vivienda, por eso tiene el desafío de vender más y ahorrar mucho mas.
texts.en:
Yesid, 30 years old, sells cold meats and also perfumes on credit, from his own home located in the south of the city, where he lives with his family. Initially he worked as a security guard for a construction company but a certain friend suggested that he sell cold meats helping him with his undertaking, a business he began and built up when he lost his security job.

It’s been two years since he started and his working capital has increased, as have his purchase order requests. This is the reason for going for a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so that he can buy bologna, salami-like sausage, pork sausage, Catalan sausage, products in daily demand, and also to invest in perfume that has been requested by special clients for their favorite brands and are very profitable for Yesid. His future goal is to open a facility accessible to the public and to buy his own house, so he has the challenge of selling more and saving more.

loans.use: to buy bologna, salami-like sausage, pork sausage, Catalan sausage, and other products.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, 20, is a married woman with two children who resides in Kagadi, Uganda. She operates a produce business selling beans and ground nuts. She has had this business for two years. She farms to supplement her income. 

Esther intends to use her loan to buy more beans and ground nuts to sell.

Her dream is to buy land to grow the crops, and educate her children up to the University.

loans.use: to buy beans and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a cash crop farmer in Kangundo where she plants crops such as maize and beans as well as vegetables to sell. She is 49 years old, married, and has six children. She has been in the farming business for the past 10 years, and it has been profitable.

This is her first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the amount to buy seeds for planting. These include maize and bean seeds. She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children.

Margaret hopes to become a large-scale farmer, sell her produce to other markets, make more income, and be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin, a musician, has been in the music industry for the past nine years. He also produces music for other musicians for extra income.

Justin is 50 years old, married to Jane, who has a green grocery, and they have three children. This will be Justin’s first loan with the Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology. He plans to use the loan to buy stock of compact discs for recording his music.

He anticipates earning more income by selling more of his music and performing in several events. He hopes to improve the quality of his music production as well as sell his music in other towns in the region.

loans.use: To buy more compact discs for recording music.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Yei, South Sudan. She is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 11.  All of them go to school.

Mary runs a restaurant and has been in business for 5 years. She has two employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2000 SSP to purchase meat, sugar and other items. This business is her only source of income.

In five years Mary would like to expand her business and open up a big hotel. Her major challenges are high prices in the market and the low income received from her business. Mary says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items like meat, beans and sugar for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Togsuren

texts.en:
Ms. Togsuren is a 38-year-old widow who lives with her two sons and father in an outer ger district of the city. She supports her family by operating a shoe-sewing business in a rented place. While she operates her business, her father babysits for her children. Her long-term aim is to own a small shoe-selling factory; therefore, she needs to improve her business. She is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT loan to purchase two kinds of sewing machines. 

With these two machines, she can improve her business and make it successful.

loans.use: To purchase two kinds of sewing machines for her business

loans.name: Candida

texts.en:
Candida is a 46-year-old farmer from Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and has two children. Candida helps her husband in tilling their land.

Candida is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her family's farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farm as well as their harvest. In the future, Candida hopes to make their farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 35 years old, married, and has one child. She does poultry farming in Makueni town. She supplies the chicken to various hotels and schools, as well as eggs to retail shops. Naomi has been in this business for 10 years and it has been profitable. She also has a clothes-selling business and this has enabled her to make more income.

This will be Naomi's fifth loan term and she plans to use the loan to buy more chicken feed and more chicks to rear. She also plans to buy broilers for rearing, which she will later sell at a profit. Part of the loan amount will be used to buy more stock of clothes for resale.

In future, Naomi hopes to grow her poultry and clothing businesses and to earn more income and be able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed and chicks to rear and also to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 40-year-old single man with two children, ages 12 and 16. He has been running his agro-vet shop for about three years with an income of approximately 7,000 KES a month.

This is John’s first loan from KADET LTD and he wants to buy veterinary medicines, fertilizer and seedlings to sell in his shop.

John hopes to buy land for his family in the future.

loans.use: to buy veterinary medicines, fertilizer and seedlings to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Stellamaris

texts.en:
Stellamaris runs a money transfer service business and lives in Kangundo, Kenya. She also sells phone credit cards, phone cards and phone accessories, such as batteries and chargers. She is 32 years old and single. She supports her siblings by paying for their education.

Stellamaris established this business four years ago and it has been profitable. This will be her first loan and she plans to add more cash as float to her money transfer business. She also plans to expand her stock of phone accessories to sell in her shop.

She hopes to expand her business by offering a larger variety of phone accessories to customers and thereby increasing her income.

loans.use: To add more cash to her money transfer business and to buy phone accessories to sell.

loans.name: Beltran

texts.en: Beltran earns a living through his motorcycle transport business. He is a married man and and a father of three children. Beltran is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle, such as wheel tires, nuts, bolts and fuel. With this, he will be able to maintain good working conditions, and therefore be able to increase his earnings from it. In the future, Beltran hopes to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle like wheel tires, nuts, bolts and fuel

loans.name: Loyce's Group

texts.en:
Loyce is 24 years old and lives in the town of Bungohko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, with three of them currently in school. For the past two years, Loyce has been working hard to manage her vegetable business, through which she sells vegetables like cabbage and tomatoes. 

To help expand her business, Loyce has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a variety of vegetables, and will help Loyce to generate greater profits and boost her business to increase her income. Loyce hopes that in the future she will be able to put her children through school. 

Loyce is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Luvsantseren

texts.en: Mr. Luvsantseren is 52 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a house in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife, Oyun, age 48, helps her husband to run their family business. Her daughter, Uranchimeg, age 24, works at a mining company. He has been running a household retail business in a rental counter at the local market. He is now starting a butcher shop in a rental counter at the local food market. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of meat products from herders to sell. He is a hardworking, kind, and diligent man.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat products from herders to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, 45, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is single and happy and she manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to provide income for her everyday needs.

Rebecca maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, and supplements through Marikina Shoe Exchange and Ever Green. A customer’s order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers earn as their income. She also retails dish-washing liquid and peanut butter. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  Rebecca earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rebecca is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, and Ever Green supplements. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rebecca hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of good health for her whole family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children and use the rest to buy house building materials

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 25-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be an honest and humble woman. She operates a retail store where she sells undergarments. Her business is located within a slum area, and her primary customers are residents from the slum area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving her business. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy undergarments to sell. Her business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after managing to pay a previous loan of Kes 12,000 successfully.

loans.use: To buy undergarments to sell

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en: Daphrose is 50 years old. She is married with five children who are between 16 and 26 years old. They all go to school. She owns a bar and has been running this business for eight years. She wants the loan to buy more sodas and different beers to sell. The profit from the business will be used to reinvest in it. She has been very lucky since the previous loan, and she has put more money into her business for further expansion.

loans.use: To buy more non-alcoholic and alcoholic drinks to sell

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili is a 33-year-old businesswoman, who lives in Yei. She is married and has four children between the ages of 4 and 11.  All of them go to school.

Lili is engaged in fish selling, and has been in business for five years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SSP to purchase many kinds of fish. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income. Her major challenges include high prices in the market, and low profit in her business.

In five years, Lili would like to have expanded her business. She says she is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan, with the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Libia Esther

texts.es: Con su credikiva anterior Libia dejó de hacer créditos a alto costo y se siente mucho mas tranquila, por la rentabilidad que su financiación le brindó, con ella pudo comprar de contado, en mayor volumen, obtuvo descuentos y ahora está aplicado a un nuevo credikiva, para reinvertir el dinero recuperado de sus cuentas por cobrar y el capital de este crédito, respondiendo a su clientela  que tiene necesidades de adquirir para incorporar una nueva línea. Ella está muy agradecida con Kiva y desea seguir contando con el apoyo de los financiadores del mundo para hacer crecer su negocio trabajando mucho.
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan, Libia stopped working on high cost credit and feels much more relaxed because of the profits the loan has brought her. With the loan she could buy in cash in higher volume, and she gained discounts. Now she is applying for a new Kiva loan to reinvest the money she has regained from her account and the loan capital she gained be responding to her clients, who have a need to acquire goods to make a new line. She is very grateful to Kiva and wants to continue counting on the support of financiers in the world to be able to grow her business with a lot of work.

loans.use: with plastic articles, like bags, straws, plates, forks, and plastic foam products.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 38-year-old woman who is married to Kofi, a 38-year-old trader. They are blessed with two children. Esther belongs to the Nyame Tease group located in Dansoman. She sells fish at the market. 

Esther joined ID Ghana in 2011, and up until now has been doing very well. She has been trading for the past six years. She gets her products from Akosombo and sells to her customers in and around Dansoman. She is very dedicated to her customers.

This is Esther's third loan and she needs an amount of GHS 1,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 28-years-old, married business lady. Her spouse contributes to the family's income. Irene has been running her retail shop for a period of about five years and she earns a monthly income of about KES 25,700.

This is Irene's third loan from KADET Ltd. and she wants to use it to buy stock of cooking oil, soap, and bread for resale. She hopes to be a leading business lady.

loans.use: to buy stock of cooking oil, soap, and bread for resale

loans.name: Eufrocina

texts.en:
This is Eufrocina. She previously received a loan of 12,000 PHP that she used buy more products such as meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. Eufrocina's earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household, and business expenditures. As of now, she also sells different vegetables for additional income.

Eufrocina would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and meet the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Eufrocina dreams of having more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, and vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 33 years old and lives in Sevan, Armenia. She married young and has two children, a 12-year-old son and a 16-year-old daughter. She graduated from secondary school but did not work since her daughter was born soon after her graduation. 
 
The only income for her family was from her husband who worked in the Russian Federation. It was a very hard time for her new family, but Hasmik has overcome her difficulties and today runs her own business.  

Hasmik rents a stall in Sevan Market and resells women’s and men’s clothing. She buys clothes from the wholesale markets in Yerevan twice each month, transports them to Sevan with her husband’s help and resells them in her stall. Hasmik and her husband can now care for their family themselves. She is very happy that her family's life has improved and they save money for the future of her children. Hasmik says that she tries to forget about her hard life in the past and her main aim is her children's future. She is convinced that their dream will come true. 

Hasmik is asking for a loan of 650,000 AMD loan to buy spring and summer seasonal clothing from the wholesale markets to sell in her stall.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Leourb's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Battambang Province’s Ek Phnom district, Leourb is 35 years old and has six children. To support the daily basics in the family, she runs a small grocery stall at home as her main source of income and supplements her income through rice farming and pig-raising. She has been with this business for several years. 

With VisionFund, Loeurb is a third-time borrower who has fully repaid her previous loans. The previous loans helped her earn a decent income and improve her living conditions. Now, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. She and one of her co-borrowers are seeking 1,400,000 KHR, whereas the third group member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, Loeurb will use her loan portion to pay for the reaping fee and to buy pig feed. She hopes to collect her crop yield and sell at a good price so she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for the reaping fee and to buy pig feed
